Description:
Our Company

Changing the world through digital experiences is what Adobe’s all about. We give everyone—from emerging artists to global brands—everything they need to design and deliver exceptional digital experiences! We’re passionate about empowering people to create beautiful and powerful images, videos, and apps, and transform how companies interact with customers across every screen. 

We’re on a mission to hire the very best and are committed to creating exceptional employee experiences where everyone is respected and has access to equal opportunity. We realize that new ideas can come from everywhere in the organization, and we know the next big idea could be yours!

 The Opportunity
Do you want to help define how Marketing and Creative workflows come together with Generative AI for Adobe? Adobe is looking for a Director of Design to join the team and drive the definition and expansion of GenStudio. You will lead a group of passionate and hardworking Experience Designers to define and develop new GenAI powered marketing workflows. Through design, you will bring together powerful capabilities from across Adobe into great end to end experiences for the simplest user and use cases through to supporting studios, creative and marketing professionals in multifaceted campaign delivery.
 Working closely with Product and Engineering executives, you will provide strategic design direction and feedback to the design and engineering teams to uplevel craft, and find resolutions to ambiguous problem spaces. You will tremendously impact the future of collaboration and virality, while helping to define new opportunities to expand the reach of our tools. From the smallest detail, to big-picture concepts, to long-term strategy, our work is put to the test by millions of creative and marketing users across a variety of fields and experience levels every single day.
What you'll Do
Coach and mentor experience designers and experience design leaders, hire and attract top-notch talent to the team, and foster a culture where designers grow, learn and do their best work.
Build a collaborative environment, encourage deep partnership with cross-functional teams, set a high bar for design craft, and define and implement design strategy for redesigns, 1.0s.
Lead the GenStudio teams through strategy, creative direction, and collaboration with product teams and other partners.
Have an impact beyond your direct reporting structure to influence end to end integrations, partner team requirements, and the definition of foundational capabilities to be used by team across Adobe.
Own the articulation and creation of design strategy on a few pivotal initiatives.
Contribute to the product strategy discussions by expressing vivid design visions.
Incite action in cross-functional partners to deliver a better user and business outcomes.
Guide the teams in weekly, monthly, and quarterly product releases
 What you need to succeed
6+ years of equivalent practical experience leading experience designers, managing experience design leaders is a plus.
Experience designing and delivering Enterprise GenAI powered experiences. Enterprise marketing software, AI driven workflow development, storytelling, as well as awareness of current industry trends and tooling are essential.
Understand what it takes to get a product idea to launch to optimize.
Lead empathetically, fostering an inclusive and empowering environment for the design team to do innovative and impactful work!
Embody a learner and mentor mentality; curiosity and ongoing self-education in the field of marketing and GenAI driven systems.
Experience working with executives on ambiguous problems and crafting big picture strategies driven by design.
Excellent oral and written communication skills are a prerequisite. Articulate design strategy through solid, strategic presentations.
Effective facilitation across product-design-engineering teams in early stages of key projects.
Deep expertise in strategic problem framing and solving problems through high design craft.
About Adobe Design
Adobe Design creates tools that amplify the world’s ability to create and communicate. We’re a global team of designers, researchers, prototypers, content strategists, program managers, and more who work across Adobe’s three product lines: Creative Cloud, Document Cloud, and Experience Cloud.
Our compensation reflects the cost of labor across several  U.S. geographic markets, and we pay differently based on those defined markets. The U.S. pay range for this position is $156,200 -- $315,600 annually. Pay within this range varies by work location and may also depend on job-related knowledge, skills, and experience. Your recruiter can share more about the specific salary range for the job location during the hiring process.
At Adobe, for sales roles starting salaries are expressed as total target compensation (TTC = base + commission), and short-term incentives are in the form of sales commission plans.  Non-sales roles starting salaries are expressed as base salary and short-term incentives are in the form of the Annual Incentive Plan (AIP).
In addition, certain roles may be eligible for long-term incentives in the form of a new hire equity award.
Adobe is proud to be an Equal Employment Opportunity and affirmative action employer. We do not discriminate based on gender, race or color, ethnicity or national origin, age, disability, religion, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, veteran status, or any other applicable characteristics protected by law. Learn more.
 Adobe aims to make Adobe.com accessible to any and all users. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation to navigate our website or complete the application process, email accommodations@adobe.com or call (408) 536-3015.
Adobe values a free and open marketplace for all employees and has policies in place to ensure that we do not enter into illegal agreements with other companies to not recruit or hire each other’s employees.

Our Company

Changing the world through digital experiences is what Adobe’s all about. We give everyone—from emerging artists to global brands—everything they need to design and deliver exceptional digital experiences! We’re passionate about empowering people to create beautiful and powerful images, videos, and apps, and transform how companies interact with customers across every screen. 

We’re on a mission to hire the very best and are committed to creating exceptional employee experiences where everyone is respected and has access to equal opportunity. We realize that new ideas can come from everywhere in the organization, and we know the next big idea could be yours!

 Introduction
The Adobe Design Content Strategy (ADCS) team — a mighty group of content strategists, content designers, and UX writers focused on in-product user experience — is looking for a passionate, creative leader to help align, grow, and evolve our practice across Adobe’s ecosystem.
The opportunity
Adobe is in a phase of rapid evolution on many fronts and Adobe Design is at the heart of all of it. Our Content Strategy team is part of a large, centralized design organization that works horizontally across the company. Our team has impact on practically all of Adobe’s product portfolio.
As Director of Content Strategy, you’ll partner closely with leaders from Design, Product, and Engineering to build high-quality experiences at scale across many dozens of products. This role sits at the center of all product development at Adobe and play a key role in building our next generation of products.
What You’ll Do
Create culture. Coach and mentor an amazing team of content strategists with a diverse array of skills, and foster a workplace where everyone can grow, learn, and do their best work.
Grow the team. Represent Adobe’s Content Strategy practice at and beyond Adobe, and you’ll connect with, hire, and attract top-notch talent.
Lead content strategy partnerships. Build a collaborative environment and encourage deep partnerships with many teams and disciplines.
Redefine the bar for quality. Set the standards for content craft, and bring that to your work in defining and implementing content strategy for redesigns, product iterations, and 1.0s.
Influence big-picture product strategy. Directly contribute to high-level strategy decisions with senior leadership, and align your team to meet Adobe’s rapidly evolving content needs.
Collaborate cross-functionally. Partner with a network of leaders and practitioners to deliver better user and business outcomes.
What you’ll bring to the team
As an experienced and thoughtful content designer as well as a deeply empathetic leader, you’ll be helping a brilliant, passionate group of people develop their career and get set up for success while aligning the team’s work to Adobe’s larger goals. You’ll also be forging the way to closer partnerships with other content-focused teams, bringing your talents to create communities of practice and spaces where people can learn and encourage each other.
Must-haves
A 5+ year track record as a content leader and a love for managing, mentoring, or helping content designers grow in their ﬁeld.
Experience leading in and navigating big, complex org structures at large, diverse companies
The ability to present and tell compelling stories, create coalition, and build support
Strong systems thinking and experience applying content design across a sophisticated, interconnected ecosystem
Experience crafting and governing content standards, terminology, and UX writing eﬀorts at a company with digital products
How to apply
To be considered for this role, please submit your resume and portfolio. In your portfolio, we’d like to see a strong writing foundation, and examples of systems-thinking approaches to design. Any stories you have to tell about growing or aligning a team toward that project would be useful and appreciated.
This position is full-time and can be anywhere within the United States. We have oﬀices in San Francisco, San Jose, Seattle, New York in particular. Remote candidates (based in the US) will also be considered.
About Adobe Design 
Adobe Design creates tools that amplify the world’s ability to create and communicate. We’re a global team of designers, researchers, prototypers, content strategists, program managers, and more who work across Adobe’s three product lines: Creative Cloud, Document Cloud, and Experience Cloud.

Job Title: Sr. Director, Product Marketing - Adobe Commerce
Description:
Our Company

Changing the world through digital experiences is what Adobe’s all about. We give everyone—from emerging artists to global brands—everything they need to design and deliver exceptional digital experiences! We’re passionate about empowering people to create beautiful and powerful images, videos, and apps, and transform how companies interact with customers across every screen. 

We’re on a mission to hire the very best and are committed to creating exceptional employee experiences where everyone is respected and has access to equal opportunity. We realize that new ideas can come from everywhere in the organization, and we know the next big idea could be yours!

 The Opportunity
Global ecommerce sales will surpass $3T this year as digital shopping transforms the way customers buy, and businesses operate. Adobe Commerce is on the forefront of this exciting market space, enabling companies to make every moment personal and every experience shoppable.
The Senior Director of Product Marketing for Adobe Commerce is a leadership position responsible for defining and executing the go-to-market strategy. As an expert in the industry, you will use deep customer understanding to lead global product launches field and ecosystem enablement. You will work with the broader product, marketing and field teams to drive focused strategies to execution and winning outcomes. Partner with product management to help define product strategy, establish a winning position that differentiates Adobe in the market.
As an established commerce leader with vision, act as the face of the brand regularly presenting to customers, supporting industry events, and engaging analysts comfortably supporting both business and technical topics.
What you'll do
Be responsible for the segment and marketing plan for Magento Enterprise Commerce.
Market intelligence—be the expert on our buyers, who are they, how they buy and their key buying criteria.
Deeply understand the competitive landscape—be an expert on our competition and how they are positioned.
Understand and document our buyer’s process, including where they get information, and the who, what, when and why behind the decisions they make. Then lead changes to our sales and marketing processes based on what you learn.
Partner with product management and marketing campaign teams to develop product positioning and messaging that resonate with our target buyer personas.
Collaborate with global marketing and campaign teams to translate strategy into execution tactics.
Be an inspiring leader for Adobe Commerce including speaking engagements and written works.
Understand and support our sales channels; train them on the problems we solve for our buyers and users; develop sales plays and external collateral and guide them how and when to use it.
What you need to succeed
A minimum of fifteen years of experience in product marketing, preferably in the enterprise software or SaaS industry.
Strong understanding of the commerce market landscape, including e-commerce platforms, digital marketing, and customer experience at a technology and business level.
Proven track record of successfully launching and market complex software products.
Exceptional strategic thinking and analytical skills, with the ability to translate market insights into actionable business strategies focused on outcomes.
Excellent leadership and team management skills, with the ability to inspire and motivate a team to achieve goals that go beyond expected.
Bachelor's degree in business, marketing, or a related field. MBA is preferred.

We’re passionate about empowering people to create beautiful and powerful images, videos, and apps, and transform how companies interact with customers across every screen. 

We’re on a mission to hire the very best and are committed to creating exceptional employee experiences where everyone is respected and has access to equal opportunity. We realize that new ideas can come from everywhere in the organization, and we know the next big idea could be yours!

 The Opportunity
As a Computer Scientist/Engineer on the Fraud Team, you will be at the forefront of developing and executing an innovative strategy utilizing Artificial Intelligence (AI), Machine Learning (ML), Deep Learning (DL), Natural Language Processing (NLP), Large Language Models (LLM), and Multi-Agent Systems to combat a variety of fraudulent activities. These activities include bot attacks, account takeover (ATO) incidents, phishing schemes, theft, and product misuse.
What you'll Do
In this role, you will tap into your expertise in computational analysis, engineering, and algorithm design to identify and thwart patterns of fraud and abuse. You will be engaged in researching the latest advancements in AI, ML, DL, NLP, LLMs, and multi-agent systems to enhance the robustness of our fraud detection capabilities. Your contributions will be pivotal in developing real-time solutions that protect our users and uphold the integrity of our platform. Collaborating closely with other data scientists, security experts, and software engineers, you will play a key role in fostering a secure digital environment. This position is a unique opportunity to employ ground breaking technologies to address the challenges of online fraud.
What you need to succeed
Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Computer Science, Data Science, Engineering, or a related field.
10 years of experience in Data Science, with substantial experience in AI/ML engineering.
A minimum of 5 years as a people manager
A minimum of 3 years of experience in developing AI, ML, DL, NLP, LLM, and multi-agent algorithms, with a focus on fraud detection and prevention.
Proven track record of successful implementation of AI-based strategies, including LLMs and multi-agent systems, to combat online fraud.
In-depth understanding of online or software fraud activities, including bots, ATOs, phishing, theft, and misuse.
Proficiency in programming languages such as Python, R, Java, or similar, with an emphasis on engineering principles.
Exceptional problem-solving skills and the ability to think critically and innovatively.
Excellent communication and partnership skills for effective multi-functional collaboration.
Commitment to staying updated with the latest research and trends in AI, ML, DL, NLP, cybersecurity, LLMs, and multi-agent systems.
Experience with big data technologies and tools (e.g., Databricks, Hadoop, Spark) is a plus.

Description:

  The Corporate Partnerships team is focused on delivering material growth and market share expansion through strategic product and technology partnerships with responsibility for sourcing, evaluating, negotiating, and implementing partnership deals across Adobe’s Creative Cloud, Document Cloud, and GenAI product groups. As the Director of Strategic Partner Development, you will be responsible for incubating and delivering partnerships across the Digital Media business with leading technology platforms globally. As a senior individual contributor, you will partner closely with product, engineering, product marketing, legal, and executive leadership to implement partner deals aligned with Adobe's critical initiatives.  
 What You'll Do 
Become an essential business thought partner to the Digital Media BU product / eng and product marketing orgs by cultivating deep relationships with exec partners, staying abreast of evolving partner landscapes, communicating untapped opportunities to internal decision-makers, and delivering value to the org through transformational partnerships

Invest in and enable the broader Corporate Partnership team’s success by modeling best-in-class negotiation and partnership development capabilities (including fluency in working on first-of-its kind agreements), driving internal alignment with key stakeholders, and delivering on strategic priorities

15+ years of proven experience in leading key strategic product partnerships in  technology, media, or similar industries 
Ability to influence C-level executives and senior internal stakeholders in a complex, matrixed organization, including balancing competing priorities between external partners and internal teams 
Be a big picture, strategic problem solver who is incessantly seeking creative opportunities to materially impact the business while practically leading a team to deliver results through operational rigor and best practices

We’re on a mission to hire the very best and are committed to creating exceptional employee experiences where everyone is respected and has access to equal opportunity. We realize that new ideas can come from everywhere in the organization, and we know the next big idea could be yours!

 The Opportunity
Behance, the world’s largest creative network, is a community of over 50 million members around the world. We’re laser-focused on empowering our members to share their work, grow their careers, and get paid.
We’re seeking an experienced and passionate Director of Growth to work with Bēhance’s Director of Product and Design to help drive a customer-centric vision to help creators get paid. We are starting with developments in Adobe’s freelance hiring marketplace (be.net/hire) which enables anyone to easily find, connect with, and hire world-class creators. This position will focus on bringing our current freelance hiring offering to market across self-service use cases and eventually to SMB and enterprise hirers, and on launching and scaling a subscription service centered around tools to help our creator community increase and manage their earning opportunities.
As the Director of Growth you will ultimately be responsible for the growth and success of the business. You will be responsible for collaborating with product managers and key business stakeholders to ensure the product is meeting key market needs, create new Go-To-Market pathways, drive strategy and execution for growth (through PLG motions, partnerships, sales, etc.), and ultimately create top of funnel demand that generates business impact highly visible and engaging ways. You will be responsible for measuring growth success and making data-driven decisions to drive and hit overall business metrics and inform future iterations that may generate increased impact.
What you'll Do
Develop a deep understanding of the customer problems that enterprises and SMBs face in hiring freelance designers to advocate for key needs and messages that will resonate with our target personas for Go-To-Market
Advocate for a product roadmap, marketing, content, partnerships, and other requirements for a successful go-to-market for Behance’s Freelance Hiring Marketplace, which balances and prioritizes the needs of both freelancers and employers, as well as B2B value adds
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to develop and implement marketing plans that effectively reach and engage target audiences, ensuring alignment with and utilization of with Adobe's broader brand and marketing strategies and campaigns.
Build a compelling vision to communicate through thought leadership, customer-facing research, customer success stories, and content to support marketing campaigns and other teams telling the story of Adobe’s commitment to helping creators earn income
Lead efforts to optimize Adobe users and Behance members with essential freelance skills and knowledge through learning and educational programs, enabling them to succeed as freelancers.
Conduct market research and analysis to find opportunities for product improvements and enhancements that will drive user engagement and income generation.
Collaborate cross-functionally across Adobe to realize this vision by working hand-in-hand with teams including legal, sales, brand, field and campaign marketing,
Build mutually beneficial partnerships with internal teams like Learn, Higher Education, and Direct-to-Student teams, and CSR/Adobe Foundation to build partnerships and programs that align with employability and job skills initiatives
Analyze the social competitive space to assist the team in understanding how other brands are approaching social marketing and find opportunities to evolve our strategy
Make data-driven decisions to optimize GTM performance and continuously evaluate and refine the customer personas, ensuring that marketing efforts optimally target and resonate with the intended audience.
Work with early adopters and power users to find opportunities for quick iterations and continuous improvements in how we meet their needs and resonate with them authentically
What you need to succeed
A deep understanding of performance marketing, content strategy and analytics. A data driven strategist who has a track record of driving growth marketing programs informed by analytics and results.
Strong understanding of creative development and digital technologies both established and emerging
Strong leadership and collaboration skills, and the ability to influence and steer projects in a matrixed multi-national organisation
Demonstrate technical SEO thought leadership in the company and help educate product, design and development teams on current industry trends and content methodologies
Shown expertise in market research and analysis, enabling data-driven decision-making and the identification of strategic opportunities for product improvement and growth.
Experience in building and cultivating strong internal and external partnerships, collaborating with diverse teams and collaborators to achieve common goals.
Strong budget management and resource allocation skills, ensuring efficient use of resources to enhance the impact of marketing efforts.
Excellent communication and presentation skills, with the ability to convey complex ideas and strategies in a clear and compelling manner to both internal and external audiences.
Experience in creating and implementing go-to-market plans for new product features and enhancements, with a keen understanding of the product development lifecycle.
A passion for Adobe's mission and values, with a commitment to fostering a sense of community, inclusivity, and support within the Adobe Community and Behance platforms.

 The Opportunity
Reporting directly to Adobe’s VP of Marketing Strategy & Global Communications, the Senior Director of Digital Media Communications will lead global communications strategy for our Digital Media (DMe) business, which includes Creative Cloud, Adobe Express, and Document Cloud. The customer focus is on creative professionals, communicators, consumers, SMBs, and students.
This senior leader will be a key partner to DMe leadership inclusive of the DMe President and their global Leadership Team. This strategic role will oversee the vision, development, and execution of end-to-end Communications programs in partnership with cross-functional teams across global comms, marketing, and the GTM (go-to-market) teams. They will lead an industry-leading team to develop communications strategies and program plans aligned with Adobe’s overall GTM and business goals across critical communications, positioning, and messaging, public relations and thought leadership, and internal and executive communications.
As Adobe’s DMe GTM evolves to be more always-on with a focus on earned and owned channels, this is a critical role in shaping the future of communications and Adobe's brand with key audiences and segments.
What You’ll Do
Set the vision for a new approach for DMe comms while partnering closely with executives and business leaders, to accelerate our go-to-market approach across the business.
Architect the integrated, end-to-end communications strategy, programs, and investment recommendations for Adobe's Digital Media business.
Support the development of product positioning and develop strategic narratives to advance Adobe’s awareness and reputation among target audiences.
Scale communications approach and operating model globally, while inspiring and leading a first-rate communications team to deliver on the communications vision and strategy.
Provide frameworks and programmatic support to ensure scale and consistency in execution and outcomes.
What You Need to Succeed
Experience leading teams at scale: executive presence and proven ability to influence and lead cross-functional teams.
Success in high-growth environments: experience creating, executing, and leading global communications in agile, fast-paced environments.
Innovation and creativity: ability to conceptualize and effectively communicate ideas, to improve and chart the next chapter of storytelling.
Modern storytelling approach: Depth in digital communications and the social ecosystem with an understanding of multimedia, visual storytelling, and modern communications platforms.
Experience working in consumer products is highly preferred.

 Job Description
The Challenge
Adobe is looking for an Account Director who is responsible for achieving sales targets through the sale of Adobe’s Digital Marketing product lines. As a part of our enterprise sales team, working with Adobe’s largest customers across Travel and Hospitality. This includes the development of long-term relationships with customers as well as crafting strategic account plans. The Account Director will achieve this through software solution selling capabilities and direct, face-to-face contact with the customer. Responsibilities include building relationships at all levels with a focus on c-suite, and effectively navigating the customer's organization. You will guide and assist customers in achieving a successful start with Adobe and help them expand the value realized from our solution. This is a key role at one of the most respected technology companies in Silicon Valley – and the entire US. Successful candidates will be high energy, data-minded, naturally inquisitive, and tech-savvy individual with prior senior level sales experience. Do you value extraordinary benefits, and one of the best places to work in the world?
What you’ll do
Approach the business strategically and set a multi-year north star vision and strategy for your business grounded in value. Proactively identify and achieve path to sales plan.
Be an innovative and resilient problem solver. Able to bring forward and take the lead on solving ambitious and sophisticated problems that allow Adobe to better serve our customers.
Communicate with customers effectively and persuasively to uncover company-viable solutions from their view.
Build strong executive relationships across multiple fields (CIO, CTO, CMO, CDO).
Identify and gain alignment from customer on compelling business issue to be addressed.
Demonstrate industry expertise, thought leadership, grasp of macro-economic environment and be a trusted advisor.
Articulate the Adobe story, unique value proposition and how Adobe’s solutions align with customer’s vision and solve customer’s business issue (e.g. return on investment of product).
Lead, collaborate and orchestrate Adobe's entire Ecosystem and Partners to drive outcomes. Use Adobe's ecosystem to the fullest potential.
Collaborate to drive consensus and action. Owner and driver of the territory and account strategy and how the ecosystem will support.
Manage large, sophisticated sales processes internally involving legal, deal desk, product marketing, product support& engineering and other Adobe customers.
Identify and lead collaboration with external 3rd parties including tech partners and system integrators.
Meet sales quota and run efficient business
Advance and close sales opportunities - through the successful execution of the sales strategy and roadmap.
Build strong account plans at the beginning of the year and lead regular account planning meetings to keep team aligned.
Follow a well-adapted approach to maintaining a rolling 4Q pipeline. Keep pipeline current and quickly qualify opportunities. Collaborate with support organizations including Marketing, Inside sales, Partners and channels to funnel pipeline into your accounts.
Ideal candidate will have:
Minimum 5 to 7+ years with consistent track record selling solutions to Marketing, IT, and brands or lines of business in large enterprise organizations;
Ability to work effectively in a team environment, effectively partnering with other Adobe teams including Sales, Support, Engineering, Product & Marketing;
Strong understanding of digital experience and the Travel and Hospitality space
Validated Sales Excellence and creative, problem-solving approach

The Global Growth team at Adobe ensures customers achieve success relative to their intent and derive significant membership value, while delivering Adobe shareholder value seen in annual ARR growth and metric performance improvements. We are looking for a passionate operational leader to own strategic ARR driving initiatives for the Digital Media business across Creative & Document Cloud!
You will lead growth in Digital media through key growth business levers: promotional strategy, trial and free customer conversion, add-on/up-sell and customer retention. This role will drive the strategic focus by using data insights as well as the GTM execution in partnership with teams across Adobe.
What You’ll Do
Function as a general manager, optimizing resources with the goals to deliver on annual and quarterly ARR targets
Responsible for Go-To-Market execution and optimization to accelerate conversion, paid member expansion, retention and digital revenue growth
Understand journey for paid and prospect customers and build insights using data to build programs
Collaborate with Product Marketing and Product teams to develop requirements for new technology initiatives that deliver conversion or retention benefit
Partner with key cross-functional teams such as Product, Cloud Tech, Adobe.com, Analytics to resolve and launch new programs
Present to Executive team to gain alignment and agreement on strategy and possible trade-offs
What You Will Bring
Proven experience (10+ years) as GM of a line of business – focused on driving revenue, KPI growth and achieving quarterly/ annual targets
Customer-first orientation, with experience working on B2B products or services
Deep understanding of digital business models and demonstrated impact creating and launching initiatives (products, experiences, tests, etc.) to drive conversion, paid member value expansion and increase customer engagement and retention
Fast learner, to get up to speed on Adobe’s unique marketing channels & funnels
Strong analytical and quantitative skills; ability to use hard data and metrics to back up assumptions and evaluate outcomes
Demonstrated success in fast-paced, complex, and dynamic environments, rapidly anticipating and adapting to shifting priorities
Strong interpersonal skills. Enthusiastic, positive and creative attitude!

Our Company

Changing the world through digital experiences is what Adobe’s all about. We give everyone—from emerging artists to global brands—everything they need to design and deliver exceptional digital experiences! We’re passionate about empowering people to create beautiful and powerful images, videos, and apps, and transform how companies interact with customers across every screen. 

We’re on a mission to hire the very best and are committed to creating exceptional employee experiences where everyone is respected and has access to equal opportunity. We realize that new ideas can come from everywhere in the organization, and we know the next big idea could be yours!

 The Challenge
Adobe is looking for an Account Director who is responsible for achieving sales targets through the sale of Adobe’s Digital Marketing product lines. As a part of our enterprise sales team, working with Adobe’s largest customers across the (add industry) industry. This includes the development of long-term relationships with customers as well as crafting strategic account plans. The Account Director will achieve this through software solution selling capabilities and direct, face-to-face contact with the customer. Responsibilities include building relationships at all levels - prioritizing c-suite, and effectively navigating the customer's organization. You will guide and assist customers in achieving a successful start with Adobe and help them expand the value realized from our solution. This is a key role at one of the most respected technology companies in Silicon Valley – and the entire US. Successful candidates will be high energy, data-minded, naturally inquisitive, and tech-savvy individual with prior senior level sales experience. Do you value extraordinary benefits, and one of the best places to work in the world?
What you’ll do
Act as the CEO of your Business, crafting a multi-year strategic vision focused on tangible value realization and sales excellence.
Proactively identify and establish cross-functional executive relationships (CIO, CTO, CMO, CDO) with alignment on business use cases and measurable outputs.
Communicate with customers effectively and persuasively leveraging the Adobe story to align offerings with the client’s vision, addressing specific business challenges and measurable impact (e.g. return on investment of product).
Position yourself as a trusted advisor through demonstration of industry expertise, thought leadership, and understanding of macro-economic trends.
Excel as a resilient and innovative problem solver, leading teams through the resolution of ambitious and sophisticated digital marketing challenges with tangible, value-driven results.
Lead, collaborate, orchestrate, and leverage Adobe's entire Ecosystem and Partner network to drive account strategy and resulting measurable outcomes.
Manage sophisticated sales processes, coordinating with legal, deal desk, product marketing, product support & engineering and other Adobe customers.
Identify and lead collaboration with external 3rd parties including tech partners and system integrators.
Achieve the primary goal of driving value realization will also supporting the secondary goal of achieving sales targets through the successful execution of the account strategy and customer journey.
Develop strong account plans with a focus on adoption/value realization and lead regular account planning meetings to ensure alignment through varied market conditions.
Lead and drive all available ecosystem support to ensure the clients adoption of solutions is aligned to strategic goals for the account.
Ideal candidate will have:
Minimum 5 to 7+ years with consistent track record selling solutions to Marketing, IT, and brands or lines of business in large enterprise organizations.
Minimum of 5 to 7+ years of experience with Value Realization methodologies, with primary focus on driving Value conversations across large enterprise organizations.
Team player, adept at partnering effectively in a team environment, inclusive of other Adobe teams (Sales, Support, Engineering, Product & Marketing, Customer Success, etc.)
Strong grasp of digital experience technologies and SaaS within the High Tech space;
Demonstrated Sales Excellence and creative, problem-solving mindset

Our Company

Changing the world through digital experiences is what Adobe’s all about.  The challenge
Adobe Digital Experience is seeking a hardworking expert and technically adept sales professional to join our sales team in the US. The role entails a blend of new business development, as well as the daily activities associated with corporate strategic selling to a few accounts. In addition, you can expect to be working with the existing sales team to lead all aspects of the sales cycle; from the qualification of opportunities, development of a market strategy, coordination of all sales team resources, final negotiation, and closing of business.
Ideally, we are seeking individuals with experience selling Digital Experience Solutions with a proven track record of selling to large enterprises in North America. This position reports to the AVP, Strategic Accounts. If you are passionate about what you do, have an entrepreneurial flair, and are excited by innovative online marketing technology, we want to hear from you!
What you’ll do
We are looking for you to exceed quota targets;
Sales strategies - You will develop effective and specific account plans to ensure revenue target delivery and balanced growth. Develop relationships with existing customers and drive strategy throughout the organization;
Trusted advisor - You will establish strong relationships based on knowledge of customer requirements and dedication to value (value of counsel and expertise, value of solutions, value of implementation expertise);
Customer Research - You will actively understand each customer's technology footprint, strategic growth plans, technology strategy and the competitive landscape. Review public information (e.g. new executive appointments, earnings statements, press releases) for the company and its competitors to remain updated on key industry trends and issues impacting the customer;
Territory and Account Leadership - You will lead account relationships, prospect profiling, and sales cycles. Inspire all accounts to become Adobe references;
Business Planning – Develop and deliver a comprehensive business plan to address customers' priorities and business issues. Apply Strategic Value Assessments, benchmarking and return on investment data to support the customer’s decision process;
Pipeline planning - Follow a focused approach to maintaining a rolling 4Q pipeline. Keep pipeline current;
Pipeline partnerships – Collaborate with support organizations including Marketing, Inside sales, Partners, and channels to funnel pipeline into the assigned territory.
Adobe Solutions – Be proficient in and bring all Adobe offers to bear on sales pursuits;
Advance and close sales opportunities - through the successful execution of the sales strategy and roadmap;
Support all Adobe promotions and events in the territory.
What you'll need to succeed
A minimum of 5 years prior experience in selling digital marketing solutions
E-Commerce and SaaS Sales is a plus
Carried a personal annual target of at least $3.5M USD
Consistent record of achieving/exceeding sales quota and market share goals
Shown success in selling to executives, VP and/or "C" level executives
Able to identify, nurture and close deals in new areas
Technically adept, skilled solution seller with proven ability to create outcomes where everybody wins
Excellent communication, presentation, and negotiation skills
Collaborative teammate with excellent organizational and time management skills
Practical knowledge in developing GTM plans between enterprise organizations
An understanding of the competition and how we are positioned against them
A creative, problem-solving approach to evolving business challenges
Competence and influencing strategies for leading teams in highly matrixed organizations

Our Company

We’re passionate about empowering people to create beautiful and powerful images, videos, and apps, and transform how companies interact with customers across every screen. 

We’re on a mission to hire the very best and are committed to creating exceptional employee experiences where everyone is respected and has access to equal opportunity. We realize that new ideas can come from everywhere in the organization, and we know the next big idea could be yours!

 The Opportunity
Adobe is driving our next phase of growth by building deep and dynamic partnerships with our most strategic enterprise accounts. We are investing our best thinking and resources to help our clients reinvent their customer & employee experiences, rationalize their business operations and technologies, and accelerate their rate of innovation to meet future challenges!
We are looking for an adaptive and highly collaborative industry executive to lead one of Adobe’s largest global accounts. The Global Account Director (GAD), will have responsibility for coordinating efforts across all aspects of the Adobe Digital Experience and Digital Media lines of business. You are accountable for achieving growth targets in addition to ensuring customer satisfaction and product adoption as value realization is a top priority for the business.
What you'll Do
Establish and lead 3+ year joint account strategy and roadmap with the assigned account
Define and build an effective joint governance model ensuring alignment and sponsorship across the account
Develop and maintain strategic relationships with customer and Adobe executives to support priority initiatives and long-term account growth
Lead the communications of business performance and associated value to the business and IT team members
Drive the adoption of Adobe products and innovations within the account through thoughtful development of business cases that map back to customer priorities and the detailed strategy
Grow revenues across the business (software, services, and support)
Lead and mentor a global account team of 20+ people with a goal of ensuring the customer is realizing value from their investment in Adobe
Orchestrate the account life cycle globally from vision setting and strategy development through sales and post-sales implementation, and ultimately consumption
Establish an account-specific framework to identify, evaluate, and complete opportunities to co-innovate in order to address emerging market needs
Coordinate critical customer-facing activities including executive engagement, company visits, briefings, and ideation workshops
Ideate with, and support, Adobe marketing functions to drive engagement and events for the account
What you need to succeed
Successful engagement will be defined by long-term retention of the base, growth in global revenues, increasing customer satisfaction, and successful execution of co-innovation initiatives.
Relevant industry expertise demonstrated through thought leadership
Deep experience in both the Software and Services business models either directly or through the partner channel with the confirmed ability to structure and negotiate large, multi-faceted agreements
Experience leading teams of at least 10 people across multiple regions on sophisticated accounts with executive relationships
Proven success leading and delivering on enterprise engagements either internal or through a consultancy
A background in enterprise transformation and change management with referenceable supporting examples
Experience leading successful digital transformations for marketing organizations paired with knowledge of the technologies and tactics needed to effectively perform
Deep knowledge of digital transformation trends in the industry and Adobe’s position relative to those trends
Experience in developing and driving adherence to a multi-layered governance model supporting multiple business functions and IT with engagement across executives, management, steering committees, and PMO functions
Practical knowledge in developing GTM plans between enterprise organizations
An understanding of the competition and how we are positioned against them
A creative, problem-solving approach to evolving business challenges
Competence and influencing strategies for leading teams in highly matrixed organizations
Job Requirements
10+ years of validated experience in the professional services industry
Past agency experience is a huge plus
Minimum 10 years of solution sales to Marketing, IT, and LOB with a consistent track record of performance
5+ years of proven track record directly leading a successful team of at least 5-10 people
Outstanding executive presence and presentation skills, with the ability to converse with, encourage and engage C-level executives
Exceptional written communication and analytical skills
Ability to work optimally in a team setting, acting as a liaison with all other organizations within Adobe including Sales, Services, Support, Product & Marketing
Strong understanding of existing and emerging marketing technologies
Willingness to travel up to 25% (post-pandemic)

 The Opportunity
Adobe seeks its next Director of Corporate Communications. The corporate communications team drives and protects Adobe’s corporate reputation globally, helping our stakeholders better understand our technology and impact. This fast-paced, highly visible team is responsible for external communications centered around business and financial performance, ethical innovation and public policy, purpose and diversity & inclusion. We are a thoughtful and forward-thinking team of communicators who are passionate about storytelling.
This highly visible leadership role will develop integrated communications strategies and program plans, including positioning, messaging, public relations, thought leadership and more. The ideal candidate will have a history of impactful corporate communications experience and thrive in a dynamic environment that requires a strong point-of-view and savvy for high-stakes issues.
What you'll Do
PR Strategy: Be responsible for the vision, development and execution of communication programs in partnership with cross-functional teams across global communications and the business. This includes strategies for moments such as earnings, M&As, and crisis, among others. Work with a wider team to drive an always-on communications program and a proactive storytelling program.
Stakeholder Management: Serve as a trusted advisor to Adobe’s leadership team. Build and partner with external press and influencers to drive Adobe’s agenda. Coordinate with various internal (social, employee communications) and global teams to further amplify content and/or news. Ability to influence and inspire change across the company in a significant way.
Thought Leadership: Drive consistency in all corporate messaging; advance Adobe's corporate narrative that educates key partners (customers, investors, employees, and policymakers) on Adobe’s point of view, products and policies across all channels, including press, digital, events and analyst relations.
Innovative Storytelling: Accelerate Adobe’s media momentum through innovative storytelling efforts across traditional and new channels. Adopt multimedia and cross-channel strategies to breakthrough among key audiences.
Practices & Processes: Build best-of-class communications practices and processes that will drive efficiencies in how Adobe’s communications team operates.
What you need to succeed
Executive presence and shown ability to influence and lead cross-functional teams, ideally in a ground-breaking technology space
Ability to move between strategy and execution easily
Experience and passion for rapid response and crisis communications, including shaping complicated stories
Dedication to the news cycle and fast-paced communications cycle
Expertise in both traditional and emerging media and channels
Innovative thinking, not afraid to take risks and push Adobe in new directions
Exceptional communication capabilities, both written and verbal, with the ability to articulate nuanced issues, strategies, and briefs clearly
Inherent curiosity, with an appetite for an exciting opportunity on a fun, collaborative team
12–15 years of relevant work experience

The Opportunity  
 Frame.io enables next generation creative collaboration through one centralized hub; allowing customers to share media, track feedback, and streamline their workflow from anywhere in the world. We are looking for a Senior Director of Product Management to develop our product vision, drive execution, and continue our mission of developing the standard cloud operating system that centralizes creators with their content, collaborators, and audience.
What you’ll do
Develop, mentor and build a world class product management team
Partner closely with our product, design, engineering, marketing, and go to market teams to ensure we are developing and delivering a world class product for our customers at the right moments in time
Leverage our data, analytics and research teams to optimize the teams efforts, uncover insights and improve user experiences
Represent our team and products with customers, partners, and executives both inside and outside of Adobe
Collaborate with cross-functional product leaders across Adobe and maintain a consistent integration roadmap aligned with teams closely connected to Frame.io
Tackle complex problems and accelerate delivery across our business
What you'll need to succeed
Proven experience of 10+ years leading high performing teams of product managers in a rapidly scaling environment with a deep customer centric focus
Enterprise level SaaS industry experience, experience launching a collaboration product highly desired
Inherently collaborative nature and bias toward partnership. Demonstrated experience working in a matrix environment at scale
A sense of urgency and the ability to act quickly and decisively with a data-driven mindset
Experience developing individual product managers across a range of career stages and skills
Eagerness to plan for the long term while maintaining execution focus in the short term
Knowledge/interest/passion of the video and/or photography editing a plus
At Adobe, you will be immersed in an exceptional work environment that is recognized around the world! You will also be surrounded by colleagues who are committed to helping each other grow through our unique Check-In approach where ongoing feedback flows freely. Our Company

Changing the world through digital experiences is what Adobe’s all about. We give everyone—from emerging artists to global brands—everything they need to design and deliver exceptional digital experiences! We’re passionate about empowering people to create beautiful and powerful images, videos, and apps, and transform how companies interact with customers across every screen. 

We’re on a mission to hire the very best and are committed to creating exceptional employee experiences where everyone is respected and has access to equal opportunity. We realize that new ideas can come from everywhere in the organization, and we know the next big idea could be yours!

 The Opportunity 
We are looking for a dynamic leader to help drive the strategy, thought leadership, and positioning to grow our Financial Services segment.  As the Industry Strategy Director, you will develop compelling and prescriptive thought leadership and present it to prospects at industry & Adobe conferences/events and 1:1 customer meetings with SVP levels and above.  You will partner with a diverse ecosystem of sales, product management, and solution consulting to bolster our industry value proposition and drive a coordinated go-to-market strategy.  As an ambassador for Adobe in the Financial Services industry, you will also partner with Adobe marketing to drive awareness of Adobe’s capabilities. 
Key Responsibilities 
Develop Adobe’s point-of-view for Financial Services: 
Build a vision and competitive positioning for the industry that resonates with Financial Services executives. This will address, for example, what are the major capabilities and use cases Adobe’s Experience Cloud enables – from customer data & analytics, advanced omnichannel personalization, cross-channel journey orchestration, creative content production, and unified measurement.  It should also address what does "amazing" look like for an omnichannel experience & customer journey, and what tactics are needed for banks, insurers, wealth and asset management companies to maximize the return from their digital programs.  You will have opportunities to collaborate with digital strategists, technologists, data scientists, and other specialists to craft a powerful point-of-view. 
Drive a coordinated strategy to grow the business:   
The Adobe Financial Services community extends across sales, marketing, pre-sales, customer success, product, professional services, and our partners. You will monitor the performance of the overall Americas business and drive long-term growth by orchestrating our strategy across functions. Typical activities include: working with sales leaders on go-to-market planning, partnering with marketing teams to amplify our industry messaging, enabling the field on how to position our capabilities to retailers, influencing product/engineering teams to ensure advanced Retail capabilities/use cases are on our product roadmap, and aligning with partners on delivery of industry solutions.
Engage with senior executives as a thought leader: 
You will develop and present compelling thought leadership to senior executives in customer meetings, CxO roundtables, Adobe conferences, and industry events (e.g., Money2020). This is a role for someone who enjoys building C-level relationships, opening new doors, speaking at conferences, and advising business leaders on how to achieve success in their omnichannel transformation programs. 
What you need to succeed  
Your success is measured by driving growth in Adobe’s Financial Services vertical by setting the vision for digital transformation in the space, and by positioning Adobe as a key strategic partner in this process. 
Experience in Financial Services, either client-side or as a trusted adviser, with specific focus in digital, marketing, omnichannel personalization, customer data & analytics, and creative production (10+ years).  
Experience leading successful programs for omnichannel transformation, along with an understanding of strategies, operational tactics, and technologies needed to execute at scale  
Entrepreneurial approach to finding new growth levers for the business.  
Experience in the effective use and deployment of data for designing and managing products for measurement, collection, integration, segmentation, experience activation and monetization. 
Outstanding executive presence and presentation skills, with the ability to inspire and engage senior level executives
Highly collaborative with ability to lead through influence in a matrixed environment.  
Exceptional written communication including interest in authoring thought-provoking points-of-view and conducting customer and market research.  
Outstanding problem solving and analytical skills including talent for conducting research, analyzing data, developing hypotheses, and synthesizing recommendations.  
Willingness to travel up to 33% (post-COVID)

Job Title: Vice President, Americas Marketing Digital Experience
Description:
Our Company

Changing the world through digital experiences is what Adobe’s all about. We give everyone—from emerging artists to global brands—everything they need to design and deliver exceptional digital experiences! We’re passionate about empowering people to create beautiful and powerful images, videos, and apps, and transform how companies interact with customers across every screen. 

We’re on a mission to hire the very best and are committed to creating exceptional employee experiences where everyone is respected and has access to equal opportunity. We realize that new ideas can come from everywhere in the organization, and we know the next big idea could be yours!

 Our Company
Changing the world through digital experiences is what Adobe’s all about. We give everyone—from emerging artists to global brands—everything they need to design and deliver exceptional digital experiences. We’re passionate about empowering people to craft beautiful and powerful images, videos, and apps, and transform how companies interact with customers across every screen.
We’re on a mission to hire the very best and are committed to building exceptional employee experiences where everyone is respected and has access to equal opportunity. We realize that new ideas can come from everywhere in the organization, and we know the next big idea could be yours!
The Opportunity
Reporting directly to the SVP & CMO of Adobe’s Digital Experience (DX) business, this executive will be responsible for leading marketing for the Digital Experience business in the Americas. This executive will lead a team, and work closely with a cross-functional team across Global Marketing, Worldwide Field Operations, and the DX Product Marketing to develop marketing strategies and campaign plans aligned with Adobe’s overall go-to–market and revenue goals.
This executive will lead the execution and measurement of digital and field marketing programs in partnership with functional teams within the Global Centers of Excellence (AR, PR, Social, Campaign/Content, Business Development) and the Regional counterparts (in EMEA, APAC and Japan) with an emphasis on account-based marketing and demand generation.
What You’ll Do
Lead a team of 100+ across America's demand generation, field marketing, account-based marketing, executive marketing, and partner marketing for all GTM efforts for the DX business.
Spearhead innovative marketing and passionate evangelism that is grounded in a compelling vision, clearly defined priorities, and measurable business results that are aligned with Adobe's strategy.
Own all execution/operational results in the Americas (US, Canada, and Latin America) in addition to collaborating across global enterprise marketing functions. Leverage thought leadership to establish Adobe as the Leader in Digital Experiences & key industry categories, including Content, Data, and GenAI.
Partner with finance to define and track data and insights around acquisition and customer retention, consistently balancing both short and long-term results.
Build strong cross-functional alignment to drive strategies and success with field sales, customer success, services, and product marketing teams.
Provide ongoing guidance and programmatic support to regional marketing organizations to drive growth.
Showcase for “Adobe on Adobe” – act as customer zero for Adobe’s best-in-class products and provide feedback to product development teams.
Inspire, empower, and develop a hard-working team; optimize organizational structure and staff as required.
What You Need to Succeed
Experience leading global teams in a matrixed environment with a data-driven approach.
Extensive leadership experience in enterprise technology and cloud-centric industries; scale and sophistication of a large global business.
A track record of success as an innovator and marketing strategist with 15 or more years of diverse experience in the technology industry.
Demonstrated experience leading and growing a successful SaaS marketing organization of large scope, global reach, and complexity.
Confirmed experience driving marketing strategy and programs (thought leadership, demand generation) at scale.
Depth of knowledge and experience effectively crafting and running demand generation strategies, working closely with Sales and Product Marketing leadership.
Steadfast focus on the customer experience.
Deep understanding of marketing's role in delivering time-to-value as well as topline revenue.
At Adobe, you will be immersed in an exceptional work environment that is recognized throughout the world on Best Companies lists. You will also be surrounded by colleagues who are committed to helping each other grow through our unique Check-In approach where ongoing feedback flows freely.

Job Title: Vice President of Product and Software Security
Description:
Our Company

Changing the world through digital experiences is what Adobe’s all about. We give everyone—from emerging artists to global brands—everything they need to design and deliver exceptional digital experiences! We’re passionate about empowering people to create beautiful and powerful images, videos, and apps, and transform how companies interact with customers across every screen. 

We’re on a mission to hire the very best and are committed to creating exceptional employee experiences where everyone is respected and has access to equal opportunity. We realize that new ideas can come from everywhere in the organization, and we know the next big idea could be yours!

 The Opportunity 
 Are you an expert with guiding large, sophisticated software development for SaaS organizations with developing secure code? Do you have experience leading a global and multi-disciplinary organization focused on building the most secure products? We’re looking for you to join Adobe as our Vice President, Product and Software Security. 
 In this role, which reports directly to the Chief Security Officer, you’ll lead our global Product and Software Security organization, which partners with product development teams, our core infrastructure teams, and our customers, to make sure Security is integrated by default into all of Adobe’s products.  In addition, you’ll build tight partnerships with the leadership of our Product Development organizations to achieve your goals.  Your team will get to partner with engineering leaders across our complete spectrum of products, including new initiatives such as our Generative AI efforts.
 What you'll Do 
 Develop a high-performing organization that will scale as Adobe grows:  
Collaborate with Adobe developers to create more secure code 
Identify security vulnerabilities in our products and address them 
Reduce friction in the software development pipelines while improving security guardrails 
Partner with Product Engineering leadership to help highlight the security risks in products, and balance this against business benefit. 
Build the vision and roadmap for efforts to validate the security of our code and products 
Help develop the roadmap of security features across all of Adobe’s products 
Grow and hire the strongest product security talent in the industry 
Take an adversary perspective on how our products can be misused and identify reasonable countermeasures for the next generation of security threats. 
 What you need to succeed 
 10+ years in Information Security, most of which in a complex, global organization 
8+ years of progressive leadership experience in application security 
Ability to build strong rapport with business leaders, engineering leaders and customers 
Be an expert on product security, and be able to explain technical concepts in understandable ways to business leadership and our customers 
Successful track record growing talent and building high performing security teams 
Strong problem-solving skills, analytical capability and a pragmatic approach to business 
Strong communications skills  
Comfort with ambiguity

Job Title: Director of Machine Learning, Firefly Services
Description:
Our Company

Changing the world through digital experiences is what Adobe’s all about. We give everyone—from emerging artists to global brands—everything they need to design and deliver exceptional digital experiences! We’re passionate about empowering people to create beautiful and powerful images, videos, and apps, and transform how companies interact with customers across every screen. 

We’re on a mission to hire the very best and are committed to creating exceptional employee experiences where everyone is respected and has access to equal opportunity. We realize that new ideas can come from everywhere in the organization, and we know the next big idea could be yours!

 The Opportunity 
We're looking for a world-class AI cloud services leader to lead our generative AI app integrations roadmap. Adobe Firefly services power generative AI features and experiences in a variety of applications like Generative Fill in Photoshop, Text to Vector in Illustrator, Text to Template in Express, Text to Image in multiple apps. In future, these services will power newer modalities like audio, video, 3D and multi-modal capabilities.
You will lead the US and global engineering teams focused on building Firefly pipelines and services to power generative features in Adobe’s apps/surfaces. Your goal will be to increase the velocity at which generative AI features are built and deployed and to implement a scalable process that multiplies Adobe’s generative AI capabilities surfaced in our products. You will also be responsible for operating high traffic GPU intensive pipelines for these generative workloads.
What You'll Do 
Engage with Applied Research (and Research) groups and product teams like Photoshop, Illustrator, Express, and others to build an ambitious roadmap and plan to deliver end-to-end machine learning solutions that will power innovative new features in our flagship applications
Work with product management leadership and other key stakeholders to define the generative AI feature strategy and secure executive buy in
Partner with various platform teams to leverage existing inference systems or define new required enhancements to support new modalities (video, streaming, etc)
Lead planning and delivery of GPU optimized, efficient model pipelines for new Firefly features serving a variety of modalities like images, vectors, 3D, etc.
Grow and scale the process and global teams with a goal to increase the velocity of AI feature capability manifold.
Ensure the delivery of a scalable, reliable cloud service with observability, logging and tracing to enable quick detection, understanding and resolution of run-time issues
What You’ll Need to Succeed 
A minimum of twelve years of industry experience, including atleast five years of engineering leadership.
A deep understanding of AI/ML, including ML frameworks, public cloud and commercial AI/ML solutions - familiarity with Pytorch, SageMaker, HuggingFace is required.
Image Processing, Computer Vision, Generative AI experience is strongly preferred
Atleast five years of AI/ML experience.
Knowledge about creation and optimization as well as operation of GPU intensive ML workloads in production environments
Understanding of model serving, orchestration, scaling and GPU resource management
A track record of attracting talent and leading multiple high-performance teams to deliver results in a fast-paced and dynamic environment of AI infrastructure
Strong communication and collaboration skills - building strong relationships with internal stakeholders and external partners
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with the ability to think strategically and make data-driven decisions
A passion for staying up to date with the latest trends and technologies in AI/ML - in the cloud and on device
A Bachelor's, Master's in Computer Science, Electrical Engineering, Computer Vision, or a related field, or equivalent industry experience
#FireflyGenAI

Our Company

Changing the world through digital experiences is what Adobe’s all about. We give everyone—from emerging artists to global brands—everything they need to design and deliver exceptional digital experiences! We’re passionate about empowering people to create beautiful and powerful images, videos, and apps, and transform how companies interact with customers across every screen. 

We’re on a mission to hire the very best and are committed to creating exceptional employee experiences where everyone is respected and has access to equal opportunity. We realize that new ideas can come from everywhere in the organization, and we know the next big idea could be yours!

 At Adobe, we’re changing the world. How? We give people the tools to bring their ideas to life and create content that makes life more fun and work more meaningful. We give businesses and organizations the power to truly engage their customers. We’re the ones behind the gorgeously designed content that streams across your laptop, TV, phone, and tablet every day—and we’re the ones who harness the massive power of big data to help companies move from data to insight and insight to action by delivering content that people crave most.
The Opportunity
We are applying innovative AI and ML technologies to power digital businesses, helping companies design and deliver personalized experiences to their customers.
Customer AI in Adobe Real-time Customer Data Platform (RTCDP) and Adobe Mix Modeler (AMM) are two notable examples. Customer AI enables marketers to generate individual level scores for a specific outcome such as conversions or churn. Customer AI predictions and insights enable personalizing customer experiences by serving the most appropriate offers and messaging. AMM is bringing measurement and planning together using both a bottom-up and top-down machine learning service framework. With AMM, customers can now forecast, focus, and target resources for future campaigns more effectively.
We are looking for an exceptional leader to evolve our strategy and execution of applying AI/ML technologies across various areas, including personalization, measurement, and planning.
What you'll Do
Hire, lead, and mentor a diverse engineering team of world-class ML engineers, data scientists and software engineers to build and enhance RTCDP and AMM services powered by AI/ML technologies.
Establish strong partnerships with cross-functional teams including product management and design to drive product vision, roadmap, and business strategy.
Drive all aspects of ML product development and software engineering lifecycle including ML modeling, data/ML pipelines, quality evaluations, API integration, and ML Ops.
Create and instill a team culture that focuses on sound scientific processes and encourages deep engagement with our customers.
Create an engineering culture that supports innovation and creativity while delivering high quality products with predictability and reliability.
Handle project scope and risks with data, analytics and creative problem solving.
Ensure engineering excellence and rigor in architecture, execution, and delivery.
What you need to succeed
A minimum of ten years of technical leadership experience in applying AI/ML techniques to build ML features/products.
Proven record of leading and managing engineering teams and fostering an innovative and collaborative environment.
Track record of delivering cloud-scale, data-driven products and services that are widely adopted with large customer bases.
A relentless pursuit of great customer experiences and continuous improvements to the product.
Strong interpersonal, analytical, problem-solving, and conflict resolution skills.
Excellent speaking, writing, and presentation skills, and the ability to persuade, encourage, and empower others.
Ability to clearly communicate technical concepts to non-technical internal stakeholders and customers.
Advanced degree or equivalent experience in computer science or a related field of study.

 The Opportunity
We’re looking for an Enterprise Engineering Director to lead the execution and evolution of Firefly generative AI workstreams for our enterprise customers. You will be responsible for providing technical and organizational leadership for features like Firefly model customization, extensible generative APIs and enterprise focused generative presets. Firefly for Enterprise is one of the biggest priorities for the organization and the measure of success in this role is rapid execution and delivery of features on the Firefly enterprise roadmap. You will help grow the organization into multiple US and global teams and implement a scalable process to parallelize the execution of various enterprise features. You will partner closely with the enterprise PM team, Adobe consulting and various field teams that work closely with our enterprise customers.
What You'll Do
Grow and lead multiple teams to execute on various Firefly enterprise features
Ensure predictable, efficient delivery of features in a phased manner to increase the engagement with enterprise customers and grow the adoption of features
Understand the client requirements and technical constraints for various enterprise customers and come up with solutions to streamline the software stack
Lead the teams to build multi-tenant solutions to satisfy customer requirements
Lead the development of custom generative AI solutions like “Train Your Own Model” using customer data
Work closely with Firefly service and ML platform teams to lead the development and operation of GPU efficient, highly reliable and scalable services for various enterprise features
Lead the integrations of generative AI enterprise features with content delivery mechanisms ranging from Adobe’s offerings to those used by the clients
Represent Adobe in technical conversations with the enterprise customers
Partner with the Firefly Enterprise PMs to define the scope and requirements of deliverables
Ensure the delivery of high quality, reliable, enterprise Firefly features complying with the data protection/isolation requirements and privacy regulations
Partner and collaborate with other Adobe teams to build solutions leveraging existing technologies
What you need to succeed
A track record of leading and growing high-performing engineering teams to build and deliver complex engineering features for enterprise customers
Experience working directly with customers to architect and build solutions for their use cases
Experience with enterprise multi-tenancy, data isolation, content system integrations, metering and billing, etc.
Experience with building tiered and entitlement-based technologies for multi-org enterprise customers
A Bachelors of Master’s degree or equivalent experience.
A minimum of twelve years of industry experience including five years of engineering leadership experience.
Experience with GPU based ML inference services is preferred
