In this role, you’ll get to…
Develop and execute a comprehensive security strategy that aligns with our core strategic objectives, and exceeds the high expectations set by our customers
Work closely with product development teams to embed security best practices and considerations across the entire development lifecycle, ensuring that new features meet the highest trust standards
Lead the enhancement of our incident detection & response procedures and protocols, ensuring a proactive and effective response to security incidents
Oversee the evolution of our SOC, implementing cutting-edge technologies and refining processes to ensure the highest level of security monitoring and incident detection
Establish and lead a threat intelligence program, providing valuable insights into the evolving threat landscape and enabling proactive security measures

At least 10+ years of multifaceted security leadership and management experience in a technology-centric company, including experience leading security teams of 50+ engineers and analysts in a globally distributed organization that services dozens of partners.
Experience designing and deploying security controls across all security domains such as access management, data protection, vulnerability management, incident response and management, application security, network security, preventive, detective and offensive security solutions.
Experience securing cloud based infrastructures; AWS, G-suite, Salesforce, etc
Experience leading highly complex, org wide security change programs
Outstanding interpersonal and communication skills; ability to influence both internally and externally, and to drive multi-functional alignment and action

Job Title: Head of Engineering - Customer Support Technology
Description:
Atlassians have the flexibility to work in an office, from home, or a combination of both. This allows Atlassians to have more control over supporting their family, personal goals, and other priorities.
The Customer Support Technology Platform drives the next generation of platform tools and services across all Atlassian Cloud products to ensure that Atlassian’s customer support capabilities are seamless for external customers and effective for internal support engineers.
What you'll do:
This senior engineering leadership role will lead a global team of 50+ engineers and work closely with product management, design leaders and others to set the strategy, goals and execution roadmap for group.
You will own significant company goals (OKRs) and their delivery.
You will also set strategy alongside triad partners, growing great leaders, technical stewardship, structuring the organisation to support strategy, helping translate strategy into funded execution plans, navigating high-level dependencies with other Atlassian teams, and leading a distributed team of accomplished engineering teams.
As a platform team, there is a large emphasis on collaboration with other platform and product teams and finding win/win roadmap trade-offs.
There is also a strong element of enterprise-level delivery as Atlassian expands in that market.

To support this goal, the baseline of our range is higher than that of the typical market range, but in turn we expect to hire most candidates near this baseline. Zone B: $198,700 - $264,900

5+ years of experience with building large-scale and modern web software mixed IaaS, PaaS and SasS environment
5+ years of driving company-wide engineering programs at similar sized SaaS companies
5+ years of experience in leading large development teams
3+ years managing senior managers, and a track record of successfully scaling organizations of 150+ engineers
Driving clarity from single-line requirements and providing direction in ambiguous environments
Ability to drive excellence, pushing innovation, quality, and operational excellence
A track record of strong execution and delivering results
Strong communication skills (technical, non-technical audiences and senior leadership)
It would be great if you have
Experience in defining a strategic roadmap for products and platforms
Experience with distributed development teams across multiple geographies
Continuous delivery with a strong bias for action
This is a remote position.

15+ years of software development management experience, managing team of 20+ engineers
Bachelor's or Master's degree with a preference for Computer Science degree
Strong and clear communication skills, with a strong emphasis on and empathy, and a bias toward action
Demonstrated experience partnering with product managers and cross-functional stakeholders
Experience driving technical strategy of the team
Knowledge of Agile software development methodologies
Demonstrated experience mentoring and growing high performing engineering teams
It would be great if you have
Delivery services on AWS
Microservices-based and server-less architectures

Atlassian is looking for an experienced leader to drive the vision and strategy for cloud transformation, including product marketing for our migration tooling & experience and Data Center product line. Your role will be to drive the marketing vision and strategy for our messaging, enablement strategy, and product launches that fuel our most critical enterprise sales motions and adoption goals. You will work alongside global product, engineering, and business leaders implementing growth and retention strategies.
Compensation

To support this goal, the baseline of our range is higher than that of the typical market range, but in turn we expect to hire most candidates near this baseline. Partner with product leaders across the organization to develop a visionary roadmap, narrative, and how to pitch it to our customers, partners, and analysts or influencers
Partner with sales and demand generation to drive pipeline, enable, and develop clear feedback loops and the right positioning to shift the enterprise narrative to our customers and partners
Collaborate with AR, PR and thought leadership to build industry momentum for Atlassian’s enterprise solutions
Influence senior leadership, across engineering, marketing, sales, legal, and other functions gaining alignment to common goals.
Build and lead a team of product marketers in defining and strengthening Atlassian’s enterprise foundations

Experience: 8 years of enterprise B2B product marketing with at least 3 years managing a growing team of product marketers.
People management: As a player/coach, you're a passionate, self-starter and are eager to jump in and get things done but don't get flustered in a fast-paced and often changing environment. First and foremost, you are a manager who is focused on developing a collaborative team that feels they can deliver their best work and grow under your leadership.
Complex stakeholder management: You’ve been responsible for creating, driving, and managing go-to-market strategies for critical areas of a business and have experience leading complex, cross-organizational initiatives.
Launches & campaigns: Proven track record of successfully launching and market complex software products
Product expertise: Become the trusted GTM partner to the product team and establish a continuous feedback loop that encompasses customer input, market trends, and competitive factors to influence product development

Working at Atlassian
Atlassians can choose where they work – whether in an office, from home, or a combination of the two. That way, Atlassians have more control over supporting their family, personal goals, and other priorities. We can hire people in any country where we have a legal entity. Interviews and onboarding are conducted virtually, a part of being a distributed-first company.
About the Role:
Join our TEAM and help us unleash the potential of every Atlassian.
We’re looking for a seasoned Talent Development leader to manage our newly-formed Craft Development team. In this role you’ll oversee a team of Talent Development and Organizational Development Partners. You'll be responsible for the strategy, execution, and measurable outcomes of a diverse portfolio of Craft solutions (ex. Engineering Onboarding, Marketing Career Expectations). Your leadership will directly influence our culture of continuous learning, growth, and innovation.
We seek a dynamic individual who thrives on developing both people and products. This hands-on role requires a candidate capable of strategic thinking and seeing the big picture, as well as diving into the intricacies to refine and perfect the details. To be successful in this role, you’ll need to excel at delivering impact through others and be able to deliver impact yourself. 
This people manager will sit within the Talent Development pillar of our Talent Team and report to the Head of Talent Development. You’ll work closely with Talent Partners, HRBPs, customers, and stakeholders to develop and continuously improve impactful solutions across the organization.
For this remote position, we’re ideally looking for someone based in the Pacific Time Zone to ensure optimal collaboration with our team members in the United States, Australia, Europe, the Philippines, and India, while being flexible to accommodate the diverse time zones of our global team.

Manage and direct a team of Talent Development and Organizational Development Partners located around the world, nurturing their professional growth and development through ongoing mentorship and coaching.
Develop and maintain a deep understanding of the Craft-specific talent development needs across the business.
In close partnership with the business, build and continuously improve craft-specific onboarding and upskilling programs (e.g., Intern and New Grad Onboarding) to equip our employees with the knowledge and skills needed to be successful. 
Develop and oversee our portfolio of Organizational Development products, frameworks, and services designed to support the continuous evolution of Atlassian’s talent ecosystem.
Oversee the strategy and maintenance of employee Growth Profiles, providing employees with clear expectations of their current role and level, while also showing a growth path forward.
Curate and manage an Employee Skills & Talent Marketplace to promote internal mobility and talent optimization across the organization.
Spearhead enterprise and craft-specific career pathing strategies, providing clear trajectories for employee growth and satisfaction.
Utilize organizational design and diagnostics to identify areas for structural effectiveness and then develop interventions to drive impactful change in close partnership with the business. 
Define success measures to help understand the impact of your efforts on employee performance and organizational health and hold yourself and your team accountable for achieving results.
Promote a culture of continuous learning and adaptability to support Atlassian’s evolving business landscape.

Advanced degree in HR, Organizational Development, Education, Psychology, Communication, or a related field.
At least 15 years of experience in talent development with proven expertise in building, scaling and refining impactful programs, products, processes, and frameworks.
At least 5 years of experience managing global teams, with a proven track record of hiring, developing, and retaining high-performing talent in a healthy team environment.
Demonstrated track record of designing and implementing end-to-end talent solutions that align with business objectives and add measurable value.
In-depth knowledge of talent and organizational effectiveness principles, frameworks, methodologies, and tools, with proficiency in organizational diagnostics and design.
Capable of understanding diverse talent needs throughout the organization and building strategically prioritized roadmaps to meet them.
Vetted program and project management skills, capable of ensuring execution excellence in dynamic, agile environments.
Strong analytical abilities, with a data-driven approach to problem-solving, decision-making, and performance measurement.
Exceptional communication skills, able to distill complex HR terminology and data insights into actionable strategies through storytelling.
Demonstrated ability to build trusted and productive working relationships with partners and stakeholders of all levels across the business.

Atlassian offers a variety of perks and benefits to support you, your family and to help you engage with your local community. Our offerings include health coverage, paid volunteer days, wellness resources, and so much more. Visit go.atlassian.com/perksandbenefits to learn more.
About Atlassian
At Atlassian, we're motivated by a common goal: to unleash the potential of every team. Our software products help teams all over the planet and our solutions are designed for all types of work. Team collaboration through our tools makes what may be impossible alone, possible together.
We believe that the unique contributions of all Atlassians create our success. To ensure that our products and culture continue to incorporate everyone's perspectives and experience, we never discriminate based on race, religion, national origin, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, age, or marital, veteran, or disability status. All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines.
To provide you the best experience, we can support with accommodations or adjustments at any stage of the recruitment process. Simply inform our Recruitment team during your conversation with them.

To learn more about our culture and hiring process, visit go.atlassian.com/crh.

Working at Atlassian
Atlassian can hire people in any country where we have a legal entity. Assuming you have eligible working rights and a sufficient time zone overlap with your team, you can choose to work remotely or return to an office as they reopen (unless it’s necessary for your role to be performed in the office). Interviews and onboarding are conducted virtually, a part of being a distributed-first company.
With a sufficient timezone overlap with the team, we’re able to hire eligible candidates for this role from USA and Canada. If this sparks your interest, apply today and chat with our friendly recruitment team further.
At Atlassian, we are on a mission to help our customers compete and win in the modern, digital economy. We have built a multi-billion-dollar, fast-growing software business with over 250,000 paying customers, and millions of users around the globe. Many of these organisations acquire and implement Atlassian Solutions through our global network of partners, who deliver a diverse range of enterprise solutions powered by our Atlassian Cloud Platform.
We are seeking a highly experienced Chief Solutions Architect for a key leadership role within our Enterprise Solutions Org. This individual will drive our Platform Solutions Technology strategy, and discussions with our Customers and Partners. You will collaborate with the Chief Solutions Strategist and Strategy Program Manager, as well as extended teams from Marketing, Sales, R&D, and Partner Teams.
There is simply not a more exciting and impactful Platform Solution building opportunity anywhere. Is this the opportunity for you?
Compensation
At Atlassian, we strive to design equitable, explainable, and competitive compensation programs. To support this goal, the baseline of our range is higher than that of the typical market range, but in turn we expect to hire most candidates near this baseline. In this role, you’ll get to:
Lead the development and implementation of the Solution Technology strategy in collaboration with Solutions Strategist and cross-functional teams, ensuring alignment with business goals and objectives.
Design and architect high-level solutions that address complex business problems, aligning them to customers' requirements.
Collaborate with stakeholders, partners, and technical teams to promote and design solutions.
Conduct solution workshops with customers and partners.
Collaborate with internal Atlassian teams and partners to build comprehensive end-to-end solutions using 2nd/3rd party apps, considering the entire solution journey from pre-sales to post-sales implementation scenarios.
Consult with customers on the value proposition of Atlassian Solutions and create a high-level roadmap for implementation.
Provide technical leadership and mentorship to internal and partner teams, fostering a culture of continuous improvement and innovation.
Manage two-way communication with R&D, Product Marketing, and other stakeholders.
Stay informed about the latest developments in technology industry trends and identify opportunities to implement new technologies to gain a competitive advantage in the field.
Work closely with Sales & Marketing, and Partner teams to support business development activities and customer proposals.
Maintain up-to-date knowledge of technology standards, industry trends, emerging technologies, and software development best practices.
Evaluate potential technical risks and provide risk mitigation strategies.
Ensure that the company's technological resources meet its short- and long-term needs.
Develop and manage the organization's data information strategy to support operational processes and decision-making.

More about you:
Technology leader with over 15 years of experience in technology, consulting, and sales within the enterprise solutions and SaaS platforms.
Deep understanding of SaaS platforms and cloud environments.
Extensive experience working on complex architectures, integration points and implementations across enterprise customer. Familiar with best practices for architecture across enterprise customers.
Proven ability to work effectively in a matrix organization, with strong bridge-building and partnering skills.
Experience working with partners is a plus.
Excellent business insight with an outcome-driven approach. Able to effectively position and sell value, calculate return on investment, and engage in consultative selling.
Proficient in executive communication but also comfortable conducting workshops and collaborating with technology teams.
While highly proficient and confident, you remain coachable and strive to be the very best. Your ego is fully in check.
You will focus on driving Atlassian Platform use cases initiatives but also keep an eye on the business as a whole.
You bring a proven record of meeting or exceeding performance metrics - both sales as well as non-revenue targets.
An extreme sense of responsibility and accountability. We have ambitious goals, and we need you to execute relentlessly to "get stuff done."

Atlassian is looking for a global lead for our pre-sales Solutions Engineering (SE) team to lead and shape a rapidly growing team and key function within the Atlassian sales team. Atlassian's Solutions Engineering team partners with both our direct sales and channel sales teams to deliver technical expertise in the sales cycle and assist in qualifying and closing high-value strategic opportunities, while shaping the customer's solutions purchasing decisions across the full Atlassian suite of products.
Compensation
At Atlassian, we strive to design equitable, explainable, and competitive compensation programs. To support this goal, the baseline of our range is higher than that of the typical market range, but in turn we expect to hire most candidates near this baseline. The Role
As the Global Solutions Engineering leader at Atlassian, you will need to understand how to continually advance the culture, organization, strategy and tactical activities of your team to best impact the business growth outcomes.
Your primary responsibilities include but aren't limited to:
Lead, grow, and manage the pre-sales team to work with the Sales team to achieve sales targets
Continue to build out team domain disciplines in Cloud Migration, Service Management, Agile, DevOps, and Work Management solutions
Develop strategies with the direct sales and channel sales team leaders to align SE team activity to best impact sales outcomes
Establish key measures and outcomes for each team member and operationalize their path to achieving success
Maintain a rigorous feedback loop with the product teams, and deliver a point of view on roadmap investment priorities
Develop and deliver solutions-focused presentations of our offerings to executive decision-makers within large customer organizations
Speak publicly and evangelize Atlassian products at enterprise-focused events
Maintain a continuous resource plan to achieve results, and create a growth model that maps additional resource ask to new demands
The SE team's expertise is often critical to developing new solutions sales opportunities in our high-growth business, and shaping the enablement and go-to-market perspective around such solutions. You will need to partner with a diverse set of stakeholders - direct sales, channel sales, field marketing, product marketing, and sales enablement - to best shape the areas of joint execution with each team. Given the broad demand for your team's time and expertise, you will need to negotiate prioritization of when and where SE assistance is best used with each team.

On your first day, we'll expect you to have:
14+ years experience interacting with customers and ideally 6+ years spent leading a team of high-performing leaders and teams.
Strong management skills with an ability to translate a plan into an agreed set of outcomes and measurements.
Strong written and oral communication skills and ability to manage your time effectively are critical.
Ideally, we're looking for someone with a prior background in solutions selling to Software Development or IT c-suite/SVPs/VP leadership, and who understands the ecosystem of potential integrations and partnerships we would work with.
Experience managing distributed remote teams is a plus.
You want to be a part of something big. You are up for the challenge of running a team within a fast-growing organization and balancing the needs of the team with the needs of the business.
You enjoy mentoring and inspiring your team with a growth mindset.
Really want to win us over? Tell us about your experience using Atlassian tools in the wild.
The Team
You will manage an organization full of solutions rockstars for Agile, DevOps, ITSM and Work Management solutions, who can speak to any customer technical and strategic fit for our solutions.
The SE team is globally distributed with a presence across US, Europe, and APAC, and they guide customers through the execution of high-profile product evaluations using in-depth knowledge of Atlassian products and industry best practices. This can take on many forms from product demonstrations, phone calls, email support, and occasional on-site visits.
The SE team also acts as a feedback funnel directly to our product management teams, offering insights and recommendations gathered from their customer interactions. You will continue to evolve the SE team's craft around providing technical expertise in the sales cycle to qualify opportunities and close deals.
The SE team interacts with Global 2000 companies every day, working closely with our go-to-market teams to provide an enterprise-grade experience to our customers. We're a get s#$% done global team, built on Atlassian's core values. If this mirrors how you want to work, then we are excited to have you join the team and help our company grow and change for the better.

The primary responsibility of the Head of Channel GTM is to lead an organization of seasoned Channel Market Leaders and strategic portfolio initiatives. The leader will be responsible for growing and shaping the market teams in order to build Atlassian's presence and market share globally for the year to come.
You possess a strong drive and analytical mindset, making you an ideal candidate for the role of a business professional. With experience in managing and expanding indirect sales and delivery teams, you have a deep understanding of how to generate value and increase volume through partnerships with hundreds of partners and thousands of customers. Your focus lies in driving channel initiatives while also keeping a holistic view of the overall business, ensuring that decisions are made with future growth in mind.
Your expertise extends to navigating complex partnership models to assemble the right portfolio of capable partners to ensure customer success. Coming from an enterprise software vendor background, you are eager to seek new challenges at a hyper-growth company where innovative business models can be explored without hesitation.

Job Title: Head of On Premises Support, AMER

We are looking for a passionate leader to run our On-Premises support operations in the Americas. Collaborating with group managers and heads of departments and geos, this position will define strategic direction and operational strategies for our On-Premises products in the Americas support team, identify areas for continuous improvement, contribute to policy definitions, and most importantly develop the talent. This person will collaborate with their peers to champion the support organization's 3-year strategy, more specifically focusing on supporting customers to be successful with using the Data Center deployment option of our products.
To service our customers effectively, you need to be able to build an environment that attracts top talent and nurtures them through training programs, accountability for stretch goals, regular performance management, and calibration exercises. Job Title: Staff, Software Networking Test Engineer (PPP, DHCP, VPWS Radius) - DB1010324 - 1010324
Description:
Software Test Engineer 
Location: Westford, MA
Software Test Engineer is a technical role within Juniper Networks Software Engineering group responsible to design, develop, build test plan and strategy to qualify and deliver software and networking products. The highly skilled engineers are responsible for delivering production grade quality products by validating and qualifying the software and products through automated, agile and adaptive test engineering. The engineer should be well versed with automation, networking technologies, virtualization technologies and test frameworks.
Responsibilities:
Review functional specs, design test plans and validate the outlined functionality in reference to functional specs;
After reviewing the software/feature functional specs, engineer would be responsible to design a test plan to cover the feature from functional as well as scale point of view.
Work with project leads and subject-matter experts to review the test-plan for its approval.
Using agile process, plan for automation of the test plan using engineering software and tools.  
Report any software issues or functional deviations found during test and review cycle.
Ensure test reports are updated and tracked on timely basis which will assist to reflect the progress and feature release.
Automate the test cases to ensure feature would be regressed on future releases.
Engineer would be responsible to automate the testcases as outlined in testplans, using advanced scripting techniques and software languages like Perl, Python.
Make use of internal infrastructure such that automated scripts can be ported on any test platform.
Review the scripts with stake holders and ensure it gets integrated into mainline regression. 
As an owner of the test suite, engineer would be responsible for fixing the problems reported on the automated scripts. 
Engage in customer escalations and assist development team in replication.
Participate in major customer escalations and work with other stake holders in understanding the problem.
Work to narrow down the problem which can be specific to platform, feature, or design.
Replicate the issue which would assist development team for potential fix in the software, which would then be validated.
Review customer found problems and fill in any test coverage gaps.
Engineer would be responsible to review the issues found in the field deployment and perform root cause analysis for test gaps.
For any test gaps found during analysis, understand customer specific deployment, and replicate the issue in lab.
 Automate these coverage gaps using test automation framework for continual regression in future release.
Develop expertise in networking and software technologies.
Engineer would be engaged in technical forums to learn and understand the emerging technologies within networking industry.
Would be responsible to take necessary certifications to enhance the knowledge which can bring in innovative ideas in routine daily tasks.
Minimum Qualifications:
Bachelor of Engineering in Electronics / Compute, or higher degree is desired
10 - 15 years’ of relevant experience.
JNCIx or equivalent certification can be added advantage. 
Should have strong automation background with proficiency in Python.
Should demonstrate strong proficiency in following networking technologies:
Switching – VXLAN, STP, RSTP, Bridge-Domain
Routing – OSPF, ISIS, BGP
Protocols EVPN, L2CKT, L2VPN, L3VPN, PPP, DHCP, VPWS Radius
Should have exposure in automation framework like ROBOT.
Expertise in use of networking test equipment like Spirent and Ixia, including automation.
Excellent oral and written communication skills.
  Minimum Salary: $140,096.00
Maximum Salary:$201,388.00
The pay range for this position is expected to be between $140,096.00 and $201,388.00/year; however, the base pay offered may vary depending on multiple individualized factors, including market location, job-related knowledge, skills, and experience. The total compensation package for this position also includes medical benefits, 401(k) eligibility, vacation, sick time, and parental leave. If hired, employee will be in an “at-will position” and the Company reserves the right to modify base salary (as well as any other payment or compensation program) at any time, including for reasons related to individual performance, Company or individual department/team performance, and market factors.
Juniper’s pay range data is provided in accordance with local state pay transparency regulations. Juniper may post different minimum wage ranges for permanent residency petitions pursuant to US Department of Labor requirements.

Intro: 
The Juniper Brand & Communications Team is the company’s nerve center for creativity and messaging. Our team is comprised of comms, brand advertising, creative development, customer experience marketing, and events. We are revitalizing a brand that disrupted the networking industry 25 years ago, and we are poised to do it again with industry-leading AI technology that is proven to significantly improve network operations for our customers’ IT teams. Our charter is to develop and perpetuate a brand story that’s as distinct and compelling as our AI-driven technology. Our work is making a measurable impact on our business and is one of the keys to achieving the company’s audacious growth goals. We’re an award-winning, fun (self-proclaimed), data-driven, art-inspired group of marketeers and creatives who are maniacally focused on building the best team in the industry. 
  Job Overview 
We’re looking for a hands-on Associate Creative Director with strong experience in directing and developing motion graphics, graphic design, web design and video. Your portfolio should demonstrate a modern, elegant design aesthetic, and be able to show off your creative process (you aren’t just an order taker). You will help lead our in-house creative team to tell Juniper’s story and convince the world that our AI-Native networking solutions are as life-changing and amazing as we think they are. Working with a sense of urgency, help us discover new and evolving expressions of the Juniper brand. Join our diverse and eclectic team of doers, makers, and roll-up-your-sleevers.  
  Key responsibilities 
Creative Leadership 
Provide innovative and strategic creative direction to the design team, aligning and developing the brand's vision and business objectives. 
Lead by example, fostering a culture of creative problem solving, collaboration, and excellence. 
Digital Experience Design 
Conceptualize and oversee the development of end-to-end digital experiences, ensuring a cohesive and captivating user journey. 
Stay at the forefront of digital design trends, bringing a modern aesthetic to all digital touchpoints. 
Motion Graphics and Video Production 
Direct the creation of compelling motion graphics and video content that enhances the brand narrative. 
Leverage strong visual storytelling skills to convey brand messages through a simple ownable visual style. 
Campaign Concept Development 
Drive the conceptualization and execution of creative campaigns across digital channels. 
Collaborate closely with marketing teams to ensure creative concepts align with campaign objectives and brand strategy. 
Digital Strategy 
Contribute to the development of digital strategy, integrating creative concepts with data-driven insights to optimize user engagement. 
Collaborate with digital marketing teams to ensure a cohesive and effective digital presence. 
Cross-Functional Collaboration 
Work collaboratively with cross-functional teams, including marketing, product, and technology, to bring integrated digital solutions to life. 
Ensure consistency in brand messaging and visual identity across all digital platforms. 
Quality Assurance 
Conduct thorough reviews of motion graphics, video content, and digital experiences to ensure they meet the highest standards of creativity, quality, and brand consistency. 
 Qualifications

Proficiency in design and video editing software (Adobe Creative Suite, After Effects, Premiere, etc.). 
Strong understanding of digital design principles and user experience best practices.
Excellent conceptual thinking and problem-solving abilities. 
Ability to develop and communicate a compelling creative vision. 
Strong leadership and collaboration skills. 
 If you are a creative visionary with a passion for modern design, motion graphics, and deep digital story telling with a deep portfolio, we invite you to join our team and play a key role in shaping the digital future of our brand.

Job Title: Director Product Management - Campus & Branch portfolio - 1010347
Description:
The  Product Director for GTM initiatives in the AI Driven Enterprise business will focus on accelerating the market presence and adoption of campus  solutions. This position involves strategic planning, product and program management, and cross-functional coordination to drive market growth and product success. This position is also responsible for overseeing the SaaS renewal business and  increasing software attach for the campus and branch solutions.
  Responsibilities:
Strategic Planning and Execution:
Develop and implement comprehensive market acceleration strategies for  the market leading Juniper Mist AI driven campus and branch portfolio
Identify target markets, understand market penetration in different regions and verticals and create tailored programs to penetrate these markets effectively.
Oversee the planning, execution, and monitoring of market acceleration initiatives.
Coordinate with various teams (R&D, sales, marketing, etc.) to ensure program objectives are met.
Develop and implement strategies to maximize software SaaS attach and renewal rates.
Identify key drivers of renewals and develop targeted initiatives to improve retention
Market Analysis and Insight:
Conduct market research to identify trends, challenges, and opportunities in the  enterprise switching & wireless markets.
Translate market insights into actionable strategies and program enhancements.
Cross-Functional Collaboration:
Work closely with product management, engineering, sales, channel and marketing teams to align market acceleration programs with overall business objectives.
Facilitate communication and collaboration across different departments to ensure program success.
Stakeholder and Customer Engagement:
Engage with key stakeholders, including customers, partners, and industry experts, to gather feedback and build relationships.
Use stakeholder insights to refine and improve market acceleration strategies.
Engage with customers and partners to understand their needs, feedback, and satisfaction levels.
Work with customer success teams to ensure a high-quality user experience, driving higher renewal rates.
Collaborate with the sales team to meet and exceed renewal revenue targets.
Develop sales tools and processes that support renewal efforts.
Performance Metrics and Reporting:
Define and track key performance indicators (KPIs) to measure the success of market acceleration initiatives.
Regularly report on program performance to senior management and adjust strategies as needed.
Analyze renewal data to identify trends, opportunities, and areas of risk.
Provide regular reports on renewal performance, insights, and forecasted trends.
Budget Management:
Manage budgets allocated for market acceleration programs.
Ensure efficient allocation and utilization of resources to maximize ROI.
  Requirements:
Educational Background:
Bachelor's degree in Business, Marketing, Engineering, or a related field. An advanced degree (e.g., MBA) can be advantageous.
Experience:
Proven experience in program management, marketing, or a related field, ideally in the technology or networking sector.
Experience with campus switching products and market dynamics is highly desirable.
Skills:
Strong leadership and project management skills.
Excellent analytical, strategic thinking, and problem-solving abilities.
Effective communication and interpersonal skills.
Proficiency in market analysis and data-driven decision-making.
Proficiency in CRM and data analysis tools
Personal Attributes:
Ability to work in a fast-paced and dynamic environment.
Innovative mindset with a focus on results.
Strong team player with the ability to lead and motivate others.
  Additional Considerations:
Travel Requirements: Depending on the role, travel to meet with clients, stakeholders, or attend industry events may be required.

At Juniper, we strive to deliver network experiences that transform how people connect, work and live. Title: ASIC  Sr. Director
THE ROLE:
Juniper Networks seeks an experienced ASIC verification leader with strong technical skills. You will manage an ASIC verification group and lead the task of producing high quality bug-free industry-leading high performance and feature-rich networking silicon on time.
KEY RESPONSIBILITIES:
Possess a thorough knowledge of ASIC design cycle, from architecture to verification sign-off, and lab validation.
Knowledge of the principles of project management and can apply them effectively on small to large size projects.
Provide leadership to the ASIC verification team – drive activities spanning from project scheduling, test planning, test execution, debug, lab bring-up and customer support.
Interact with ASIC IP and EDA vendors to resolve issues and drive higher productivity and quality.
Initiates significant changes to existing processes and methods to improve project and team efficiency.
Manage and handle issues and escalations with a sense of urgency.
Availability for discussions with coworkers and customers in other time zones.
PREFERRED EXPERIENCE:
Experience in delivering successful silicon in high-speed networking.
Exposure to lab validation and customer support
Consistent record leading and successfully delivering medium-to-large ASIC projects.
Strong organizational, problem-solving, interpersonal, presentation, written and verbal communication skills. 
Exposure to ASIC verification using SystemVerilog/UVM, modeling using SystemC/C++, emulation methodologies, build and regression environment using perl/Python

ACADEMIC CREDENTIALS:
Degree in electrical engineering, computer science, or similar preferred

LOCATION: Sunnyvale CA

Job Title: Senior Director of Product Marketing, AI Data Center - 1010281
Description:
We are seeking a dynamic and strategic Senior Director of Product Marketing to lead the marketing efforts for our AI Data Center Solutions at Juniper Networks.  This critical leadership role involves shaping and executing comprehensive product marketing strategies to drive awareness and penetration in this strategic and massively growing market.
  Responsibilities:
  Strategy Development:
Develop and drive the overall product marketing strategy for Juniper's AI Data Center Solutions, aligning with the company's business objectives and market dynamics.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams, including product management, sales, field marketing, and performance marketing to ensure cohesive and integrated go-to-market plans.
Product Positioning and Messaging:
Craft differentiated messaging that resonates with key buyer personas, establishing Juniper Networks as a thought leader in AI Data Center networking.
Evangelize products and solutions directly with customers, partners, analysts, influencers, and sales teams.
Go-to-Market Execution:
Lead the development and execution of go-to-market plans for new product launches and updates, ensuring alignment with overall business objectives.
Collaborate with demand generation and sales teams to create impactful marketing campaigns that generate awareness, interest, and demand.
Sales Enablement:
Develop sales enablement tools, including collateral, presentations, and training materials, to empower the sales team to effectively communicate the value of Juniper's AI Data Center Solutions.
Provide ongoing support to the sales organization, including participation in key customer meetings and events.
Customer Advocacy:
Foster strong relationships with key customers, gathering feedback and insights to continuously improve products and marketing strategies.
Leverage customer success stories and testimonials to build credibility and influence in the market.
  Qualifications:
  Bachelor's degree in marketing, business, or a related field; MBA is a plus.
Proven experience in product marketing leadership roles, preferably in the networking, AI, or technology industry.
Deep understanding of campus and branch networking solutions, including wireless access, wired access, WAN, indoor location, and NAC.
Strong strategic thinking, with the ability to translate complex technical concepts into compelling and relatable messaging.
Excellent leadership and collaboration skills, with the ability to work effectively across functions and influence at all levels of the organization.
Track record of developing and executing successful go-to-market strategies.
Exceptional communication and presentation skills.

Job Title: Director, Product Line Management (Threat Management) - RC1009857 - 1009857
Description:
Director of Product Line Management – Threat Management 
Location: Sunnyvale, CA
Do you have what it takes to join one of the world’s leading network security companies?  Do you enjoy working on innovative solutions that solve real world problems?  Do you have an eye for simplicity? If you do, then come and join Juniper Networks in our mission to Connect Everything and Empower Everyone through Engineering Simplicity
We’re seeking a highly motivated Director of Product Line Manager (PLM) to lead our Security Management Team. The candidate will drive and execute on strategy for our security management portfolio. This is an opportunity to work with an innovative team to build the next generation digital experience for network security. 
These solutions are a critical contributor to our highly competitive line of network security solutions. 
You will get to work with what CRN award as one of The 10 Coolest New Networking Products.
This position will have broad responsibility for working with the field sales to engage customers and drive our security business. The candidate must have proven ability and record to drive product requirements for complex and dynamic network security space, engage with strategic customers, work with vendors and partners, drive market requirement from definition to delivery, and effectively interface with product marketing, product development/engineering, manufacturing, operations and finance.
Responsibilities
Create and execute a strategy to build and grow our network security threat management services business.
Responsible for quarterly/annual revenue and margin targets
Contribute to our quarterly business reviews
Manage threat management product line powered by artificial intelligence
Drive thought leadership, strategy, and market-leadership around threat management, AI, and automation in Enterprise, Cloud, Data Center and Service Provider segments
Maximize ROI using the build, buy and partner ecosystem 
Full lifecycle Product Management role (including inbound and outbound functions)
Business (Revenue and Customer) growth along with improving mind share 
Develop roadmaps, outline product requirements, and oversee the management of requirements backlog.
Execute design programs to validate novel product concepts through customer engagement.
Collaborate with Engineering, Marketing, Finance, Manufacturing, and Supply Chain teams to implement cutting-edge solutions.
Support marketing and sales teams via product training and in depth market analysis 
Work closely with customer success and field organizations to ensure customer satisfaction.
  Experience/Skills
10+ years’ experience working as a principal product manager, senior product manager or a manager or product management building and working on threat management products
Must have a background in creating and executing a strategy that delivers security products to the market successfully.
Must have experience with revenue responsibility. 
Well versed in the Security Market and trends, customer deployment models, monetization models and technologies to deliver an industry leading user experience for our security services.
Well versed in SASE and SSE framework and management 
Experienced with Agile development methodology
Must be able to define software and hardware product requirements, author business plans, prioritize features and track progress. In depth knowledge of networking, firewalls, security services such as IPS, IDP, Web filtering, Anti-virus, Advanced Threat Protection, Anti-malware, usability, and security digital experience 
Must also be adept at forecasting, pricing, positioning and managing product transitions.
Excellent critical thinking skillset
Excellent analytical analysis skillset
Excellent presenter, great 360-degree collaboration and influence skills, high-energy personality to break barriers and drive an emerging portfolio 
Good understanding about security solution integration with automation frameworks and artificial intelligence
Outstanding verbal and written communication abilities to effectively influence and engage with management at all organizational levels.
 Education:
Bachelors / Master’s degree with 10 years’ experience in enterprise networking and/or security solutions and working with software/hardware management products
Other:
Travel is required for this position. 
This position is based in Sunnyvale, California and has a requirement for the individual to be based locally.
Must work from the office 2-3 days a week. 
Must have the ability to physically host and attend in-office meetings as needed.

Juniper Networks is a leading provider of networking hardware and systems, headquartered in Sunnyvale, CA. We have an immediate need at our Sunnyvale, CA location for a highly skilled and experienced individual to lead the Mechanical Design team. This position reports to the Senior Director of System Technologies, a subgroup of Juniper’s Silicon & System Technologies department in AWAN BU. The main objective of this team is to apply principles of mechanical engineering to develop practical solutions to the very demanding requirements for Juniper products, and to support the ASIC & Hardware design teams in ensuring that the mechanical design is properly executed.
This is an excellent opportunity for the right person who is passionate about building critical infrastructure hardware; that powers large portion of the internet today; provides last mile connectivity through WIFI access points and secures the entire network.  The successful candidate will be a key  member of the System Technologies leadership team, responsible for all aspects of mechanical design and analysis of all Juniper products.  The role will have ~15 design and analysis engineers reporting directly, while another 5+ mechanical engineers reporting dotted line.  The selected candidate will work closely with Hardware Engineering Leaders & Architects to drive the next generation product roadmap for Juniper.
Job Description:
Must be a self-motivated individual to work in a fast-paced high energy environment with short product development cycles. This person must have project management skills including creating budget, resources assignment, schedules, as well as people management.
The job requires experience as Mechanical Manager responsible for leading a large team for design and development of rack mounted networking products. Also, the candidate must be very hands-on and not only have experience of designing products but also putting products through regulatory compliance tests.
The job also requires coaching Jr. engineers and reviewing the design of engineers before design get released for prototyping.
Job function involves interaction with other functional groups and coordination with outside design resources.
Experience:
Must have minimum of 20 years of experience which includes at least 5 years as manager of 10+ team and 10+ years’ experience in electro-mechanical design with a concentration in either networking or storage or server products.
A working knowledge of sheet metal design and manufacturing processes for low and mid volume production is a must. Excellent understanding of electro-mechanical packaging,  manufacturing processes, tolerance analysis, thermal design, Power, NEBS and EMI issues. Understanding of high-speed signal routings and large system installation in Data Center & Telco industries are preferable.
Must be a present user of a 3D solids modeling package, proficiency with Solidworks would be preferable and working knowledge of EPDM is plus.
Must be able to do Tolerance Analysis of complex systems and have working knowledge of FEA.
Experience with IDF & ECAD-MCAD transfer process is preferred.
Education:
BSME is required and MSME is preferred.
Proficient with Tolerance Analysis, GD&T & FEA

Are you ready to join Juniper today?

Demonstrated experience developing and implementing a successful go-to market plan and multiyear (three-year) business/sales plan.
Extensive experience building and developing a successful team of sales professionals.
Strong quantitative analytical skills
Exceptional interpersonal skills, including listening, written, and public speaking.
Key industry and customer (CxO) relationships.
Must have a clear understanding of industry selling methodology; MEDDPICC, and Value based selling.

Team:
The Juniper Brand & Communications Team is the company’s nerve center for creativity and messaging. Our team is comprised of comms, brand advertising, creative development, customer experience marketing, and events. We are revitalizing a brand that disrupted the networking industry 25 years ago, and we are poised to do it again with industry-leading AI technology that is proven to significantly improve network operations for our customers’ IT teams. Our charter is to develop and perpetuate a brand story that’s as distinct and compelling as our AI-driven technology. Our work is making a measurable impact on our business and is one of the keys to achieving the company’s audacious growth goals. We’re an award-winning, fun(self-proclaimed), data-driven, art-inspired group of marketeers and creatives who are maniacally focused on building the best team in the industry. 
  Position Overview:
As a vital part of our growth acceleration, we are seeking a Global Communications Senior Director to lead a high-performing team responsible for public relations, corporate communications, executive communications and employee communications on a global scale.
The person is this new role will be responsible for rolling out our recently minted company narrative across all external and internal comms channels. A relentless focus on developing cohesive and compelling messaging will be key to delivering aggressive 2024 awareness and thought leadership goals, while an expert managerial prowess is important to fully optimize the team’s operations globally. 
And because we’re not really interested in doing the expected, we’re looking for someone with an insatiable curiosity to try new things, test provocative ideas and constantly uncover actionable learning. Status quo won’t drive the historic growth we believe we’re capable of, so if you naturally run counter to industry norms and you’re used to unprecedented achievements, we’d love to meet you.
  Responsibilities:
1. Strategic Communication Planning
Develop and implement a comprehensive communications strategy aligned with Juniper Networks' business objectives.
Drive the creation of compelling messaging that supports our focus areas and key themes.
Understand the communications landscape and needs of various audiences, regularly evolving to reflect changes to business priorities.
2. Team Leadership
Lead and inspire a diverse team of communication professionals, providing mentorship and fostering a collaborative and innovative work environment. 
Set clear goals and objectives for the team, monitoring progress and ensuring successful execution of comms initiatives.
Evaluate and refine operational processes to improve coordination and efficiency across the Comms team and broader Marketing organization.
Participate in the Brand & Communications leadership team to maintain a cohesive operating model and continue to foster/evolve our uniquely outstanding team culture.
3. Media Relations
Proactively engage with media outlets to secure positive coverage and manage the company's reputation.
Act as a spokesperson for Juniper Networks, building and maintaining relationships with key journalists and industry influencers.
4. Internal Communications
Lead execution and evolution of all internal communication channels and tools to ensure employees are informed and engaged.
Drive employee advocacy by fostering a strong internal communications culture.
Lead the evolution of our employer brand in close partnership with HR leadership.
5. Crisis Communication
Develop and implement crisis communication plans, providing timely and transparent communication during challenging situations.
Serve as a key point of contact for media inquiries during crises.
6. Content Creation
Oversee the creation of compelling content, including press releases, blog posts, and other written materials.
Ensure that all communication materials reflect the company's brand and messaging guidelines.
Work with a portfolio of global agency partners to develop compelling, unified and strategically relevant messaging concepts. 
7. Executive Communication
Support executive leadership in crafting speeches, presentations, and other communication materials.
Provide media training for executives to enhance their communication skills.
  Qualifications
Strong people leadership with a consistent track record of building and developing high-performing comms organizations. A team-focused obsession that makes you a great team member and a great team leader. 
Demonstrated ability to build cross-functional partnerships with teams such as product marketing, demand generation, field marketing, etc.
Demonstrable global media relations experience including a broad range of media outlets. 
Exceptional written and verbal communication skills.
Crisis communication experience on a global scale.
A passion and enthusiasm for emerging technologies, experimentation, building new things, and a stomach for the exploration and iteration it takes.
Minimum of 10-12 years of experience in global corporate communications or related roles.

Job Title: Senior Director of Product Marketing, Campus and Branch - 1009714

We are seeking a dynamic and strategic Senior Director of Product Marketing to lead the marketing efforts for our Campus and Branch Solutions portfolio at Juniper Networks, the fastest-growing product area at the company. Job Title: Sales Engineering Director-Enterprise-CO, MT, UT, AZ - 1008976
Description:
Sales Engineering Director-Enterprise
Responsibilities:
The Director of Enterprise Sales Engineering is responsible for defining the technical contribution in respect to Juniper’s Enterprise Go-to-Market (GTM) strategy. This includes defining consistent and efficient strategies focused on use cases which drive key business outcomes.  The successful candidate will have a heavy hand in crafting a strategy that extends across all of Juniper’s enterprise sales theaters, and meaningful verticals. This packaging effort must also include competitive context, highlighting differentiation, which drives customer adoption, upsell, and cross sell.  This position includes operational and creative elements where an ideal candidate will be proficient at ideation and experienced in cross-functional execution. We are committed to imagining groundbreaking ways to deliver AI-Driven, automated, scalable, and secure networks to move at the speed of business!
Juniper Networks brings simplicity to networking with products, solutions, and services that connect the world!
Specific responsibilities include:
Define and evangelize messaging pertaining to next-gen enterprise solutions
Define and land the enterprise & data center unique value proposition with field and partner sellers.
Package the unique value proposition along with products and services to help drive enterprise sales plays.
Work with field marketing to drive major demand campaigns, aligned with technology areas focused on full-stack enterprise deployments.
Lead regional technical teams to drive the technical contribution for GTM success focused on actions which drive significant multi-year business outcomes.
Provide relevant market and competitive intelligence for both the field and product marketing teams.
Drive career growth for all direct reports to articulate a multi-year career journey.
Design, develop and execute broader strategies to establish efficiencies that apply to the global enterprise technical community.
Required skills include:
10+ years of proven experience to include management of diverse technical teams.
Deep understanding of enterprise networking, including key buying criteria and personas
Deep understanding of major technology areas, including enterprise / data center architectures, automation, and SD-WAN
Strong interpersonal / communication skills
Ability to lead cross-functional teams focused on strategic business outcomes.
Knowledge of key enterprise verticals, including retail, manufacturing, financial services, healthcare, and related
About Juniper Networks
Juniper Networks is in the business of network innovation. From devices to data centers, from consumers to cloud providers, Juniper Networks delivers the software, silicon, and systems that transform the experience and economics of networking. Our products and technology own the world’s largest and most fast paced networks today, enabling service providers, enterprises, and governments to add new value and accelerate business success. Every day our 9,000+ colleagues come together across 46 countries to realize our company vision – Connect Everything, Empower Everyone. We are innovating in ways that empower our customers, our partners, and ultimately, everyone, in a connected world. These customers include the top 130 global service providers, 96 of the Fortune 100, and hundreds of public sector organizations.

Job Requisition ID #
24WD74659
Position Overview
Autodesk's Digital Media Center (DMC) is a center of excellence that supports and advises internal stakeholders with digital media best practices to improve business outcomes. The organization operates like an in-house media agency, consisting of digital media planners, optimizers, analysts, and execution experts across paid search, organic search, display advertising, social media, in-product marketing, web content and new platforms. As a digital center of excellence, the team ensures that best practices and innovation are implemented across all activities. This role could be based anywhere in the US near an Autodesk office.
You will manage a team of 20+ within DMC and must align closely with our media planners and SEO teams to support holistic paid media and owned media activities. The mission of the Paid Media team is to ensure stakeholder satisfaction by aligning to goals and activating and reporting on digital media performance. You will be presenting actionable insights with performance improvement recommendations, designing experimentation test plans for optimal conversion, and evolving our in-house media capabilities to stay ahead of modern marketing technologies and strategies.
You will lead the strategy around how DMC scales to support an increasing number of internal stakeholders and increasing budgets. You will ensure tracking and measurement, and that ROAS and ROMI are improved.
This is a hybrid position that will report to the VP, Demand Generation.
Responsibilities
Directly oversee all aspects of paid digital media execution and optimization, including managing the internal team, contractors and downstream agencies
Manage large media partner relationships (I.e. Google, Facebook, LinkedIn)
Track overall paid media success against KPIs and communicate results to broader team
Review in-flight performance, ensuring teams are optimizing to targets and proposing changes based on performance
Provide leadership in DMC, advocating for the most effective approaches to paid media activation
Maintain alignment with marketing operations team (MOT) to ensure data accuracy and digital media optimization & performance is being evaluated properly
Coordinate with stakeholders and DMC experts to ensure alignment on budgets, volume, quality and return goals
Minimum Qualifications
15+ years experience in paid media strategy and execution, in either an in-house or agency role
Bachelor's, Master's or equivalent degree in marketing, communications or related field
Experience managing large global teams of at least 25+
Extensive knowledge of digital marketing channels across SEM, social, display and programmatic platforms, video streaming, etc. designed for brand-to-demand efforts
Experience with multi-touch attribution and media mix modeling
Direct experience with the predominant ad platforms including Facebook, LinkedIn, Adwords, DV360, Demandbase, TradeDesk, YouTube, etc
Experience with ad operations, media reporting and QA, including implementation of UTMs, ad serving and pixels
An understanding of the evolving MarTech space in order to communicate and orchestrate complex campaigns across multiple channels
Experience using digital media analytics and reporting tools (Adobe Analytics, Google Analytics, PowerBI, etc.)
Experience establishing communication with many different groups and working collaboratively with people who are diverse in background and geography
Passion for digital marketing and connecting stakeholders with a path to the most effective digital media approaches
Preference for B2B experience but open to B2C depending on qualifications
Agency experience a big plus
Enterprise software and SaaS industry experience

Position Overview  
At Autodesk’s Worldwide Marketing organization, we seek an extraordinary leader to shape the future of Autodesk’s community of customers, partners, and employees.  The Senior Director of the Autodesk Community will play a crucial role in actualizing the potential of the global Autodesk ecosystem by building and nurturing a vibrant and engaged community. You will be responsible for developing and executing strategies to enhance customer loyalty, advocacy and success while driving user adoption, and establishing a culture that honors skillful contribution, imaginative solutions, and compassionate interaction. 
 Reporting into the Vice President, Industry & Portfolio Marketing, the Senior Director of the Autodesk Community will be a strategic leader, responsible for developing and executing a comprehensive vision for Autodesk’s global community. You will lead impactful programs, and foster deep connections that will fuel innovation and accelerate the adoption of Autodesk’s technology. You will oversee a dynamics team of community professionals who design, build, and operate programs that empower millions of customers, partners, and employees to learn, connect, and grow with Autodesk.  
 Autodesk is a leading software company specializing in providing design and engineering solutions to professionals in various industries. With a strong focus on innovation and collaboration, Autodesk empowers its customers to create, visualize, and simulate their ideas to drive better outcomes.  
 Responsibilities  
Community Strategy: Develop and implement a comprehensive community strategy aligned with Autodesk's business objectives. This includes defining goals, KPIs, and success metrics to measure the impact of community initiatives
Programs: Create impactful and inclusive programs and experiences that drive customer loyalty, advocacy, and success
Key Stakeholder Engagement: Develop relationships with Autodesk Executive sponsors and cross functional partners to understand their vision of community and how community supports current and emerging business strategies over time 
Community Engagement: Foster a sense of community and collaboration among users. Drive active participation and engagement within the Autodesk community by creating compelling content, organizing events, and facilitating discussions
User Support: Oversee the development and implementation of effective user support programs and resources. Ensure timely and accurate responses to user inquiries, troubleshooting, and issue resolution 
Advocacy and Evangelism: Identify and nurture community advocates and influencers who can promote Autodesk products and services. Collaborate with marketing and sales teams to leverage user-generated content and testimonials
Product Feedback: Act as a liaison between the community and product development teams, gathering user feedback, insights, and feature requests. Advocate for community-driven product improvements and enhancements 
Community Growth: Develop strategies to attract all current and new users to the Autodesk community. Expand community programs to engage senior leaders and executives. Collaborate with marketing and sales teams to drive user acquisition and retention initiatives  
Metrics and Reporting: Establish and track key performance indicators (KPIs) to measure the success and impact of community initiatives, including shared KPIs with all internal community partners. Provide regular reports and insights to senior leadership on community engagement, user satisfaction, and business outcomes  
 Minimum Qualifications  
Experience:  You have a minimum of 12+ years of experience driving user engagement in online communities of 5000+ members. Previous experience in the software industry or technology sector is highly desirable. Experience in marketing is preferred 
Leadership Skills: You have a proven track record of building, leading and managing high-performing teams. The team culture you have created inspires and motivates your team members to proactively create solutions, “dream big” about future programs, and achieve common goals   
Strategic Thinking: You have the ability to develop and execute community strategies aligned with business objectives with experience in setting goals, defining metrics, and measuring success 
User-Centric Approach: You have a deep understanding of user needs, preferences, and behaviors. Your ability to empathize with users and advocate for their interests within the organization  
Executive Presence and Communication Skills: Your written and verbal communication skills are excellent, with an ability to articulate complex ideas and concepts in a clear and concise manner. You also have the ability to tailor content and communication style to any audience within the organization. Experience in public speaking and presenting to diverse audiences is a plus 
Facilitation: You have guided diverse groups in exploring creative possibilities and synthesized output into an actionable state   
Collaboration: You have strong relationship building skills and can collaborate effectively with cross-functional teams, including marketing, sales, product development, and customer support 
Analytical Skills: You are proficient in data analysis and interpretation and have an ability to derive actionable insights from community metrics and user feedback
Passion for Community: You have a genuine passion for building and nurturing online communities. You are familiar with community management best practices, trends, and emerging technologies

Job Requisition ID #
23WD74283
Position Overview
The Director – Transfer Pricing will report to the Senior Director – Global Tax Planning & Strategy and be a member of a worldwide finance team that strives to be best-in-class. The successful candidate will join the tax group to gain an understanding of how public policy, corporate goals and business transformations, and tax intersect at a dynamic, public software company. How governments seek to tax multinational corporations is undergoing one of the largest public policy shifts in decades.
The Autodesk Tax team is constantly adapting and evolving to new government rules and regulations. We are seeking an individual to join the Autodesk Tax team and lead Autodesk's transfer pricing strategy. We are seeking a candidate who will help drive a culture of accountability and excitement within the tax team. A successful candidate will join a tax team focused on building a world-class tax department. The Director of Transfer Pricing will be responsible for fostering a creative, innovative team environment in which Autodesk's worldwide tax compliance and planning are completed.
Autodesk has a hybrid work environment and you can work anywhere in the US or Europe.
Responsibilities
You will develop global transfer pricing strategy and projects such as business supply chain planning, business restructurings, acquisition integration, etc.
You will Identify new transfer pricing legislation across the globe and understand the potential impact to the Company
You will collaborate with business partners and interact with senior management and executives to develop a deep understanding of Autodesk's business, reconcile with the underlying data and develop a global strategic transfer pricing framework
You will develop transfer pricing controversy strategy and provide audit support for transfer pricing issues including analyzing local financials, identify/anticipate areas of weakness based on functional/risk analysis, and assist with preparation of audit-ready files
You will support M&A, including preparing IP and legal entity valuations and preparing/reviewing intercompany transactions
You will manage transfer pricing documentation process to ensure timely creation of transfer pricing reports on a global basis
You will guide the legal entity forecasting process working with regional and corporate finance teams
You will help lead the tax digitalization of the transfer pricing function
Minimum Qualifications
12+ years or equivalent experience
Degree(s): Master's degree in Economics/Math or Juris Doctorate; CPA/LLM
Deep knowledge of corporate tax including international tax research, compliance and consulting
Considerable knowledge of performing market studies and industry research
Ability to perform financial / economic analyses and build financial valuation models
Experience writing arguments and positions

About Autodesk
Welcome to Autodesk! Amazing things are created every day with our software – from the greenest buildings and cleanest cars to the smartest factories and biggest hit movies. We help innovators turn their ideas into reality, transforming not only how things are made, but what can be made.
 We take great pride in our culture here at Autodesk – our Culture Code is at the core of everything we do. Our values and ways of working help our people thrive and realize their potential, which leads to even better outcomes for our customers.
 When you’re an Autodesker, you can be your whole, authentic self and do meaningful work that helps build a better future for all. Ready to shape the world and your future? Join us!
Benefits
From health and financial benefits to time away and everyday wellness, we give Autodeskers the best, so they can do their best work. Learn more about our benefits in the U.S. by visiting https://benefits.autodesk.com/
Salary transparency
Salary is one part of Autodesk’s competitive compensation package. For U.S.-based roles, we expect a starting base salary between $161,000 and $260,370. Offers are based on the candidate’s experience and geographic location, and may exceed this range. In addition to base salaries, we also have a significant emphasis on annual cash bonuses, commissions for sales roles, stock grants, and a comprehensive benefits package.
Equal Employment Opportunity 
At Autodesk, we're building a diverse workplace and an inclusive culture to give more people the chance to imagine, design, and make a better world. Autodesk is proud to be an equal opportunity employer and considers all qualified applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity, national origin, disability, veteran status or any other legally protected characteristic. We also consider for employment all qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with applicable law.
Diversity & Belonging
We take pride in cultivating a culture of belonging and an equitable workplace where everyone can thrive. Learn more here: https://www.autodesk.com/company/diversity-and-belonging
