Description:
Build the future of data. Join the Snowflake team.
The Snowflake Professional Services Practice Director is the ultimate representation of extreme ownership for his/her designated Region/Vertical.  Operating in an environment of both direct reports and matrixed relationships, the ideal candidate will have a proven track record of successful leadership of Professional Services engagements in consulting or product services companies.
This position brings a mix of responsibilities with multiple areas of critical focus and required competence.  Practice Directors maintain relationships at all levels with Customers, Leadership, Sales Teams, Delivery Teams, Operations Teams, and Key Partners. Practice Directors are expected to sustain KPIs across multiple disciplines including, but not limited to Forecasts, Bookings, Revenue, and Staffing.
RESPONSIBILITIES :
Serving Customers:
Build deep, technical relationships with Customers to ensure Snowflake PS can serve the specific needs of current and future engagements
Coordinates pre-sales scoping of engagements to support customer’s services needs
Accountable for Customer Satisfaction and successful post sales delivery of engagements against scope and timelines in Services statements of work
Partnering with Sales:
Builds and maintains close relationships with Product Sales teams to build a continual pipeline of leads and opportunities for Professional Services and Education within territory
Leads the Professional Services Go-to-Market strategy and the Services and Product Education Sales activities for assigned territory
Provides technical and/or business consultative leadership for a specific practice at the pre- or post- sales level
Communicates pipeline activity to Professional Services leadership frequently on progress toward targets, and leverages executives appropriately and strategically to gain alignment and overcome Customer objections
Accountable for quarterly booking targets for Professional Services and Education
Practice Readiness:
Ensures appropriate levels of specialization in the practice are being achieved by utilizing online and in person training opportunities for the teams
Communicates pipeline activity to the Delivery teams and Resource Management to ensure visibility to upcoming resource needs
Recruits, hires, and drives performance for employees who can help grow and drive Snowflake's Professional Services' strategy, including senior and junior consultants, architects, Practice Managers, and Services Engagement Managers
Proactively provides input into the development of Practices' policies, procedures, and standards
Monitors Resource job performance and provides coaching, counseling, and motivation to maximize practice performance
Coordinates with Delivery Directors and Resource Management to staff Professional Services engagements with appropriate skills
Technical Expertise:
Demonstrates detailed Snowflake product knowledge from the vision of Snowflake and how it serves Customers of all sizes to how we solve for specific technical use cases
Understands the technical complexities of Cloud Computing, the competitive environment, and can confidently address Customer concerns and insecurities around Cloud adoption and migrations
Provides strong consultative skills and understanding of the services engagement model
REQUIREMENTS :
On Day One We Will Expect You To Have: 
Sales Minded individual with 10+ years of experience within the SaaS or cloud computing space, specifically within professional services/ delivery experience
Knowledge of the data warehousing, data management, analytics and/or cloud computing space
Healthcare Life Science Industry experience is a huge plus. 
Experience selling professional services and managing to sales targets, working closely with cross functional teams including sales, pre-sales, legal, marketing and finance 
Experience with documenting scope, deliverables, and timelines in statements of work and managing service delivery to meet the expectations of executed contracts
Comfortable with Salesforce or other leading CRM tools
Experience presenting to internal and external key stakeholders, speaking to both  business and technical audience 
Ability to prioritize projects and deliverables (project management)
KEY PERFORMANCE INDICATORS :
Quarterly practice Professional Services and Education booking targets
Hire to Headcount targets within given timeframes
Snowflake consumption targets
Practice revenue targets
Engagement delivery quality
Effective management of Practice objectives
Every Snowflake employee is expected to follow the company’s confidentiality and security standards for handling sensitive data. Snowflake employees must abide by the company’s data security plan as an essential part of their duties. It is every employee's duty to keep customer information secure and confidential.
The following represents the expected range of compensation for this role:
The estimated base salary range for this role is $183,000 - $273,000.
Additionally, this role is eligible to participate in Snowflake’s bonus and equity plan.
The successful candidate’s starting salary will be determined based on permissible, non-discriminatory factors such as skills, experience, and geographic location. This role is also eligible for a competitive benefits package that includes: medical, dental, vision, life, and disability insurance; 401(k) retirement plan; flexible spending & health savings account; at least 12 paid holidays; paid time off; parental leave; employee assistance program; and other company benefits.
Snowflake is growing fast, and we’re scaling our team to help enable and accelerate our growth. We are looking for people who share our values, challenge ordinary thinking, and push the pace of innovation while building a future for themselves and Snowflake.
How do you want to make your impact?

Build the future of data. Join the Snowflake team.
Our Sales Engineering organization is seeking a Federal Director, Sales Engineering to lead a highly skilled pre-sales team focusing on our  federal practice. In this role you will act as a second line manager, managing a team of SE managers  as well as work directly with our sales team to understand the needs of our customers, strategize on how to navigate sales cycles, lead a team of sales engineers who provide value-based evaluation scenarios including demonstrations, labs, POCs, and pilots to close business. 
Reporting to the Industry VP, Sales Engineering, you will play a hands-on role in building a team of sales engineers and owning the revenue and consumption responsibilities for the group. 
This role requires experience within the federal/DOD/SLED space and to be located in the Greater DC Area. 
IN THIS ROLE YOU WILL GET TO:
Build and lead a team of sales engineers and SE managers who serve as our core product introduction, evaluation and education experts 
Coordinate cross functional dotted line resources to achieve your team goals
Partner with sales leadership to achieve regional quota and consumption targets and ensure customer success
Provide guidance to revenue leaders on sales strategy, product obstacles/gaps and represent the team’s needs to executive staff
Interpret complex problems, create simple solutions and collaborate closely with prospects, channel partners and our sales team to deliver winning solutions 
Collaborate and maintain a close working relationship with product, engineering, sales, marketing and services 
Play an active role in sourcing and screening potential candidates and managing the entire interview process 
Act as a player/coach working with your team on and delivering compelling presentations to customers and prospects
Innovate and implement strategies that will uplevel your teams skills
ON DAY ONE WE WILL EXPECT YOU TO HAVE:
15+ years of industry experience in a pre-sales capacity with 5+ years of direct line management experience (hiring, training and retaining top talent)
Deep rooted knowledge and experience working within the Federal, DOD, SLED space
Located in the Greater DC Area 
Industry expertise within Data Warehousing, Business Intelligence, Data Analytics, Cloud Computing, and/or SaaS Solutions
Knowledge of and experience with the technical aspects of a SQL database ecosystem
Outstanding presentation skills to both technical and executive audiences, whether impromptu on a whiteboard or using presentations and demos
Ability to connect a customer’s specific business problems to Snowflake’s solutions
University degree in computer science, engineering, mathematics or related fields, or equivalent experience preferred 
ABOUT OUR TEAM:
Our Sales Engineers are customer obsessed and we believe in the unique business value we can add.  We value both transparency and uncompromising integrity.  We love to learn, are open to giving and receiving feedback and are passionate about making our clients successful. Our team works to ensure data is accessible, usable and valuable to everyone.
ABOUT SNOWFLAKE:
Snowflake is growing fast and we’re scaling our team to help enable and accelerate our growth. We’re passionate about our people, our customers, our values and our culture! We’re also looking for people with a growth mindset and the pragmatic insight to solve for today while building for the future. And as a Snowflake employee, you will be accountable for supporting and enabling diversity and belonging.
Snowflake started with a clear vision: make modern data warehousing effective, affordable, and accessible to all data users. Because traditional on-premises and cloud solutions struggle with this, Snowflake developed an innovative product with a new built-for-the-cloud architecture that combines the power of data warehousing, the flexibility of big data platforms, and the elasticity of the cloud at a fraction of the cost of traditional solutions.
Snowflake is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, color, gender identity or expression, marital status, national origin, disability, protected veteran status, race, religion, pregnancy, sexual orientation, or any other characteristic protected by applicable laws, regulations and ordinances.

Snowflake employees must abide by the company’s data security plan as an essential part of their duties. It is every employee's duty to keep customer information secure and confidential.
The following represents the expected range of compensation for this role:
This role is eligible to participate in Snowflake's commission plan and it is common for employees in this role to receive total on-target earnings of $275,500 - $383,250. The estimated base salary for this role is $206,625 - $287,438.
Additionally, this role is eligible to participate in Snowflake’s equity plan.
The successful candidate’s starting salary will be determined based on permissible, non-discriminatory factors such as skills, experience, and geographic location. This role is also eligible for a competitive benefits package that includes: medical, dental, vision, life, and disability insurance; 401(k) retirement plan; flexible spending & health savings account; at least 12 paid holidays; paid time off; parental leave; employee assistance program; and other company benefits.

Job Title: Director of Sales Engineering, Media & Entertainment
Description:
Build the future of data. Join the Snowflake team.
Snowflake’s Sales Engineering organization is seeking a Director, Sales Engineering to lead a highly skilled team of SE Managers. You will  work directly with our sales team to understand the needs of our customers, strategize on how to navigate sales cycles, lead a team of sales engineers who provide value-based evaluation scenarios including demonstrations, labs, POCs, and closing business. 
This is a hands-on role in which you will build a sales engineering organization and own the revenue and consumption responsibilities for our Sales Engineering team. This includes the performance and culture of your team & partnership with sales.
IN THIS ROLE YOU WILL GET TO:
Develop and execute selling strategies and identify opportunities to improve team performance
Be an executive sponsor to our strategic customers and ensure the needs of our customers are met
Partner with sales leadership to achieve regional quota and consumption targets
Provide guidance to leaders on sales strategy, product obstacles/gaps, and represent the team’s needs to executives
Collaborate and maintain a close working relationship with product, engineering, sales, marketing, enablement, and services 
Recruit, hire, onboard and manage a diverse  team of managers, supporting employee development and performance
Develop relationships internally to further the needs of the business and drive additional insights to your region
Play an active role in sourcing and screening potential SE candidates to ensure we hire the right talent 
Innovate and implement strategies that will uplevel your teams skills
Location: Denver, CO (preferred), San Mateo, CA
ON DAY ONE WE WILL EXPECT YOU TO HAVE: 
10+ years of industry experience in a pre-sales capacity with 4+ years of direct second line management experience (hiring, training and retaining top diverse  talent)
Industry expertise within Data Warehousing, Business Intelligence, Data Analytics, Cloud Computing, and/or SaaS Solutions
Knowledge of and experience with the technical aspects of a SQL database ecosystem
Outstanding presentation skills to both technical and executive audiences, whether impromptu on a whiteboard or using presentations and demos
Ability to connect a customer’s specific business problems to Snowflake’s solutions
University degree in computer science, engineering, mathematics or related fields, or equivalent experience preferred 
ABOUT OUR TEAM: 
Our Sales Engineers are customer obsessed and we believe in the unique business value we can add.  We value both transparency and uncompromising integrity.  We love to learn, are open to giving and receiving feedback and are passionate about making our customers successful. Our team works to ensure data is accessible, usable and valuable to everyone.

As a Director, of Sales Finance focused on supporting Sales, you will support our GTM strategy in partnership with the VP Finance and the VP Sales and their leadership team. You will play a crucial role in areas such as ARR (Annual Recurring Revenue) forecasting and planning, measuring the success of strategic initiatives, driving analytical insights, deal structuring and approvals, and evaluating resource investments. Your work will play a crucial part in ensuring Snowflake makes sound financial and strategic decisions that drive sustainable business growth. You’ll get senior leadership exposure, focusing real-time on the highest priority business issues, and being plugged into every facet of our business.
RESPONSIBILITIES :
Partner with the Sales leadership team and serve as a thought leader in shaping the financial framework for our Sales, Channel and Product teams.
Drive financial planning, forecasting, and reporting activities for Sales and Channel Teams, set financial goals, and provide regular executive-level reporting to track progress against strategic initiatives.
Conduct advanced analytics, delivering impactful and actionable insights that drive decision-making.
Engage with global sales teams and deal desk on deal structuring and approvals.
Drive ARR Planning for sales, including sales capacity planning, driver based ARR modeling, and short-range and long range plans
Develop monthly spend forecast and drive budget planning process.
Assist in driving standardized Reporting, Forecasting, Budgeting, and Budget vs Actual (BvA) processes and narratives.
Collaborate with business partners in Sales, Sales Strategy, Business Strategy, and Finance on ad-hoc projects and financial modeling.
Develop new processes and tools to drive scalable analysis and insights.
REQUIREMENTS :
10+ years of relevant FP&A experience in a fast-growing tech environment preferred. Sales Finance experience a must, preferably in the technology space.
Prior experience building and analyzing the revenue forecast for Sales functions.
Excellence in financial modeling and analytics. Advanced Excel skills essential
Strong quantitative, organizational and communications skills

Operating in an environment of both direct reports and matrixed relationships, the ideal candidate will have a proven track record of successful leadership of Professional Services engagements in consulting or product services companies.
This position brings a mix of responsibilities with multiple areas of critical focus and required competence.  Practice Directors maintain relationships at all levels with Customers, Leadership, Sales Teams, Delivery Teams, Operations Teams, and Key Partners. Practice Directors are expected to sustain KPIs across multiple disciplines including, but not limited to Forecasts, Bookings, Revenue, and Staffing.
RESPONSIBILITIES :
Serving Customers:
Build deep, technical relationships with Customers to ensure Snowflake PS can serve the specific needs of current and future engagements
Coordinates pre-sales scoping of engagements to support customer’s services needs
Accountable for Customer Satisfaction and successful post sales delivery of engagements against scope and timelines in Services statements of work
Partnering with Sales:
Builds and maintains close relationships with Product Sales teams to build a continual pipeline of leads and opportunities for Professional Services and Education within territory
Leads the Professional Services Go-to-Market strategy and the Services and Product Education Sales activities for assigned territory
Provides technical and/or business consultative leadership for a specific practice at the pre- or post- sales level
Communicates pipeline activity to Professional Services leadership frequently on progress toward targets, and leverages executives appropriately and strategically to gain alignment and overcome Customer objections
Accountable for quarterly booking targets for Professional Services and Education
Practice Readiness:
Ensures appropriate levels of specialization in the practice are being achieved by utilizing online and in person training opportunities for the teams
Communicates pipeline activity to the Delivery teams and Resource Management to ensure visibility to upcoming resource needs

Proactively provides input into the development of Practices' policies, procedures, and standards
Monitors Resource job performance and provides coaching, counseling, and motivation to maximize practice performance
Coordinates with Delivery Directors and Resource Management to staff Professional Services engagements with appropriate skills
Technical Expertise:
Demonstrates detailed Snowflake product knowledge from the vision of Snowflake and how it serves Customers of all sizes to how we solve for specific technical use cases
Understands the technical complexities of Cloud Computing, the competitive environment, and can confidently address Customer concerns and insecurities around Cloud adoption and migrations
Provides strong consultative skills and understanding of the services engagement model
REQUIREMENTS :
On Day One We Will Expect You To Have: 
Sales Minded individual with 10+ years of experience within the SaaS or cloud computing space, specifically within professional services/ delivery experience
Knowledge of the data warehousing, data management, analytics and/or cloud computing space
Healthcare Life Science Industry experience is a huge plus. 
Experience selling professional services and managing to sales targets, working closely with cross functional teams including sales, pre-sales, legal, marketing and finance 
Experience with documenting scope, deliverables, and timelines in statements of work and managing service delivery to meet the expectations of executed contracts
Comfortable with Salesforce or other leading CRM tools
Experience presenting to internal and external key stakeholders, speaking to both  business and technical audience 
Ability to prioritize projects and deliverables (project management)
KEY PERFORMANCE INDICATORS :
Quarterly practice Professional Services and Education booking targets
Hire to Headcount targets within given timeframes
Snowflake consumption targets
Practice revenue targets
Engagement delivery quality

We are looking for a Head of Partner Marketing, someone who is passionate about developing an ecosystem of partners in the cloud industry. In this role, you will own and develop partner marketing strategies, driving pipeline and growth revenue for Japan. You will report to the Senior Director, Field Marketing in Japan.
AS THE HEAD OF PARTNER MARKETING AT SNOWFLAKE YOU WILL:
Develop and work directly with our global partner marketing teams to own programs and executive GTM strategies with partners, including local/global SIs, and technology partners in Japan.
Work closely with our Partner Alliance organization alongside our partners to co-develop a GTM strategy to drive pipeline activation and identify content/positioning to help accelerate the sales cycle.
Develop co-marketing campaigns including email, digital and online/in-person events.
Drive thought leadership, demand generation, and mindshare programs in coordination with partners' marketing teams to target joint customers and prospects.
OUR IDEAL HEAD OF PARTNER MARKETING WILL HAVE:
12+ years of relevant experience in a role focused on building SI partner marketing relationships and executing campaigns for enterprise software and cloud environments.
Bachelor's Degree in, Marketing, Business Administration, or related field.
Familiarity with key technologies in data analytics, ML/AI and solutions space.
Ability to understand and communicate to diverse technical and non-technical audiences.
Demonstrated success in highly collaborative partnerships with other marketing and cross-functional leaders both inside and outside the company.
Hands-on execution ability with effective project and time management.
Project management, prioritization, organizational skills, accuracy in performance and details driven.
Fluent in Japanese and business level English.
 ADDITIONAL CONSIDERATION FOR CANDIDATES WITH THE FOLLOWING:
Solid understanding and experience in the data analytics, and big data marketspace.
Good understanding of cloud infrastructure and cloud applications (e. g. Amazon AWS, Microsoft Azure, Google Cloud, Business Intelligence, Machine Learning and Solution Providers).
Proven success at enterprise software startups focused on data management and analytics.
Hands-on experience with databases, data warehousing, or big data solutions.
Demonstrated creative spark as expressed in content, visual design, messaging, etc

Job Title: Head of Digital Forensic Incident Response
Description:
This is a hands-on role in a dynamic and fast paced environment. In this role you will lead the global team in a follow-the-sun support model responsible for providing digital forensic incident response analysis. You and your team will help develop capabilities to protect Apple today and tomorrow. An ideal candidate is an experienced, highly motivated leader who embraces the opportunity to influence and evangelize security across the company.

If this is you, apply today!

In this role, you will be a vital member of the team — concepting, coordinating, and collaborating frequently in order to bring to life Apple services’ key elements of design and art direction. You’ll craft innovative and inspiring design solutions that meet the requirements outlined in creative briefs, following creative direction of the appropriate Associate Creative Director or Creative Director. You'll plan and direct projects end to end, inspire the team to pursue new creative solutions, and provide guidance to junior creatives. 

Regular reviews of creative work with each group’s Associate Creative Director or Creative Director are part of our workflow. You will be responsible for conducting persuasive creative presentations, gathering feedback on direction, and ensuring work aligns with other activities within Apple’s marketing communications.

Our team strives for consistent delivery of superior design, as well as scaling design solutions in accordance with project constraints and parameters. We're accountable for the successful implementation of creative and art direction on assigned projects in a variety of media for brand campaigns, digital performance campaigns, social, owned Apple channels, and new mediums of communication.

Job Title: Senior Director, Retail Engagement and Marketing, WW Strategy and Programming,
Description:
With the breadth of reach across Apple Retail’s programs and campaigns, you will activate an important lever to help Apple bring its values of sustainability, accessibility, privacy, inclusion and diversity - to our customers and employees. Inclusion is a shared responsibility, and we work together to foster a culture where everyone belongs and is inspired to do their best work.   

You'll manage a team of leaders for Strategic and Editorial Planning, Campaigns, content initiatives, Retail Brand Marketing, Customer Engagement Marketing. These include Today At Apple and Creative Studios, Internal Communication and Learning and Development, working together to craft and share the stories that enrich the lives of both our customers and teams.  

The role requires a deep understanding of Apple Retail’s goals, customer and commercial insights, and marketing and operations. It mandates deep knowledge and thought leadership. Identifying what it takes to engage and market to people in an increasingly complex world, where customers’ choices are infinite, and they face a plethora of messages, propositions and experiences every minute of every day.  

To be successful you will also need to drive collaboration with their counterparts in REM as well as key cross functional and GEO partners to ensure we can deliver to Apple highest standards, globally and at speed.

Job Title: Director of Product Management, Consumer Services - App Store
Description:
- Deliver on a strong portfolio of features that improve and grow customer app discovery and engagement and drive business impact for the App Store

- Define and develop consensus on product vision, strategy, and ongoing optimization for the storefront features, Apple Arcade, and Game Center across cross-functional teams globally 

- Advance the faithful implementation of the product vision and strategy, from managing the feature definition process, to crafting how it’s unveiled to the public 

- Successfully advocate for the prioritization of impactful features on the engineering roadmap and secure key resource commitments among cross functional teams 

- Interact with company executives to build product vision for new features, report on improvements to the customer experience over time, and provide domain expertise

- Have expert knowledge of the field, including competitive and 3rd party products and competitor strategy, including privacy-focused product approaches. Develop a corporate development strategy and suggest M&A activity as needed
Location: Santa Clara Valley (Cupertino), California, United States

Job Title: AIML - Director of Machine Learning Applied Research, Data & ML Innovation
Description:
The Data and Machine Learning Innovation team focuses on innovative technologies,
methodologies, and research to enable amazing user experiences and advance the frontier of
machine learning at Apple. The team works broadly with Machine Learning teams across the
company to advance capabilities. This role is highly multi-functional, and you will collaborate
very closely with various highly skilled machine learning and software development teams to
develop groundbreaking research and solutions for Apple products.

As a Senior Technical Leader, you will:
- Lead teams of machine learning and software engineers to research, build and deliver AI
technologies that enable AI-driven customer-facing products and features.

- Work cross-functionally on a diverse set of exciting problems, collaborate with world-
class software and machine learning engineers and researchers to impact the future of
Apple products.

- Lead research portfolio, help identify long-term ambitious research goals as well as
intermediate milestones, prioritize research that can be applied to Apple’s product development.

- Build and grow inclusive, high-functioning, diverse teams.
Location: Santa Clara Valley (Cupertino), California, United States

Description:
We’re a global organization looking for a Head of LATAM that is consultative, collaborative leader to lead this customer facing team and drive long term business and revenue growth. As a core leader in our global sales organization, your proven record of outstanding customer service, collaboration, and coaching hardworking team members will ensure success for our customers and business in this region.

-  Lead, hire, and coach our LATAM team, to do the best work of their lives.

-  Engage and interact with senior leaders within Ad Platforms to report on progress of go-to-market initiatives. 

-  Meet with key customers and agencies to foster senior relationships & gather market feedback.

-  Collaborate with other departments such as Customer Success, Data Insights, Learning & Development, Sales Operations, & Marketing to ensure alignment on priorities and outcomes. 

-  Excel globally with teammates in sharing takeaways from the region, categories & with go-to-market initiatives.

We’re looking for an experienced UX Writing Editor-in-Chief who is enthusiastic about user experience design. We work every day to create products that enrich people’s lives.  You love words and language, and have strong feelings about style, grammar, tone, and voice. The only thing that rivals your passion for language is your passion for great user experiences. You cannot tolerate poor user interface and experience and you find yourself brainstorming better experiences for products you use. You’re an advocate for clean, alluring UI, and you champion writing and design that supports both the content and the user.  You have years of experience living and breathing UX, and have held positions as a manager for UX Writers, UX Designers, Information Architects, Content Strategists, or similar.  You’re familiar with Apple products, and are a regular user of iCloud, Apple Maps, Apple TV, Apple Music, Apple News, and the App Store. You’re a music and media enthusiast, and love keeping up with pop culture. You enjoy working through the details of complex problems, love logic puzzles, and relish the challenge of untying impossible knots.  You’re good at following a process, but excited by an opportunity to create process for your team where none currently exists.  You enjoy handling multiple products and tasks at once, and know how to effectively lead your time and prioritize your projects. You are good at identifying what information is needed to accomplish team goals, and relish working closely with others in a matrixed organization to get the answers. You take initiative and feel a strong sense of ownership, not just for your team's deliverables, but for the quality of the entire product. You’re confident inserting yourself into discussions to represent yourself or your team, and work hard to ensure your value in the organization is recognized and understood.  You enjoy working with both introverts and strong personalities, technical and detail-oriented people as well as big thinkers and creative types. The thought of establishing working relationships with executives, marketers, producers, engineers, designers, project managers, and other cross functional teams—and helping consolidate their differing feedback to create stunning and professional features and products—excites and motivates you.  Most of all, you’re enthusiastic about seeing where Apple Services products are headed and eager to help craft an amazing user experience for millions of people around the world.

Job Title: Headphones and Accessories Tools & Automation Engineer
Description: Build creative solutions for testing current and next generation products. Drive quality and champion bug fixes, working closely with dev team and analyze the root causes for the issues. Design comprehensive test plans for new features, factoring in technical details and the customer experience. Develop test automation scripts using Python, maintain reports of all automation issues and test results. Collaborate with cross functional teams to get requirements and implement automation feature requests. Bring up, perform regular maintenance and debugging of test setups and scripts.

You will also be working closely with our sales leadership to develop strategies that will help us maximize profits and market share.
The successful candidate should be able to demonstrate excellent strategic planning skills. He/she is also expected to execute marketing initiatives flawlessly and must demonstrate instances where he/she has a proven ability to successfully grow a business. Naturally, the candidate needs to have excellent organizational skills and the ability to effectively collaborate and communicate with key stakeholders within CrowdStrike.
This is a very exciting time for CrowdStrike as we consolidate our position in Americas markets. This key role has remarkable potential for both the company and the successful candidate.
What You'll Do: 
Lead the development of strategic, account based marketing plans to build pipeline and drive revenue goals in our Majors account segment
Collaborate with the business team to uncover insights and strategies to develop and implement marketing and branding strategies for new and existing products, internally and externally
Oversee the implementation of the marketing strategy, creating and executing tailored programs including bespoke in-person/virtual seminars, industry events, meeting maker programs, thought leadership, executive conferences & roundtables

What You’ll Need:

Must be able to demonstrate an understanding in the different cultural dynamics across the North America region.
Skills in digital marketing and related forms of online engagement including progressive profiling and lead nurturing.
Must possess budget management and forecasting skills.
Excellent collaboration skills in working cross-functionally with sales organization, corporate marketing, peers and channel teams. We are looking for a great communicator with good presentation skills.

Job Title: Director, Engineering - Cloud Security Runtime Protection (Remote)
Description:
#WeAreCrowdStrike and our mission is to stop breaches. As a global leader in cybersecurity, our team changed the game. Since our inception, our market leading cloud-native platform has offered unparalleled protection against the most sophisticated cyberattacks. We work on large scale distributed systems, processing over 1 trillion events a day with a petabyte of RAM deployed in our Cassandra clusters - and this traffic is growing daily. We’re looking for people with limitless passion, a relentless focus on innovation and a fanatical commitment to developing and shaping our cybersecurity platform. Consistently recognized as a top workplace, CrowdStrike is committed to cultivating an inclusive, remote-first culture that offers people the autonomy and flexibility to balance the needs of work and life while taking their career to the next level. Interested in working for a company that sets the standard and leads with integrity? Join us on a mission that matters - one team, one fight.
About the Role:
We’re building a welcoming & flexible team that prizes collaboration over competition, one which provides opportunities to learn new skills, mentor junior and senior developers and contribute to the direction of both the team & the products we’re responsible for. This is a high trust environment where we allow team members to manage their own time, take holidays as they need it and reward them with competitive salaries and equity.
 
What You'll Do: 
CrowdStrike is seeking a Director, Engineering for our Cloud Security Runtime Protection team. This critical role in the organization will be responsible for leading the charge on building innovative solutions leveraging Crowdstrike’s world famous sensor, capture data from millions of sensors deployed in sensitive environments and enable sophisticated security detections across a wide variety of workloads. You will be going deep into the internals of Kubernetes, containers, functions and a variety of modern assets in the world of cloud infrastructure. You will help drive and deliver on the technical strategy and roadmap and will be responsible for mentoring the team. CrowdStrike is growing rapidly and you will be instrumental in the hiring, retaining and growth of our world class engineers. You will work cross functionally with your peers in the engineering organization as well as leaders in sales and product. Your impact is not bounded and you will be enabled to engage and collaborate with various teams and ensure your product’s success. We are a remote first company so you must bring your excellent verbal and written communication skills to bear when you are working with your engineering teams and cross functional teams across the globe.
What You'll Need: 
Experience leading teams of senior and junior engineers
Ability to code in languages such as Golang, C/C++ or equivalent
Demonstrated track record of building a strong core engineering team and engineering team management
Familiarity with cyber security and modern technologies like eBPF
Understanding of Kubernetes and its role in cloud computing
Familiarity with cloud computing and deployment of software in the cloud
10+ years of software engineering experience in all phases of a software development lifecycle
Broad grounding in all aspects of distributed systems development: understanding of distributed systems concepts
Solid design and problem solving skills with demonstrated passion for engineering excellence, quality, security and performance
Strong cross-group collaboration and interpersonal communication skills working with a variety of roles including engineering, product management, support and sales engineering
Experience working with remote teams and individuals while ensuring agility and code velocity
Ability to communicate and articulate crisply at all levels from executive staff to engineers
Bonus Points:  
Solid grounding in the technology of at least one cloud environment (AWS, Azure, GCP)
Experience with hybrid cloud environments
Machine learning and data science familiarity and hands on experience
Exposure to/experience with cybersecurity and intelligence

Description:

Since our inception, our market leading cloud-native platform has offered unparalleled protection against the most sophisticated cyberattacks. About the Role: 
CrowdStrike is looking for highly motivated, self-driven, and experienced Regional Sales Director dedicated to making a difference in global security by protecting organizations against the most advanced attackers in the world.
As the Regional Sales Director, you must possess the ability to position our portfolio of next-generation cyber security and threat intelligence capabilities. The successful candidate will also be comfortable articulating CrowdStrike’s GTM strategies to senior customer executives within the assigned territory.  You will have the opportunity to present CrowdStrike’s product capabilities and value to prospects, match our strengths to agency and department needs, and help our partners and clients defeat the adversary.  The successful candidate must have sales leadership experience and executive level contacts across the assigned territory. The candidate must be also to be flexible and adaptable to rapidly changing business situations.  You must be extremely results driven, customer focused, technologically savvy, and innovative at building internal relationships and external partnerships to attack the market with passion!
 This position is a Director-level opportunity within our Field Sales team. We are seeking qualified candidates within: Minnesota, Wisconsin, Illinois, Michigan, Ohio, Indiana, or Iowa

What You'll Do:
Sales and management experience leading a team of senior sales people
Day to day personnel management, pipeline development, territory planning, account planning, forecasting, quota attainment, sales presentations, and short term, mid-term, long-term opportunity management. 
Have a deep network of VAR resellers to drive all pertinent issues related to CrowdStrike sales strategy and goal attainment.
Identify, develop and execute account strategy to close new business opportunities and expanding revenue with customers across the assigned region; independently and cooperatively.
Scope, negotiate and bring to closure agreements to exceed booking and revenue quota targets.
Target and gain access to decision makers in key prospect accounts in the assigned territory.
Collaborate with operative peers across functions (including the Field Sales, Channel, Marketing, Sales Operations, System Engineering, Services, Customer Support, and Product Development) to create visibility with target accounts and drive engagement of target prospects at both the individual contributor and executive level.
Work cooperatively within the partner ecosystem to leverage their established account presence and relationships.
Capture, maintain, and disseminate accurate and relevant prospect information using Salesforce.com/CLARITY and other data analytics tools
MEDDPICC sales methodology experience strongly preferred, not required.
What You'll Need:
5+ years of successful solution sales experience leading a sales team selling cyber security software and/or infrastructure products 
Strong understanding of Cybersecurity, Cloud and SaaS technologies and competitive offerings in the marketplace.
Demonstrated history of exceeding booking and revenue targets.  Successful experience with target account selling, solution selling, and/or consultative sales techniques.
Must be aggressive, a self-starter with an ability to build executive relationships, articulate CrowdStrike’s product and business strategies, and create the demand that makes deals happen. 
Must have an aptitude for understanding how technology products and solutions solve business problems and an ability to explain complicated concepts to a variety of audiences and skill levels.
Strong problem solving skills, ability to analyze complex multivariate problems and use a systematic approach to gain swift resolution.
Recognized experience developing and maintaining relationships with senior executives.
Excellent communication (written and verbal) and presentation skills; both internally and externally.
Strong time management, organizational and decision-making skills.
Ability to work remotely and be able and willing to travel on short notice.
Self-motivated ability to work independently and as part of a team.
Possess the drive to succeed and to participate in the growth of an exciting, fast-paced startup.
BA/BS or equivalent combination of education and experience.

#WeAreCrowdStrike and our mission is to stop breaches. As a global leader in cybersecurity, our team changed the game. We’re looking for people with limitless passion, a relentless focus on innovation and a fanatical commitment to the customer to join us in shaping the future of cybersecurity. Interested in working for a company that sets the standard and leads with integrity? Join us on a mission that matters - one team, one fight.
About the Role: 
As CrowdStrike’s head of ServiceNow Applications, you will develop an organization designed to create the infrastructure and systems that enable business operations teams to scale and achieve process excellence. Success will require partnering with key stakeholders to ensure our systems and practices support CrowdStrike’s overall Business Strategy. You will be responsible for achieving the required functionality, ease of execution and scalability in the platform while supporting multiple business units, including, but not limited to: Legal, Information Security, Finance, Human Resources, Project Management Office, and Information Technology Operations. 
What You’ll Do: 
Partner, collaborate and develop strong relationships with business unit leaders to understand organizational needs in support of the digital strategy, corporate objectives, and major functional objectives
Perform gap assessments, formulate investment proposals, and partner with the PMO organization to develop roadmaps that optimally reflect corporate priorities and balancing of resources
Manage demand and drive execution of a portfolio of projects through effective prioritization, planning (e.g. clear definition of objectives, success criteria, risks, scope, timelines, cost), vendor management and oversight
Develop, document, and maintain process, system, integration and data architectures for the ServiceNow eco-systems
Utilize best practices for defining business capabilities, understanding core requirements, and managing vendors for implementation and ongoing support
Serve as the IT owner for ServiceNow platform and partner cross functionally to ensure systems integrate and operate as designed and intended to support global process execution
Implement integrated and automated processes that drive efficiency and be audit ready at all times; sustain knowledge continuity through appropriate level of documentation, cross training and vendor management
What You’ll Need: 
10+ years of proven experience as an IT product owner leading a ServiceNow development team with a track record of continued growth and responsibilities 
15+ years of progressively increasing responsibility in IT applications with a minimum of 4 years partnering and working with multiple business functions on the implementation of new capabilities enabled by IT 
Bachelor’s degree in related field; MBA or similar certification is a plus

Job Title: Regional Sales Director, Mid Enterprise, Texas (Remote)
Description:
#WeAreCrowdStrike and our mission is to stop breaches. As a global leader in cybersecurity, our team changed the game. Since our inception, our market leading cloud-native platform has offered unparalleled protection against the most sophisticated cyberattacks. We’re looking for people with limitless passion, a relentless focus on innovation and a fanatical commitment to the customer to join us in shaping the future of cybersecurity. Consistently recognized as a top workplace, CrowdStrike is committed to cultivating an inclusive, remote-first culture that offers people the autonomy and flexibility to balance the needs of work and life while taking their career to the next level. Interested in working for a company that sets the standard and leads with integrity? Join us on a mission that matters - one team, one fight.
About the Role: 
CrowdStrike is looking for highly motivated, self-driven, and experienced Regional Sales Director dedicated to making a difference in global security by protecting organizations against the most advanced attackers in the world.
As the Regional Sales Director, you must possess the ability to position our portfolio of next-generation cyber security and threat intelligence capabilities. The successful candidate will also be comfortable articulating CrowdStrike’s GTM strategies to senior customer executives within the assigned territory.  You will have the opportunity to present CrowdStrike’s product capabilities and value to prospects, match our strengths to agency and department needs, and help our partners and clients defeat the adversary.  The successful candidate must have sales leadership experience and executive level contacts across the assigned territory. The candidate must be also to be flexible and adaptable to rapidly changing business situations.  You must be extremely results driven, customer focused, technologically savvy, and innovative at building internal relationships and external partnerships to attack the market with passion!
 This position is a Director-level opportunity within our Field Sales team. We are seeking qualified candidates in any major Texas metro area.

What You'll Do:
Sales and management experience leading a team of senior sales people
Day to day personnel management, pipeline development, territory planning, account planning, forecasting, quota attainment, sales presentations, and short term, mid-term, long-term opportunity management. 
Have a deep network of VAR resellers to drive all pertinent issues related to CrowdStrike sales strategy and goal attainment.
Identify, develop and execute account strategy to close new business opportunities and expanding revenue with customers across the assigned region; independently and cooperatively.
Scope, negotiate and bring to closure agreements to exceed booking and revenue quota targets.
Target and gain access to decision makers in key prospect accounts in the assigned territory.
Collaborate with operative peers across functions (including the Field Sales, Channel, Marketing, Sales Operations, System Engineering, Services, Customer Support, and Product Development) to create visibility with target accounts and drive engagement of target prospects at both the individual contributor and executive level.
Work cooperatively within the partner ecosystem to leverage their established account presence and relationships.
Capture, maintain, and disseminate accurate and relevant prospect information using Salesforce.com/CLARITY and other data analytics tools
MEDDPICC sales methodology experience strongly preferred, not required.
What You'll Need:
5+ years of successful solution sales experience leading a sales team selling cyber security software and/or infrastructure products 
Strong understanding of Cybersecurity, Cloud and SaaS technologies and competitive offerings in the marketplace.
Demonstrated history of exceeding booking and revenue targets.  Successful experience with target account selling, solution selling, and/or consultative sales techniques.
Must be aggressive, a self-starter with an ability to build executive relationships, articulate CrowdStrike’s product and business strategies, and create the demand that makes deals happen. 
Must have an aptitude for understanding how technology products and solutions solve business problems and an ability to explain complicated concepts to a variety of audiences and skill levels.
Strong problem solving skills, ability to analyze complex multivariate problems and use a systematic approach to gain swift resolution.
Recognized experience developing and maintaining relationships with senior executives.
Excellent communication (written and verbal) and presentation skills; both internally and externally.
Strong time management, organizational and decision-making skills.
Ability to work remotely and be able and willing to travel on short notice.
Self-motivated ability to work independently and as part of a team.
Possess the drive to succeed and to participate in the growth of an exciting, fast-paced startup.
BA/BS or equivalent combination of education and experience.

We’re looking for people with limitless passion, a relentless focus on innovation and a fanatical commitment to the customer to join us in shaping the future of cybersecurity. About the Role:
As a Regional Sales Director, you will manage all sales activities within the SLED West Region for CrowdStrike Products and Services. This challenging and high-visibility position provides leadership and management oversight to the Regional Sales Managers. You develop long-term strategies and shorter term plans to meet aggressive revenue goals. You must be extremely results driven, customer focused, technologically savvy, and skilled at building internal relationships and external partnerships.
This position is available to candidates located ideally in California.
What You'll Do:
Provide management oversight to Regional Sales Managers within the Region to drive all pertinent issues related to sales strategy and goal attainment.
Participate in strategic planning sessions with the sales management team on a quarterly and annual basis.
Communicate corporate strategy to employees within your Region.
Plan and direct activities including planning and implementing forecasts, marketing program development, relationship development, customer satisfaction and collateral material development and distribution.
Establish short-term and long-term goals and quotas in line with corporate objectives.
Identify needed resources for supporting sales strategy and develop a proposed budget for Senior Management review.
Identify and qualify important Enterprise sales opportunities at the management level.
Act as coach, mentor and educator to all Regional Sales Managers within your Region.
Select, develop, and evaluate personnel to ensure sales goals are met.
Keep senior leadership informed of key issues and changes which may impact expected business results.
What You'll Need:
Strong verbal and written communications skills, including presentation skills.
Passionate relationship building and negotiating skills.
Ability to work collaboratively with functional peers across functions including the Channel, Marketing, Sales Operations, System Engineering, Services Customer Support, and Product Development.
Strong understanding of Cybersecurity technologies and competitive offerings in the marketplace.
Experience with target account selling, solution selling, and/or consultative sales techniques.
An aptitude for understanding how technology products and solutions solve business problems.
Experience as a successful Regional Sales Manager with a track record of exceeding assigned sales quotas in contiguous, multiple years.
Demonstrated experience working with Sales organizations and technical teams.
Experience with developing budgets and predicting project costs.
A demonstrated ability to manage professional level employees.
Ability to foster a positive work environment and attitude.
Ability to work remotely and able and willing to travel on short notice, up to 50% of the time.
Management:
This individual uses their management and technical skills to develop, modify and execute company policies that affect operations and may have a companywide effect.
The scope of responsibility for this person includes implementing strategic policies and establishing and adhering to budgets, schedules, work plans, and performance requirements.
This individual manages the coordination of activities of a Region, with full responsibility for oversight in terms of costs, methods and staffing.
May act as an advisor or subject matter expert.
Sets revenue targets and ensures targets are met.
Education and Experience
A minimum of 8 years of experience as an individual contributor and 1 to 5 years as a people manager is required.
Experience as a "front line" sales manager leading a sales team selling into State & Local Government and Education accounts highly preferred.
A Bachelor’s degree required; or equivalent experience is required. A Master’s degree is desirable.

#WeAreCrowdStrike and our mission is to stop breaches. As a global leader in cybersecurity, our team changed the game. Since our inception, our market leading cloud-native platform has offered unparalleled protection against the most sophisticated cyberattacks. We’re looking for people with limitless passion, a relentless focus on innovation and a fanatical commitment to the customer to join us in shaping the future of cybersecurity. Consistently recognized as a top workplace, CrowdStrike is committed to cultivating an inclusive, remote-first culture that offers people the autonomy and flexibility to balance the needs of work and life while taking their career to the next level. Interested in working for a company that sets the standard and leads with integrity? Join us on a mission that matters - one team, one fight.
About the Role:
We are looking for a Director of Product Marketing to own the positioning, messaging, and go-to-market strategy for CrowdStrike’s IT Automation suite of offerings. This key role will partner closely with our product management, business development, marketing, and sales teams to bring exciting new innovations to market, drive value to our customers, and grow our position as the cybersecurity platform of choice for stopping breaches, as well as unify IT and security.
You will work with the best in the business, and we need you to bring your creativity, imagination and energy to this high-profile position. We also need you to have a comprehensive understanding of multiple domains across IT Operations and cybersecurity as well as strong knowledge of IT management, endpoint management,  security operations, and risk/compliance  products and related technologies. You’ll need to develop clear and crisp messaging and positioning for Falcon for IT, other related products, and the overall CrowdStrike Falcon platform. 
We are at a pivotal moment, poised to disrupt the legacy IT operations market and truly unified security and IT in a single AI-native platform. We need your passion and marketing leadership to capitalize on this unique opportunity and achieve our full potential.
What You’ll Do: 
Messaging & Positioning: Create compelling, differentiated messaging and positioning, with a clear understanding of the target customer and the core capabilities of the offering.
Business Growth: Drive awareness, adoption, and growth of the Falcon for IT module and related modules across the CrowdStrike Falcon platform.
PMM Leadership: Plan, implement, and manage our overall product marketing strategy for Falcon for IT and associated product and service offerings.
GTM Leadership: Engage with cross-functional teams to help design, plan and execute the go-to-market strategy that drives measurable results.
Content Creation: Develop fresh content including collateral, thought leadership assets and solution presentations, website content, videos, blogs, by-lined articles and more to execute communication strategies and accelerate the buyer's journey.
Sales Enablement: Work closely with sales and alliances teams to ensure the value proposition, assets, training, support structures, and incentive plans are all in place for a strong sales motion in line with our product and ecosystem capabilities.
Market and Competitive Intelligence: Be the expert on target buyers, market trends, and competitive offerings across the cybersecurity landscape and how this intersects with our offerings. Use this to drive differentiation and influence overall planning.
Trusted Evangelist: Serve as an evangelist for our products through thought leadership and blogging, social media, and public speaking.
What You’ll Need:
15+ years of cybersecurity product marketing experience strongly preferred.
Bachelor's degree in business, marketing, or engineering preferred. MBA from a top tier program is recommended, but not required.
Very strong written communication and presentation skills.
Excellent people skills to interact with staff, colleagues, cross-functional teams and third parties.
Self-motivation, initiative, and resourcefulness to effectively manage multiple projects simultaneously.
Passion about cybersecurity and ability to deliver in the face of a challenge.
Strong cross-functional collaboration skills and comfort in the spotlight of high-visibility initiatives.
Ability to create clear and compelling messages as well as willingness to roll up the sleeves to create externally-facing assets or internal deliverables.
Strong presentation skills with ability to educate and inspire small groups and conference audiences.
Bonus Points: 
High-tech, start-up, rapid growth and/or publicly traded company experience.
Love our business. CrowdStrike is a leader in cybersecurity. We don't have a mission statement. We are on a mission to protect our customers from breaches. You must be genuinely committed to our mission and eager to learn the details of our business.

Since our inception, our market leading cloud-native platform has offered unparalleled protection against the most sophisticated cyberattacks. We’re looking for people with limitless passion, a relentless focus on innovation and a fanatical commitment to the customer to join us in shaping the future of cybersecurity. Interested in working for a company that sets the standard and leads with integrity? Join us on a mission that matters - one team, one fight.
About the Role:
We are seeking a Director of Competitive Marketing to run the  CrowdStrike competitive marketing team. Reporting directly to the Sr. Director of Technical and Competitive Marketing, this role will continuously monitor the ever-evolving competitive landscape, develop highly differentiated, sharp competitive messaging and positioning and work cross-functionally across marketing and sales teams to ensure these teams are kept informed of major competitive developments and CrowdStrike products are effectively positioned relative to the competition.
 This role will align to the competitive landscape for the key and rapidly expanding security markets that CrowdStrike services—and the endpoint security landscape in particular. Importantly, you will be  responsible for leading a world class competitive marketing team to ensure sharp and consistent competitive messaging across our product lines, while empowering the team to excel in their respective roles. 
 What You’ll Do:
Responsibility and Ownership: Take full ownership and accountability for the competitive marketing  program, from defining goals and KPIs, to quarterly reporting and measuring its success, while maintaining accountability throughout.
Demonstrated Capacity to Handle Multiple Projects: Proven track record of effectively managing and executing numerous competitive projects concurrently.
Crafting Sharp Competitive Positioning and Messaging: Develop concise and compelling competitive positioning and messaging to serve as the cornerstone for internal and outbound competitive sales assets, encompassing web copy, presentations, competitive displacement campaigns, and press releases.
Content Creation: Create essential sales tools to support the selling process, including battle cards, kill sheets, customer-facing competitive assets, feature and positioning comparisons, white papers, and more.
Sales Enablement: Empower sales, marketing, and partner audiences to effectively position and differentiate CrowdStrike’s offerings from competitors across various solutions.
Strategic Sales Support: Offer strategic support on competitive sales deals, leveraging expertise in competitor-specific issues.
Competitive Analysis and Insight Sharing: Analyze competitive products and services, extracting insights and sharing them internally and externally through presentations and content. Leverage deep product and market expertise to clearly articulate how CrowdStrike addresses customer use cases better than the competition.
Contribution to Product and Go-to-Market Decision Making: Partner with Sales, Product Management, other Competitive Intelligence professionals, and broader Marketing teams to contribute to critical product and go-to-market decision making.
Win-Loss Analysis: Assist in regular win-loss analysis with sales enablement to enhance competitive conversion rates.
What You’ll Need:
Bachelor’s degree or higher in a relevant field.
Minimum of 12-15 years of experience (or more) in the Cyber Security market, with a strong focus on endpoint security, identity protection, and cloud security. 
At least 5 years of relevant work experience is preferred. Ideal candidates will have experience in at least two of the following areas: product marketing, solutions marketing, competitive intelligence, technical marketing, sales engineering/pre-sales, or product management.
Minimum of 5 years of experience in managing a team of 3 or more competitive professionals.
Excellent writing skills: Demonstrated ability to craft sharp and concise competitive messaging. Ability to distill complex technical concepts into actionable field guidance and executive summaries.
Superior communication skills, including experience presenting to senior and executive-level management.
Strong people and project management skills required to effectively lead projects and engage with staff, colleagues, cross-functional teams, and third parties.

Job Title: Regional Sales Director, NG SIEM (Remote, West Coast)
Description:
#WeAreCrowdStrike and our mission is to stop breaches. As a global leader in cybersecurity, our team changed the game. Since our inception, our market leading cloud-native platform has offered unparalleled protection against the most sophisticated cyberattacks. We’re looking for people with limitless passion, a relentless focus on innovation and a fanatical commitment to the customer to join us in shaping the future of cybersecurity. Consistently recognized as a top workplace, CrowdStrike is committed to cultivating an inclusive, remote-first culture that offers people the autonomy and flexibility to balance the needs of work and life while taking their career to the next level. Interested in working for a company that sets the standard and leads with integrity? Join us on a mission that matters - one team, one fight.
About the Role: 
Must live in the Western Region in order to be considered.
We are seeking a Regional Sales Director to oversee our Americas West Next Gen-SIEM business. This challenging and high-visibility position provides leadership and management oversight to the NG SIEM specialists. You will develop long-term strategies and shorter term plans to meet aggressive revenue goals. You must be extremely results driven, customer focused, technologically savvy, and skilled at building internal relationships and external partnerships.
What You'll Do: 
Provide management oversight to sales specialists within the Region to drive all pertinent issues related to sales strategy and goal attainment.
Participate in strategic planning sessions with the sales management team on a quarterly and annual basis.
Communicate corporate strategy to employees within your team.
Plan and direct activities including planning and implementing forecasts, marketing program development, relationship development, customer satisfaction and collateral material development and distribution.
Establish short-term and long-term goals and quotas in line with objectives.
Identify needed resources for supporting sales strategy and develop a proposed budget for Senior Management review.
Select, develop, and evaluate personnel to ensure sales goals are met.
Keep senior leadership informed of key issues and changes which may impact expected business results.
What You'll Need: 
Background in selling Log and Security Management, especially SaaS products is a plus.
Technical aptitude and ability to learn new concepts quickly.
Ability to sell in direct touch approach and via the channel.
Strong verbal and written communications skills, including presentation skills.
Passionate relationship building and negotiating skills.
Ability to work collaboratively with functional peers across functions including the Channel, Marketing, Sales Operations, System Engineering, Services Customer Support, and Product Development.
Strong understanding of Security management technologies and competitive offerings in the marketplace.
Experience with target account selling, solution selling, and/or consultative sales techniques.
An aptitude for understanding how technology products and solutions solve business problems.
Demonstrated experience working with Sales organizations and technical teams.
MEDDPICC sales methodology experience strongly preferred.
Experience with developing budgets and predicting project costs.
A demonstrated ability to manage professional level employees.
Ability to foster a positive work environment and attitude.
Ability to work remotely and able and willing to travel.
Management:
This individual uses their management and technical skills to develop, modify and execute company policies that affect operations and may have a companywide effect.
The scope of responsibility for this person includes implementing strategic policies and establishing and adhering to budgets, schedules, work plans, and performance requirements.
This individual manages the coordination of activities of a Region, with full responsibility for oversight in terms of costs, methods and staffing.
May act as an advisor or subject matter expert.
Sets revenue targets and ensures targets are met.
Hire, train and manage a team of highly motivated and successful senior sales professionals.
Successfully forecast team revenue numbers.
Prepare and execute a thorough business plan.
Reporting on sales activity and forecast to senior sales management.
Education and Experience:
A minimum of 8 years of experience as an individual contributor and 1 to 5 years as a people manager is required.
Experience in leading/managing senior sales teams with a complex product and solution sales approach is required.
A Bachelor’s degree required; or equivalent experience is required. A Master’s degree is desirable.

#LI-SL1

Remote-first culture
Market leader in compensation and equity awards
Competitive vacation and flexible working arrangements 
Comprehensive and inclusive health benefits
Physical and mental wellness programs

Offices with stocked kitchens when you need to fuel innovation and collaboration

By embracing the diversity of our people, we achieve our best work and fuel innovation - generating the best possible outcomes for our customers and the communities they serve.

Job Title: Sr. Director, HR Technology Operational Effectiveness & Incident Management
Senior Director, Continuous Improvement and LEAN Practices
Vice President, Finance & Accounting, Mobility Fleet Services
Description:
Description
Based in Indianapolis, this role is the most senior finance leader in Mobility Fleet Services and will provide strategic and financial leadership across the $800M+ organization.  As a trusted leader, this critical role will be uniquely positioned to collaborate with executives across all parts of the business.   This experienced Finance Leader will be responsible for the administrative, accounting, financial, and risk management operations of our company. In addition, it will also contribute to the development of our financial and operational strategy, KPIs, and the ongoing development and monitoring of financial systems.
This role will partner with business and finance leaders to influence and drive both topline and bottom-line profitable growth within Fleet Services. It will provide the necessary thought leadership to effectively analyze, assess, and communicate financial results, risks, and opportunities; the role has primary ownership for telling the Fleet Services story. In addition to finance and accounting responsibilities, this role may also have a leadership role in business development, real estate/facilities, risk management, legal, supply chain, etc.
This position is responsible for the strategy and operational execution of the accounting operations of the Company encompassing financial transaction processing, financial close, accounting policy and procedures and compliance with and ensuring the effectiveness of our internal controls.  The VP ensures the accurate and timely preparation of financial data in the ERP general ledger in accordance with the US GAAP, and serves as the primary point for process certification of Company Accounting results.

Transformational leadership is essential to success in this position; this will include defining the roles and expectations of the future finance organization, effectively communicating the vision and leading a team of leaders to move the team to the future state.  A focus on continuous improvement including the enhancement of financial and operational processes, policies, and procedures is essential to success in this position. This includes partnering across the broader organization and with key business stakeholders to optimize upstream and downstream processes and integrate improvements into operating plans and goals.  
Ongoing organizational and individual development within the finance organization is another critical success factor including the ability to transform and adapt the finance organization to the Company’s shifting business model and strategies.  
Sets and executes the long-term strategy and appropriate organizational structure for the finance organization function.  Plans and directs Fleet Services’ overall financial plans and policies and recommends and facilitates the implementation of all financial policies of the company.
Align leadership around financial commitments, key investments, risks & opportunities, and performance.
Provides direction on procedures and systems necessary to maintain proper records and adequate accounting controls.  Establishes policy related to accounts payable, accounts receivables, credit, and collections, accounting and financial reporting in compliance with GAAP and other Federal and State regulations.
Consolidate the month end close results, provide P&L and capital spend oversight, deliver monthly financial and KPI reporting, modeling, and analysis to explain drivers & trends, identify risks & opportunities.
Responsible for organizing, leading, and directing the budget function; leads the analysis of the consolidated budget plan and monitoring of actual performance against budget.
Provide financial reporting, KPI trend analysis, business case modeling, resource capacity and investment planning, expertise to business partners and executive leadership to make informed strategic business decisions.
Analyzes general economic, business, and financial conditions in the marketplace and their impact on the company’s financial policies and operations. Adheres to the law and to company policies
Analyzes and recommends acquisition and growth opportunities.
Responsible for supply chain policies and procedures to ensure efficient flow of equipment, parts and related goods and services and appropriate inventory levels maintained. 
Lead, coach, and develop team members to perform at a consistent high-level, preparing them to meet the accountabilities of their current positions and their career goals.
Ability to travel <30%
Knowledge, Skills & Experience:
BS/BA in finance/accounting degree required combined with 16+ years relevant experience, OR Master’s Degree (desirable) and 14 years experience, OR Ph.D. degree with 11 years experience.
Minimum10 years in a leadership role
Proven P&L experience in a general management or operations role with progressive increased responsibility required.  Prior working experience as a CFO preferred.
Strong communication skills with multiple levels of leadership and ability to drive initiatives and influence decisions within a matrix organization including corporate leadership.  
Ability to work in fast paced, start-up, entrepreneurial environment with proven time management, prioritization, and execution experience.
Able to clearly communicate complex, technical concepts, and opportunities to functional and executive leaders in a simple way
A spirit of curiosity. Interested in obtaining deep knowledge of Cox Automotive businesses and products to drive improvement. Attention to detail.
Innovative and imaginative. Relentlessly seeks creative solutions to all problems
Able to build relationships across boundaries and with peers. Experience driving alignment and marshaling resources across disparate organizations and functions to reach business goals.
Demonstrated ability to solve complex financial and analytical problems, with specific expertise in financial modeling, statistical methods, business case analysis, and benchmarking.
Advanced Excel and financial modeling skills are essential, with Oracle, Hyperion Planning, OneStream, Power BI, Tableau, and related applications experience strongly preferred.  
Superior business acumen and polished presentation skills with advanced PowerPoint experience required.  
Understanding of Generally Accepted Accounting Principles (GAAP) 
#LI-141

Drug Testing:
To be employed in this role, you'll need to clear a pre-employment drug test. Cox Automotive does not currently administer a pre-employment drug test for marijuana for this position. However, we are a drug-free workplace, so the possession, use or being under the influence of drugs illegal under federal or state law during work hours, on company property and/or in company vehicles is prohibited.
About Cox Automotive
At Cox Automotive, people of every background are driven by their passion for mobility, innovation and community. We transform the way the world buys, sells, owns and uses cars, accelerating the industry with global powerhouse brands like Autotrader, Kelley Blue Book, Manheim and more. What’s more, we do it all with an emphasis on employee growth and happiness. Drive your future forward and join Cox Automotive today! 
About Cox
Cox empowers employees to build a better future and has been doing so for over 120 years. With exciting investments and innovations across transportation, communications, cleantech and healthcare, our family of businesses – which includes Cox Automotive and Cox Communications – is forging a better future for us all. Ready to make your mark? Join us today! 
----------
Benefits of working at Cox may include health care insurance (medical, dental, vision), retirement planning (401(k)), and paid days off (sick leave, parental leave, flexible vacation/wellness days, and/or PTO). For more details on what benefits you may be offered, visit our benefits page.
Cox is an Equal Employment Opportunity employer - All qualified applicants/employees will receive consideration for employment without regard to that individual’s age, race, color, religion or creed, national origin or ancestry, sex (including pregnancy), sexual orientation, gender, gender identity, physical or mental disability, veteran status, genetic information, ethnicity, citizenship, or any other characteristic protected by law. Cox provides reasonable accommodations when requested by a qualified applicant or employee with disability, unless such accommodations would cause an undue hardship.
Statement to ALL Third-Party Agencies and Similar Organizations: Cox accepts resumes only from agencies with which we formally engage their services. Please do not forward resumes to our applicant tracking system, Cox employees, Cox hiring manager, or send to any Cox facility. Cox is not responsible for any fees or charges associated with unsolicited resumes.
