Job Title: Sr. Director, Enterprise HR Technology Portfolio

Description:
Equifax is where you can power your possible. If you want to achieve your true potential, chart new paths, develop new skills, collaborate with bright minds, and make a meaningful impact, we want to hear from you.
The Sr. Director of Global Physical Security reports to the SVP, Physical Security, Investigations and Crisis Management, providing leadership over an established Physical Security program. As the subject matter expert in physical security you will own an enterprise standard that is defined by a set of controls and technical requirements. Accountable for all physical protection system controls globally, including design, implementation, performance, and related compliance protocols. You will lead a small team of physical security managers while influencing, building and maintaining collaborative partnerships with Real Estate, Sourcing, Infrastructure, Finance, and Business Leadership teams.
Must be flexible and enjoy traveling (50%), as the position requires on call 24 hours a day, seven days a week 
Equifax has a hybrid work schedule that allows for 2 days of remote work (Monday/Friday), with three days onsite (Tuesday/Wednesday/Thursday). The candidate will be required to work from Equifax’s Alpharetta (Atlanta) location.     
Sponsorship is not available for this position.
What you will do 
Gather applicable metrics and report on security risks and initiatives affecting physical systems and controls.
Conduct Physical Security testing, including assessments, surveys, and penetration testing, tracking and remediating issues in accordance with SLAs.
Configuration and administration of physical access control, video surveillance, and interrelated systems.
Management of the physical and technical integration and secure decommissioning of global protection systems.
Develop procedures and practices to protect employees and physical assets.
Provides on-the-job guidance and assists others in identifying the skills needed to complete tasks effectively and efficiently.
Develop and maintain positive working relationships with others; support the team to reach common goals; listen and respond appropriately to the concerns of other employees and business unit management.
Respond to, investigate, and manage security and safety related incidents.
Perform additional duties and projects as assigned by management.
What experience you will need 
Bachelor's degree strongly preferred, but will consider applicable and equivalent combination of education and experience.
7+ years experience in physical security, preferably in a global environment. 
3+ years experience managing physical security projects.
Experience with enterprise physical security applications (CCURE, Avigilon).
Experience effectively responding to incidents, monitoring assets, and communicating to a range of audiences utilizing various channels, including mass notification tools.
Verifiable experience in the design and project management of security control installations, integrations, and decommissioning of new and existing facilities.
Demonstrated experience managing security integration vendors and agreements. 
Proven experience in conducting Request For Proposals (RFP) for security vendors.
Experience conducting Physical Security Assessments and Physical PenTests.
Ability and willingness to learn new tools and processes.
Ability to deliver on commitments on time.
Ability to formulate decisions based on business and technical knowledge.
Superb analytical, documentation, and communication skills are a must.
Incident Response Management; and/or Experience working within a global security role.
Working knowledge of NIST, ISO, GDPR, and PCI standards and their risk implications around physical security requirements.
Excellent oral and written communication skills with ability to interact effectively with a diverse management and employee base.
Position continually requires demonstrated integrity, honesty, poise, tact, and diplomacy.
Excellent organizational, interpersonal and leadership skills with ability to plan, coordinate and manage staff and operations.             
Insatiable curiosity challenging established norms (think outside the box).
Must be flexible and enjoy traveling (50%), as the position requires on call 24 hours a day, seven days a week 
What could set you apart 
Experience working in a Global environment.
Multilingual.
Proficient with Google Workspace, Jira, ServiceNow.
Certified Protection Professional (CPP).

What You'll Do:
Facilitate, coordinate, and generate business solutions proposals for existing and new clients
Support the end-to-end proposal development for multi-service/multi-business unit offerings with potential high complexity and high strategic importance to our business. The end-to-end process includes project management, proposal development, compliance matrix preparation and adherence, team coordination to meet internal deadlines, organize and schedule status reviews and color team reviews, and submission of all proposals within prescribed client timeline
Assist in developing win themes and ensure themes are present and consistent throughout responses; provide a consistent voice to the response
Use Project Management skills to provide overall management and direction of a bid response by securing necessary commitments, provide visibility of project deliverables, and escalate as necessary to ensure that timelines are met
Maintain adherence to company policies and procedures with regard to proposal preparation
Perform detailed compliance assessment of client RFX requirements against current and future product capabilities
Provide strategy and management for overall RFX response content and messaging based on client objectives
Produce compelling first draft cover letters, executive summaries, and value proposition statements adhering to client requirements
Ensure answers are relevant and written well to present one voice throughout the document
Ensure proposals and bids are compliant with agency specifications and ensure quality control throughout the proposal process under tight deadlines
Manage post-proposal analysis of submitted RFX documents
Design and deliver proposal development content and tools for sales teams to use when responding to proactive proposals
Engage in peer reviews with other Proposal Development Team members
Engage in additional project work required by the Proposal Development Team and/or the Strategic Growth Initiatives and Business Excellence team (SGI & BE)
What Experience You Need:
Bachelor’s degree or equivalent experience
Minimum 7+ years of commercial and government proposal management experience
Proposal development certification (APMP)
Ability to work out of Equifax offices in St. Louis MO, Atlanta GA, or Reston VA
Ability to travel up to 10%
What Could Set You Apart:
Project management certification (PMP) preferred
Strong proposal management experience with large enterprise organizations and multiple federal and state agencies is required
Ability to interpret complex documents and understand and analyze requirements
Superior project management skills to effectively deliver an on-time response from multiple team inputs
Exceptional facilitation, organization and communication skills (written and oral); including proficiency in Google Workspace, Microsoft Office Suite and Adobe applications
Compelling writing ability to convey the best possible solution for the client, including draft cover letters, executive summaries, and value proposition statements
Ability to create a cohesive voice for a multi-member team to ensure quality and timely winning proposals
Ability to work in a fast-paced, deadline driven environment and manage multiple initiatives

The Senior Director - Business Transformation is responsible for driving business process transformation strategy utilizing problem solving methodologies and applying people / process  / technology / data solutions.  The ideal candidate will have a strong focus on understanding customer needs and developing insights on key Equifax processes and products. This person will be highly motivated to enable revenue growth, increase customer satisfaction, and provide greater productivity. The Senior Director- Business Transformation will bring their prior experience leveraging Artificial Intelligence (AI) technologies such as: Machine Learning, Natural Language Processing (NLP), Robotic Process Automation (RPA), Predictive Analytics- in order to analyze data, automate tasks, and make informed decisions to optimize various processes at Equifax.
This role is located in St Louis, and will require working a hybrid schedule in our office 3 days per week.
What you’ll do
Identify net new value opportunities for customers and revenue impact for Equifax by understanding internal and external value streams.
Act as mentor and catalyst for sales teams to embrace customer value mapping to expose opportunities for product innovation and cross sell / upsell strategies.
Lead large scale process transformation activity as the SME, including LEAN and Customer Journey Mapping, to ensure alignment with new business concepts and technologies.
Identify, recommend and implement automation solutions, updating processes where applicable. Incorporate process design, process risk assessment, piloting, and data analysis and reporting.
Create strategic roadmaps and execute transformational change across multiple functional areas, large BU’s, regions or the enterprise.
Understand, analyze, and provide strategic consultation to resolve highly complex business problems using scalable and sustainable solutions.
Establish, monitor and communicate measures of success, plans, status, issues and risks to team members, stakeholders and senior level management.
What experience you need
7-10 years experience leading large scale, complex, cross-functional initiatives
7-10 years demonstrated expertise in process mapping/discovery and customer experience journey
Minimum 1 year experience leveraging Artificial Intelligence (AI) technologies such as: Machine Learning, Natural Language Processing (NLP), Robotic Process Automation (RPA), Predictive Analytics- in order to analyze data, automate tasks, and make informed decision to optimize various processes within the company.
Bachelors degree or equivalent experience required
Travel up to 25%
What could set you apart
Proficiency in a wide variety of software packages valued in process transformation  (Intelligent automation, data analysis, process mapping, business process management, project management, knowledge management, etc.)
Lean Six Sigma Black Belt certification strongly preferred
Experience with change management methodology preferred
Self-starter who is able to hold people accountable, inﬂuence and drive execution of improvements
Strong interpersonal and relationship-building skills within a matrix organization
Experience leading projects where clients, vendors, partners, and/or end-users are part of the team
Impeccable communication skills (written, verbal and presentation) to effectively address all levels inside and outside the organization
Working knowledge of SAFe Agile and Scrum

Equifax is a trusted global leader in data, advanced analytics, and technology. We help businesses provide a seamless and positive experience during life’s pivotal moments — like applying for a job or mortgage, financing an education, or buying a car. Our differentiated data, analytics, and technology lets us create the insights that power decisions to move people forward. Data is at our core.
The Head of Enterprise Data Enablement is responsible for connecting the Equifax global data teams to support the enterprise data strategy. At Equifax, Data Enablement includes control-oriented activities to ensure regulatory compliance, data privacy, etc., and also the the roles, operating model ( e.g. , data ownership), and framework that enables data to be acquired, managed, and used optimally and in support of the data strategy that enables our business.
What You Will Do
The Head of Enterprise Data Enablement will report to the Global Enterprise Data Officer, and lead global teams through our center of excellence structure.
Work with global business units to define enterprise-wide roles & responsibilities, operating model, and decision rights required for the enterprise data strategy – balancing flexibility of federated business unit roles with a solid core of well-defined enterprise-wide responsibilities
Work with data strategy and business leaders (offense) and risk and compliance (defense) to guide definition and implementation of required data (incl. data management) capabilities
Create and manage enterprise data principles (e.g., FAIR), frameworks, policies, and standards
Establish and manage forums and other routines to connect data and analytics teams across the enterprise
Establish and manage channels that enable enterprise-wide sharing of data uses cases and practices
Evangelize the enterprise data strategy, and embed it in our culture through training and other channels – helping all team members see how our data products matter, and understand their roles in managing those data products
What experience you need
Bachelor's degree, preferably in social sciences; advanced degree in business (preferred)
10+ years of experience in data governance, change or program management, or other corporate governance or communications function requiring creation and management enterprise-wide plans, frameworks, and policies
10+ years of combined experience in more than one data management discipline (data privacy, data quality, metadata, data usage & ethics, etc.)
5+ years experience leading teams across locations and units (directly and indirectly)
5+ years experience using data and / or analytics to deliver business results, including experience working with cloud and big data technologies
Demonstrated success helping teams collaborate and leading through conflict
Ability to influence through a variety of verbal and written channels, tuning content and messaging to the audience
What could set you apart
Experience adopting a “data as a product” mindset, and standing up Data Product Manager / Owner roles
Strength in understanding the perspectives of others, and drive to bring people together
Strength in quickly understanding objectives, both “what” and “why”, and connecting those across different teams and areas to create a compelling and actionable vision
Willingness to work in a non-hierarchical, dynamic, hybrid, and IT-oriented environment

Our differentiated data, analytics, and technology lets us create the insights that power decisions to move people forward. Data is at our core. The Head of Enterprise Data Architecture is responsible for the artifacts and practices used to define data requirements, guide integration and control of data assets, and align data investments with business strategy, including required data structures at various levels of abstraction. This includes logical and conceptual models (e.g., domains, subdomains, schemas, and common data elements), ontologies and standards for common data vocabulary, metadata requirements, and processes to align those business components with the physical data environment, IT processes, and governance.

What you’ll do
Report to the Global Enterprise Data Officer, and lead global teams through our center of excellence structure.
Work closely with global business units to understand their business and data strategies, and the data, processes, and flows needed to support them
Optimize the end-to-end data environment for enterprise data strategies – by simplifying, streamlining, and standardizing reusable data structures and flows where possible, and customizing for specific business uses if needed
Design and drive implementation of an optimal data layer that enables the acquisition, production, storage, analysis, and delivery of data to meet business objectives, acting as a bridge between the data requirements of business and analytic processes, and the physical implementation of that data in technology infrastructure.
Design data domains, taxonomies, ontologies, metadata requirements, and other standards that are critical to ensuring that the meaning of data is precise and unambiguous, and that data is accessible and aligned with business purpose
Work closely with IT to align underlying physical sources with data domains, logical and conceptual models, authoritative sources, and access points across the enterprise – maximizing value and use, and minimizing data expense, technical debt, and remediation costs
Partner with IT to ensure ongoing management of the data architecture through SDLC, IT, and other governance processes

What experience you need 
Bachelors degree, preferably in social sciences; advanced degree in business (preferred)
10+ years of data analysis, modeling, and architecture experience, particularly applied to common and specific business uses
Fluency across cloud and on prem technologies and tools, structured and unstructured data, streaming and reposed data
Demonstrated expertise designing data structures and solutions in multiple companies, businesses, and infrastructures based on a deep understanding of the business and technical environment
Deep expertise with a variety of data modeling techniques and tools across a variety of platforms and architecture patterns
Experience partnering with IT to integrate data architecture with SDLC and IT governance processes
Ability to influence through a variety of verbal and written channels, tuning content and messaging to the audience

What could set you apart
Experience in financial services and companies whose business is the monetization of data and analytics
Cloud, TOGAF, and other relevant technical certifications
Willingness to work in a non-hierarchical, dynamic, hybrid, and IT-oriented environment

Job Title: Global VP (Model Risk Management and AI Governance)
Description:
Equifax is where you can power your possible. If you want to achieve your true potential, chart new paths, develop new skills, collaborate with bright minds, and make a meaningful impact, we want to hear from you.
Equifax operates using a “three lines of defense” model: the first line responsible for operations and implementation, the second line responsible for internal oversight, and the third line responsible for independent audit. 
The Global Vice President (VP) of Model Risk Management & AI Governance will be part of the first line corporate Data & Analytics Team, and will be responsible for overseeing the first line’s governance and implementation  models, attributes, and AI, including managing and mitigating associated risks. The VP will also be responsible for the development and management of first line AI governance at Equifax. This role is crucial in ensuring the accuracy, reliability, and compliance of models, attributes,  and AI implemented across Data and Analytics functions at Equifax. 
What you will do
Ensures the model risk management framework for Equifax encompasses all business and global regulatory requirements.
Lead and appropriately organize Equifax’s governance committees such as the Model Risk Management Steering Committee and AI Governance Committee.  
Provide expert consultation on risk metrics, monitoring, reporting and technology solutions in order to improve framework capabilities
Leads the process definition and execution of validating models and AI solutions.
Ensures that Equifax’s models comply with relevant financial regulations and industry standards.  
Manages the coordination, development and best practice adoption of the governance strategy, managing the appropriate deployment activities for the Global Equifax Organization. 
Ensure the responsible use of AI and effective risk management strategies, such as selecting appropriate training data sets, implementing cybersecurity measures, and addressing potential biases or errors in AI models.
Oversee the model candidate assessment process and ensure cross collaboration of the Model Risk & Validation team to document rationale for decisions made.
Oversee enhancements to model risk management framework, policy, and procedures.  Ensure ongoing updates are captured to ensure compliance. 
As a SME of MRM, support audits and examinations, as well as lead remediation efforts.
Develop and enhance model risk metrics reports and present results to senior management.
What experience you need
10+ years of experience in risk management, risk analytics, risk consulting, or related fields within the financial services industry performing analytics
8+ years working with internal or external  (CFPB, OCC, Federal Reserve, State Utilities, etc.) regulatory groups
8+ years managing teams of statisticians and database analysts
Experience managing and governing a large inventory of risk models across multiple regions. 
Strong and effective communication are required and will be applied across a matrix global environment. The ability to adjust messaging and adapt to various stakeholders and audiences will be important.
What could set you apart
Active Cloud Certification strongly preferred (GCP, AWS, and/or Azure)
Strong presentation and spreadsheet skills. Equifax uses Google Workspace (Google Slides, Google Sheets, Google Docs, Gmail, Google Meet, Google Chat). Previous experience with Google Workspace is strongly preferred
Familiarity with programming languages (eg Python, R, VBA, SQl)

Equifax is where you can power your possible. If you want to achieve your true potential, chart new paths, develop new skills, collaborate with bright minds, and make a meaningful impact, we want to hear from you.
Equifax’s ambition is to become a global leader in AI for Data & Analytics. As Global Chief AI Officer (CAIO) you will serve as a visionary leader spearheading Equifax’s strategy paradigm of “AI Everywhere”. You will be responsible for defining and driving global AI strategies throughout the business and ensuring that Equifax leverages the power of AI. This includes partnering with stakeholders across the businesses to identify, test and roll-out use cases for AI, continuously improving Equifax’s AI capabilities and modeling innovation, defining AI tools and capabilities requirements,  driving continuous AI education for the D&A community and broader organization and establishing effective governance and risk management of AI solutions.
What you will do
Lead Equifax’s global AI and data science strategy in partnership with global and business stakeholders.
Defines the strategic vision that can integrate AI strategies seamlessly with business goals and deliver bottom-line results. This will include driving outcomes internally in how we approach our data, externally in how we create new products and analytically in how we extract value from Equifax’s data.  You’ll be responsible for identifying opportunities to enhance the customer experiences, streamlining operational processes, or creating new revenue streams. 
Continue Equifax’s tradition of developing new AI solutions for strategic use cases (e.g., Neuro Decision Technology) and lead the development of proprietary and patented AI solutions.
Drive thought leadership and adoption of AI techniques and tools across all D&A teams globally. 
In partnership with Legal, Compliance and Technology develop and maintain effective and efficient governance procedures and processes to manage data science solutions.
Develop frameworks and procedures for Responsible and Explainable AI in line with Equifax’s vision of being the most consumer friendly credit bureau.
Lead the continuous education efforts around AI and other Data & Analytics areas leveraging Equifax’s D&A University as well as other training solutions.
Represent Equifax as an AI leader at industry gatherings and conferences. Support external leadership discussions with customers, investors and analysts.  
Continue to leverage Equifax’s academic partnerships to drive research and innovation as well as on-campus brand for talent recruiting.
In partnership with platform and technology experts, drive the requirements and roadmap for analytical tools needed for Equifax’s internal analytical use cases. In particular, partner closely with Google to leverage Google’s AI capabilities.
Co-Lead the AI roadmap of the company in close partnership  with the PDAT (Product, Data, Technology and Operation) organization.
Partner with the Chief Architect to ensure overall technology alignment across all AI technologies.
What experience you need
Strong academic background with a Ph.D. and/or Master's degree in Computer Science, Artificial Intelligence, Statistics, Mathematics or equivalent practical experience
Proven experience and a deep understanding of data science and AI is indispensable for the role. This includes comprehension of machine learning algorithms, neural networks, and other advanced AI techniques (including among others: GBM, NLPs, Random Forest, and/or other advanced techniques)
Strong track record of leading innovation efforts using data science and delivering meaningful ROI for an organization.
Minimum of 15 years experience in developing and deploying Machine Learning models
Minimum of 10 years experience leading data science teams
Minimum of 3 years experience using cloud technologies
A deep understanding of the business landscape, market dynamics, and organizational challenges ensures that AI initiatives are not just technically sound but also strategically viable.
Experienced in navigating the Legal and ethical challenges inherent to AI 
Strong command of prompt engineering to evangelize and guide prompt engineering throughout the AI enabled enterprise
What could set you apart
The CAIO should be adept at change management, ready to tackle resistance, dispel myths, and foster a culture that embraces AI. 
Leadership skills are paramount. You will need to show that you can inspire teams, cultivate trust, and ensure that all stakeholders, from top-level executives to frontline employees, are aligned in the AI journey.
Strong and effective communication skills are required, with the ability to translate complex AI notions into digestible insights for various stakeholders and audiences.
Must be inherently curious, always on the lookout for the latest developments, ready to adapt, and eager to innovate.
Collaboration and cross-functional Interaction are important. You must be capable of interacting with diverse teams, understanding their unique challenges, and integrating AI solutions that cater to their specific needs.

Equifax is where you can power your possible. If you want to achieve your true potential, chart new paths, develop new skills, collaborate with bright minds, and make a meaningful impact, we want to hear from you.
Senior Director, Compliance
The Sr. Director, Compliance, will provide subject matter expertise on managing regulatory inquiries and exams. The position will lead internal efforts to respond to requests from U.S. regulators with supervisory authority over Equifax, including the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau (CFPB) and State financial services and consumer protection agencies, manage regulatory engagements, and provide compliance guidance related to regulatory requirements. This position will manage individual project priorities, deadlines and deliverables, as well as support other compliance initiatives.
The Sr. Director, Compliance, will be a versatile team player, display leadership qualities, and be enthusiastic in addressing new challenges across the organization.
This role reports to the Deputy Chief Compliance Officer and will be a hybrid workplace model offering the flexibility to work remotely as well as in our office building in Midtown! (This is not a fully-remote role)
What You’ll Do:
Provide subject matter expertise on managing regulatory inquiries and exams.  
Work closely with teams across Equifax to conduct investigations and prepare responses to regulatory inquiries. 
Serve as the point of contact for teams across Equifax regarding regulatory inquiries and exams.
Manage document and information collection necessary to respond to information requests.
Interface with regulators and maintain positive and collaborative relationships.
Support the monitoring and testing of compliance controls for effectiveness. 
Maintain visibility into emerging regulatory issues, including US laws and regulations that may impact Equifax.
Review company processes, policies, controls, operational requirements, and procedures to identify process improvements as they relate to compliance. 
Manage metrics related to role and, where applicable, content for other leadership reports.

What Experience You Need:
Six (6) years minimum of relevant regulatory, compliance, or analogous experience, preferably in the financial services industry; or three (3) years of relevant law firm experience.
Bachelor's degree.
Excellent verbal and written communication skills with both technical and non-technical partners, with focus on informing, influencing, and relationship building.
Experience serving as the primary interface with regulators. 
In-depth understanding of the financial services industry, including the regulatory landscape and consumer financial protection laws, specifically FCRA.
Experience interpreting financial services regulations.
Strong project management and coordination skills with proven ability to meet deadlines, prioritize assignments, and run multiple projects.
Demonstrated partnering skills, with experience coordinating initiatives with partners in a multinational organization.


What Could Set You Apart:
Direct experience with managing CFPB supervisory engagements
Juris Doctorate is strongly preferred.

Senior Director, Corporate Strategy
The Senior Director, Corporate Strategy will play a pivotal role in the year-round process that shapes Equifax’s enterprise strategy and the Business Units’ (BUs) and Center of Excellence’s (COEs) business strategies. Under the supervision of the Chief Strategy Officer, you will be creating strategic recommendations for Equifax’s leadership team by (a) leading assessments on high priority growth opportunities, (b) creating comprehensive market and competitive assessments, and (c) partnering with the M&A team to understand the strategic fit of acquisition targets and partners. You will participate in driving a continuous dialogue across the organization by supporting and coordinating the annual Strategic Thinking & Planning process, in terms of content development (e.g., strategic thinking sessions) and presentations (e.g., CEO, Board of Directors meetings). You will work closely with the Business Units (Sales, Strategy, Marketing, Product Development, etc.) as well as with Enterprise functions (Finance, Corporate Development, Data & Analytics, Technology, etc.) 
This role reports to the Chief Strategy Officer and will be a hybrid workplace model offering the flexibility to work remotely as well as in our global corporate HQ building in Midtown! (This is not a fully-remote role)

  What you’ll do:
Combine internal and external intel on macro, market, and competitive events and trends (e.g., emerging business models, new capabilities, traditional and non-traditional / emerging players, ongoing M&A activity), distill key insights, and articulate relevant opportunities or threats for our company 
Run strategy projects to assess new opportunities or identify solutions to potential threats (i.e., articulate and size the opportunity / solution, flesh out implications for EFX and potential competitive responses, lay out path for execution, prepare presentation material, socialize it with key stakeholders, and present to senior executives)
Assist BUs / COEs in planning and executing their strategic initiatives
Lead working sessions with cross-functional internal (top, middle management) and external stakeholders to identify new opportunities: facilitate the process, contribute with thought leadership, analyze and distill the outcome of the sessions, and create executive-level recommendations or feed them into the annual strategic planning process
Partner with M&A and BU teams to assess the strategic fit of potential acquisition targets and partners, and support them in shaping up the business case
Support annual Strategic Thinking & Planning process: identification and prioritization of opportunities, coordination of BUs and COEs and creation of an enterprise view, stress-testing of  financial projections / forecasts, preparation of material for key meetings with CEO and Board of Directors
Act as liaison between Corporate Strategy and BUs / COEs to keep the latter ones appraised with the enterprise strategic direction and collect from them input on main trends, events, opportunities, issues, and decisions in their businesses
What experience you need:
MBA is preferred
5+ years of experience in strategy roles, of which 3+ in management consulting firms, with a proven track record of (a) leading strategy projects while working across multiple stakeholder groups and (b) defining and delivering a cross-enterprise strategy 
Experience in Financial Services and in leading strategic engagements for M&A are a preferred plus
Highly independent in thinking and framing problems, driven by intellectual curiosity
High degree of comfort on managing multiple assignments and priorities simultaneously
Strong quantitative and problem solving skills
Executive presence and comfort with presenting to senior executives
Excellent verbal, written and interpersonal communication skills
Proven ability to influence and collaborate effectively with cross-functional teams to align and coordinate internal resources
Refined skills in developing and delivering compelling presentations
High energy, with strong will and ambition to learn and work on new things
What could set you apart:
Prior experience working in a large corporation
Experience leading projects in the technology financial services industry

Overview
Center 1 (19052), United States of America, McLean, Virginia
Senior Director, Design, Payments
Making a purchase. Paying bills. Sending someone money. Everyday things people do multiple times a week (or sometimes, a day). Money is fundamental to living our lives. And Capital One’s digital Payments experiences are at the heart of the customer journey and the core of our Bank & Card lines of business. We are seeking a dynamic and established Sr. Director of Design to elevate the design quality of these experiences and accelerate Capital One’s journey as an innovative leader in the digital payments space.
You will lead established design teams working on next-generation concepts for products such as virtual card numbers, digital wallets, Zelle, bill payments, money transfers, and payments authentication. You will operate as a strategic leader at the intersection of business, customer, and associate experiences to uncover and define compelling and forward-looking experience investments in partnership with product management, engineering, analytics, and marketing leaders. You will lead your team through developing experience insights, setting strategy, and rigorously refining UX/UI and content design to deliver on payments-related business objectives with world-class design quality. 
And you'll do it all in a collaborative environment that encourages you to build relationships, take on new responsibility, and promotes continuous learning. As part of a broader design leadership team focused on customer engagement through onboarding, payments, and money management, you will play a key role in upleveling the team’s design skillsets, developing business acumen, and shaping product strategy to best position our team to weave these experiences into the fabric of our ecosystem, as much as money is inextricably woven into the fabric of life.
What You’ll Do: 
Lead several design teams aligned with multiple business lines in shaping and executing on best-in-class digital payment experiences, setting goals, clearly communicating expectations, tracking progress, and providing meaningful guidance
Build a team operating model that emphasizes rigor in elevating design quality and mitigating operational risk in the design via continual critique and iterative refinement
Partner with business, technology, marketing, and analytics leaders and executives in the payments space to shape product strategy, communicating how experience design drives business results with compelling stories grounded in market intelligence, measurement, insights, and analysis
Influence senior and executive partners across the company to imagine the possibilities and connect dots on intersecting business agendas to elevate the product experience
Manage high-level internal and external stakeholder and partner relationships, effectively working with partners and teams across various teams & geographies 
Embrace and advocate for experience mindsets with our teams and partners — this is as important to the work as the results
Lead cross-functional engagements with Experience Researchers, Strategists, and Operations team members on large-scale efforts, applying research findings to frame problems, define insights, and design new methodologies, practices, and experiences to serve customer & business needs
Manage and coach high-potential team leaders and associates, including actively crafting a vision for their roles and their success
Manage team resourcing and resiliently lead teams through change
Our ideal candidate will have the following experience and skills:
Deep experience in digital payments & payment authentication UX
Deep experience leading mid-sized design teams operating across UX/UI, strategy, content, and research skillsets from strategy and execution
Deep experience partnering with product, engineers, marketing, and analytics leaders and executives across multiple business lines to shape strategy, internally and with external partners and vendors
Exceptional written and verbal communication skills
Proficiency in business case development in whitespace thinking — communicating analysis, customer trends, opportunity, and business impact grounded in insights
Experience in leading a portfolio of work across various business teams bringing emerging opportunities to market 
Exceptional people management and development skills
Exceptional workshop and meeting facilitation skills
Fantastic interpersonal skills, with experience influencing senior decision making
Experience with working in design innovation environments
Basic Qualifications:
Bachelor’s degree or military experience
At least 12+ years professional experience in design
Preferred Qualifications:
10+ years experience in a role leading Customer Experience or Product Design teams across UX/UI, strategy, content, and user experience research
5+ years experience in digital payments
5+ years leading mid-size design teams across multiple business lines

Job Title: Sr. Director, Technical Program Management - Card Servicing
Description:
Overview
Center 1 (19052), United States of America, McLean, Virginia
Sr. Director, Technical Program Management - Card Servicing
Are you interested in leading programs that deliver on critical business goals and build large scale products & platforms?
About Capital One: At Capital One, we’re changing banking for good. We were founded on the belief that no one should be locked out of the financial system. We’re dedicated to helping foster a world where everyone has an equal opportunity to prosper.
We’re a bank, but we don’t think like one. We’re always thinking about what’s next, about how we can innovate and inspire, and about how we can develop the tools our customers need to improve their financial lives - by leveraging best in class technology. That’s where you come in. 
About the team:
As a Sr. Director of Technical Program Management (TPM) in Capital One Card’s servicing technology organization, you’ll help lead large-scale, transformative multi-year projects involving dozens of teams and organizations.  This initiative is a part of an overall Capital One Card effort and will require the successful candidate to be a leader within the overall execution of the program, interfacing with counterparts in non-Servicing organizations.
This role will be communicating at the highest levels of the organization to the senior executive level, and will be able to identify, produce and connect the dots using the appropriate level of artifacts and analysis tools.  
The primary day-to-day working relationships for the role  will be with Directors, Senior Directors, VPs and Distinguished Engineers within the Card Tech and Card Product organizations.
Our TPM Sr. Directors have:
Strong technical backgrounds (ideally building highly scalable platforms, products, or services) with the ability to proactively identify and mitigate technical risks throughout delivery life-cycle
Experience building and leading a world-class team of technical program managers with a mission to power real-time, intelligent experiences for our customers and associates
Lead technology focused discussions with senior leadership by providing valuable insights and recommendations that guide technology-based decisions
Exceptional communication and collaboration skills
Excellent problem solving and influencing skills
A quantitative approach to problem solving and a collaborative implementer to holistic solutions; a systems thinker 
Experienced TPM leader to grow and develop a team of TPMs, while also building the foundations for the TPM practice
Ability to simplify the technically complex and drive well-educated decisions across product, engineering, design, and data science representatives
Deep focus on execution, follow-through, accountability, and results
Exceptional cross-team collaboration; able to work across different functions, organizations, and reporting boundaries to get the job done.
Highly tuned emotional intelligence, good listener, and deep seated empathy for teams and partners
Basic Qualifications
Bachelor's degree
At least 9 years of experience managing technical programs
Preferred Qualifications
9+ years of experience designing and building data-intensive solutions using distributed computing.
5+ years of experience in building distributed systems & highly available services using cloud computing services / architecture - preferably using AWS
5+ years of building & leading experienced TPM team
5+ years experience building highly scalable mobile products & platforms
5+ years of experience with Agile delivery
5+ years years experience delivering large and complex programs - where you own the business or technical vision, collaborate with large cross-functional teams, secure commitments on deliverables and unblock teams to land business impact
Experience in building systems & solutions within a highly regulated environment
Bachelor's degree in a related technical field (Computer Science, Software Engineering) 
MBA or Master’s Degree in a related technical field (Computer Science, Software Engineering) or equivalent experience

Description:
Overview
Locations: VA - McLean, United States of America, McLean, Virginia
Business Director
As a Business Director at Capital One, you will apply your strategic and analytical skills to major company challenges. You’ll team with world-class professionals to develop and test strategies that ultimately impact the bottom line. And you will do it all in a collaborative environment that values your insight, encourages you to take on new responsibility, promotes continuous learning, and rewards innovation. 
This role will lead decision analytics and strategy for the Bank Modernization program. This program will build out a replacement bank core which requires a rebuild of all our products and core capabilities. The analysis of value and strategy with which we sequence that activity will require significant analysis and strategic leadership. The leader of this team will help drive that thinking, leading a team of analysts to help influence executive leadership on direction and approach.
General Responsibilities:
Strategic leadership:  Develop business strategies that will drive growth, profitability, and competitive success for Capital One in the face of shifting consumer and regulatory demands 
Leadership:  May manage and develop multiple analysts.  Coaching and mentoring associates with a goal of developing and retaining talent at Capital One 
Product:  Develop and implement new product and pricing strategies for various lending products; lead product level data modeling/analytics 
Marketing:  Lead direct-to-consumer marketing efforts for select products, and strategic intent for products distributed through the retail channel.  Build targeted insights to inform the design and development of new customer experiences, as well as breakthrough technology and concepts designed to deliver on new go-to-market strategies 
Credit Risk:  Drive step-change improvements in credit performance by connecting drivers of future consumer credit trends to historical behavior, creating risk models, and testing hypotheses using rigorous monitoring and analysis 
Execution:  Manage and sequence delivery of business intent, build business requirements and execute against the product strategy. Oversee multiple projects and programs concurrently 
Partnership:  Work closely with colleagues across Capital One including:  IT, Sales, Operations, Finance and others to drive improvement in quality, volume, service, and profitability  
Strategic; analytic orientation: A proven track record of decision making and problem solving based on analytics. Conceptual thinking skills must be complemented by a strong quantitative orientation, given that a large part of the business is based on rigorous analytic marketing & credit risk management 
Strong business judgment, leadership and integrity: They should be a tenacious decision maker, able to bring a healthy, aggressive, yet responsible approach to business 
Solid people leadership experience: Ability to build and leverage the capabilities of a high-performing team, as well as business partners across the enterprise. They should foster innovation, drive critical decisions, hold business partners accountable, and be able to consistently deliver results 
Strong executive communication skills: Impeccable written and oral communication credentials, coupled with strategic influencing skills and the ability to drive agreement through intellect, interpersonal and negotiation skills 
Clear results orientation: display an intense focus on achieving both short and long term goals. They should be able to drive and execute an agenda in an uncertain and fluid environment
Successful track record of thriving in a fast paced, entrepreneurial and dynamic environment. Previous consulting experience is a plus 
Basic Qualifications:
Bachelor’s Degree 
At least 7 years of experience in analysis 
Preferred Qualifications:
Master’s Degree 
2+ years of experience in financial services 
1+ year of experience in consulting 
3+ years of experience in people management

Description:
Overview
West Creek 4 (12074), United States of America, Richmond, Virginia
Director, Data Engineering
Capital One's is seeking a Director of Data Engineering to lead, mentor, exceptional data engineering teams to deliver game changing technologies. The Director must have the ability to influence and lead talented engineering teams while simultaneously having the technical chops to ensure that we build compelling, customer-focused solutions in an iterative methodology.
This role will be leading the development and implementation plan for our Technology Data Excellence tower, working to develop strategies to optimize our application data architecture design and our data governance practices for operations and telemetry data.  
As a candidate for this role, you’re able to seamlessly switch from diving deep into technology with engineers to driving high-level, strategic discussions. You are a naturally curious technologist and stay on top of emerging trends, including prototyping of nascent technologies. You are not afraid to question any existing processes and solutions, yet you display a keen sense of business value proposition and focus on the right priorities.
You will:
Build awareness, increase knowledge and drive adoption of modern technologies, sharing consumer and engineering benefits to gain buy-in
Strike the right balance between lending expertise and providing an inclusive environment where others’ ideas can be heard and championed; leverage expertise to grow skills in the broader Capital One team
Promote a culture of engineering excellence, using opportunities to reuse and innersource solutions where possible
Effectively communicate with and influence key stakeholders across the enterprise, at all levels of the organization
Operate as a trusted advisor for a specific technology, platform or capability domain, helping to shape use cases and implementation in an unified manner
Lead the way in creating next-generation talent for Tech, mentoring internal talent and actively recruiting external talent to bolster Capital One’s Tech talent
Basic Qualifications:
Bachelor’s Degree
At least 7 years’ experience in data engineering
At least 5 years’ experience in people management
Preferred Qualifications:
Master’s Degree
10+ years’ of experience in data engineering
5+ years’ of experience in Agile practices
5+ years in AWS or other Cloud Providers
5+ of experience in Big Data Architecture Design

Description:
Overview
77 West Wacker Dr (35012), United States of America, Chicago, Illinois
Director, Software Engineering - Partner Data
We are seeking a Director of Software Engineering who is passionate about growing and sustaining an innovative technology organization while fostering a culture of engineering and operational excellence. This individual will be an engineering leader who enjoys solving complex business problems in a fast-paced, collaborative, inclusive, and iterative delivery environment. At Capital One, you’ll be part of a big group of builders, breakers, doers and disruptors, who love to solve real problems and meet real customer needs.
The Director of Software Engineering is in the Card Tech Partnerships organization with oversight of Big Data initiatives, governance and best practices. You will lead and enable full stack teams with strong data experts, collaborate with cross-functional teams, and influence innovative solutions.
You will design cloud native solutions and will have the opportunity to work on emerging technologies such as: AWS, Java, Python, Spark, ERM, Big Data technologies, to name a few. 
Specifically you will
:
Lead multiple agile teams and coach and mentor engineers through their career development and performance
Work with Product partners to develop the technology strategy, roadmap and vision for the platforms you own; and deliver application capabilities
Work within and across Agile teams to design, develop, test, implement, and support technical solutions across a full-stack development tools and technologies
Lead complex vendor relationships and ensure well-managed integration of vendor platforms into our broader Capital One ecosystem
Develop and leverage trusted relationships across Architecture, Design, and other Technology leaders to ensure strategic alignment across key Bank Tech initiatives
Bring a passion to stay on top of tech trends, experiment with and learn new technologies, participate in internal & external technology communities
Encourage innovation, implementation of cutting-edge technologies, inclusion, outside-of-the-box thinking, teamwork, self-organization, and diversity
Basic Qualifications
:
Bachelor’s Degree
At least 7 years experience in software engineering or software development
At least 5 years experience in people management
At least 2 years of experience with AWS
Preferred Qualifications
:
Master’s Degree
10+ years of experience in software engineering or software development
8+ years of experience with AWS 
5+ years of experience leading Big Data and Data Governance initiatives 
5+ years of experience in Agile practices
3+ years of experience in modernizing technology stacks
3+ years of experience with Event-Driven Architecture

Overview
West Creek 3 (12073), United States of America, Richmond, Virginia
AML Risk and Controls Director
Anti-Money Laundering (AML) is a key risk function within Capital One’s Compliance & Ethics (C&E). The AML team serves as a second line of defense and operates certain first line of defense controls for Capital One’s Lines of Business. In this role, you will work within Capital One’s AML Program Risk Office (AMLPRO), and with partners across all of Capital One’s lines of businesses, leading risk assessments and control challenges for AML and Sanctions.
This leader will also be responsible for a team of risk managers, and be a thought leader working across the enterprise to develop and implement cutting edge solutions to ensure Capital One’s continued stability and success. Directors in Capital One’s AML organization partner with many different stakeholders to drive change in order to effectively manage risk in an open, collaborative environment where new ideas and solutions are both welcomed and rewarded. Our Directors are highly motivated risk management professionals with excellent organizational, leadership and communication skills. They have a high level of exposure across lines of business and functions, and the opportunity to create and implement innovative solutions to identify and mitigate potential risks to the Company.
Core Responsibilities include:
Lead the execution of the enterprise Money Laundering and Sanctions risk assessment. 
Partner with key stakeholders across AML to establish an emerging risk forum, helping Capital One navigate the ever-changing risk landscape for financial crime compliance. 
Lead second-line compliance control reviews, providing assurance that Capital One’s AML controls are designed and operating effectively to mitigate financial crime risk and are in compliance with our Enterprise Risk Management (ERM) standards
Oversee AML’s Process framework, ensuring our program’s process documentation and framework is kept up-to-date and aligned with C&E’s Process Excellence framework
Monitor, through closure, issues and recommendations stemming from the various assessments performed under the risk and controls organization
Interface with regulators and audit partners, representing the AML Risk & Controls functions
Develop Subject Matter Expertise in ERM’s framework, and provide advisory services to the AML Program in navigating this framework. 
Maintain and update AML’s guidance for first-line assessments and product, service, industry, and transaction risk ratings
Partner with oversight groups to advance risk assessments and compliance testing. 
Engage in new projects and/or ad-hoc leadership activities, as requested by senior leadership
Basic Qualifications:
Bachelors Degree or military experience
At least 7 years of experience in AML or Compliance
At least 2 years experience in Operations Management
At least 3 years experience in People Management
Preferred Qualifications:
At least 5 years of experience as a Project and/or Process Manager within the financial services industry
At least 10 years of overall experience as Project and/or Process Manager
Business Process Management certification (internal Capital One certification) Six Sigma Lean, Green Belt or Black Belt certification, Agile Coach certification, Compliance Certification (CRCM)

Job Title: Sr. Distinguished Engineer (Sr. Director IC) - Business Cards & Payments
Description:
Overview
Center 2 (19050), United States of America, McLean, Virginia
Sr. Distinguished Engineer (Sr. Director IC) - Business Cards & Payments
As a Sr. Distinguished Engineer at Capital One, you will be a part of a community of technical experts working to define the future of banking in the cloud.
At Capital One, we believe diversity of thought strengthens our ability to influence, collaborate and provide the most innovative solutions across organizational boundaries. You will promote a culture of engineering excellence, and strike the right balance between lending expertise and providing an inclusive environment where the ideas of others can be heard and championed. You will lead the way in creating next-generation talent for Capital One Tech, mentoring internal talent and actively recruiting to keep building our community.
About the team:
Business Cards & Payments (BC&P) helps businesses, both large and small, do more business. This mission is accomplished in many ways, all of which revolve around enabling businesses to manage and move money (charge, credit, payments, etc). Business Card’s goal is to provide business customers with a variety of credit and charge card products and capabilities to meet the unique needs of their business. This is a mature growth business, and we are at a time where we are redefining the future of our products, architecture, and technology stack that will propel us to new heights.
Senior DEs are:
Deep technical experts and thought leaders that help accelerate adoption of the very best engineering practices, while maintaining knowledge on industry innovations, trends and practices
Visionaries, collaborating on Capital One’s toughest issues, to deliver on business needs that directly impact the lives of our customers and associates
Role models and mentors, helping to coach and strengthen the technical expertise and know-how of our engineering and product community
Evangelists, both internally and externally, helping to elevate the Distinguished Engineering community and establish themselves as a go-to resource on given technologies and technology-enabled capabilities
Responsibilities:
Build awareness, increase knowledge and drive adoption of modern technologies, sharing consumer and engineering benefits to gain buy-in
Strike the right balance between lending expertise and providing an inclusive environment where others’ ideas can be heard and championed; leverage expertise to grow skills in the broader Capital One team
Promote a culture of engineering excellence, using opportunities to reuse and innersource solutions where possible
Effectively communicate with and influence key stakeholders across the enterprise, at all levels of the organization
Operate as a trusted advisor for a specific technology, platform or capability domain, helping to shape use cases and implementation in an unified manner
Lead the way in creating next-generation talent for Tech, mentoring internal talent and actively recruiting external talent to bolster Capital One’s Tech talent
Basic Qualifications:
Bachelor’s Degree 
At least 9 years of experience in software engineering or solution architecture
At least 5 years’ experience with public cloud technologies
Preferred Qualifications:
Masters’ Degree 
12+ years of experience in software engineering or solution architecture
7+ years of experience designing and building enterprise platform solutions
5+ years experience with Amazon Web Services
3+ years of experience defining software design, architecture and engineering practices
1+ year of experience with developing strategy and implementing target architectures
AWS Certifications

Job Title: Sr. Director, Cyber Risk & Analysis - Card Technology
Description:
Overview
Plano 3 (31063), United States of America, Plano, Texas
Sr. Director, Cyber Risk & Analysis - Card Technology
The Senior Director for Cyber Risk & Analysis serves as an experienced technology leader in Capital One’s Card Technology organization as part of the Governance & Risk team. This is a visible, strategic, and high-impact leadership role as an advocate for continuous cyber program and process maturation. This individual is a Risk expert with a capacity to lead experts and also possesses the qualities of a skilled governance Subject Matter Expert (SME). This individual brings operational depth and breadth across a broad range of technology risk functions.
This individual plays a key role in the continued innovation of Card Technology’s risk posture. The Senior Director enables competitive advantage by leading technology risk excellence in Card Technology’s cyber risk and awareness functions at the organization as well as enterprise levels.
The Senior Director is responsible for shaping and implementing a bold strategic agenda for Card Technology’s  cyber risk and awareness, driving action plans, and building/leading a high performing organization to deliver results. In addition, this individual effectively influences key internal stakeholders toward sound cyber decisions.
Responsibilities
:
Plays a key leadership role within Card Technology’s community of leaders, driving strategy and collaborating with peers across Technology, Lines of Business, and horizontal functions.
Instills a culture that works toward the highest standards in cyber (safeguard the business) while ensuring that business requirements are understood and adhered to (enabling the business).
With an innovative mindset, employs new cyber assurance approaches to mitigate risk around current and anticipated risks and/or breaches.  
Advances the company’s overall mission to assess, improve and monitor cyber across the enterprise.  
Builds relationships, influences and collaborates with second-line Risk Management partners, as well as executives across both technology and the business.  
Guides the acquisition of professional services and tools for effective governance.
Establishes credibility throughout the organization by earning the reputation for being a dedicated senior leader and change agent.
Recruits, develops, and retains top talent, and uses excellent people leadership skills. 
Basic Qualifications:
Bachelor’s degree
At least 9 years of experience in information technology management
At least 7 years of experience in people management
Preferred Qualifications:
Master’s degree 
8+ years of experience in information and technology risk management controls
5+ years of experience working with industry frameworks such as NIST CSF, FFIEC CAT, CIS RAM, FAIR and PCI DSS
5+ years of experience in cybersecurity awareness and training
3+ years of experience with information technology audit or compliance management
Industry-recognized professional certifications, such as Certified Risk & Information Systems Control (CRISC), Certified Information Systems Security Professional (CISSP), and Certified Information Security Manager (CISM)
Financial services industry experience

Job Title: Chief of Staff, Principal Risk Associate (Card)
Description:
Overview
West Creek 1 (12071), United States of America, Richmond, Virginia
Chief of Staff, Principal Risk Associate (Card)
Capital One, a Fortune 500 company and one of the nation’s top 10 banks, offers a broad spectrum of financial products and services to consumers, small businesses, and commercial clients.  We nurture a work environment where people with a variety of thoughts, ideas, and backgrounds, guided by our shared values, come together to make Capital One a great company – and a great place to work.
The Card Risk Chief of Staff team  is seeking a collaborative, analytically focused risk management professional to join our team. As a Principal Risk Specialist, you will work in a strong team environment to scope and deploy mandatory Compliance training to associates across Card. The Principal Risk Specialist will be responsible for working with business partners in Card and second line to deliver against numerous compliance related requirements. We are looking for someone who can identify process enhancements to create efficiencies, maintain program methodology and collect and analyze data. This role requires highly motivated Risk Management professionals with excellent organizational and communication skills. 
General Responsibilities:
Provide day to day oversight of multiple processes: monitor, report, and plan process improvement 
Identify process improvement opportunities and implement them through collaboration with other groups such as other risk offices and Enterprise Risk Management 
Coordinate and conduct data validations of end-to-end processing outcomes and actively lead problem-solving exercises
Perform analysis and provide recommendations; Take results and data to help management and customers understand implications and determine next steps.
Communicate and report on results of assessments, process outcome and issue management.
Collaborate on larger initiatives. Participate in cross-functional project teams, including projects driven by other parts of the organization, to provide input, and partner with groups on execution efforts.
Basic Qualifications:
High school diploma, GED or equivalent certification
At least 2 years of Compliance, Audit, or Risk Management experience
At least 1 year of experience in Process Management or Project Management
Preferred Qualifications:
Bachelor’s Degree or Military experience
Process Management, Project Management or Risk Management Certification
3+ years of experience in Project Management, Process Management, or Relationship Management
3+ years of Compliance, Audit, or Risk Management experience
2+ years of experience using Google Suite 
2+ years of Financial Services experience
Proficient in use of query and data visualization tools like Tableau

Job Title: Sr. Director, Design, Card Platforms & Data
Description:
Overview
11 West 19th Street (22008), United States of America, New York, New York
Sr. Director, Design, Card Platforms & Data
The Sr. Director of Design will be accountable for our Card Platforms & Data team. This role will be partner with our business teams representing Card Platforms & Services as well as our Card Data, Models, and Credit.
As Sr. Director of Design you will also operate as a strategic leader at the intersection of business and associate experiences to uncover and define compelling design solutions that impact enable our Card Platforms and Data agenda. And you'll do it all in a collaborative environment that encourages you to build relationships, take on new responsibility, and promote continuous learning with a team of design strategists, service designers, product designers, and researchers.
---
What You’ll Do: 
Manage a portfolio of large scale, platform and data design engagements supporting our associate experiences
Build and lead a dedicated team of designers to support high priority projects for the organization
Manage and coach high potential associates, including actively crafting a vision for their roles and their success
Provide thought leadership for your team and business partners by connect dots across our teams and developing strategic projects, customer insights, and product design solutions
Devise organizational structures that optimally leverage internal expertise and organizational needs to maximize design impact
Craft compelling stories grounded in rigorous insights and analysis to influence senior and executive partners across the company
Lead designers and non-designers on cross-functional project teams to understand and apply research findings by framing problems, defining insights, and designing new methodologies/ practices to serve customer needs
Manage internal executive stakeholder and partner relationships
Embrace and advocate an experience mindset with our teams and partners - this is as important to the work as the results
Effectively work with partners and teams across various geographies 
Our ideal candidate will have the following experience and skills:
Exceptional written and verbal communication skills
Proficiency in business case development in whitespace thinking - communicating analysis, customer trends, opportunity, and business impact grounded in customer experience and insights
Experience in leading a portfolio of work bringing emerging opportunities to market 
Experience in leading strategic and horizontal teams within a product design space
Exceptional people management and development skills
Exceptional workshop and meeting facilitation skills
Fantastic interpersonal skills, with experience influencing senior decision making
Experience with working in design innovation environments
Experience designing for large scale enterprise data, platform, and internal-facing experiences 
Basic Qualifications (keep in tact)
Bachelor’s degree or military experience
At least 12+ years professional experience in experience design
Preferred Qualifications:
Master’s degree or advanced Degree in Human-Computer Interaction, Design, Behavioral Science, or related field
8+ years experience in a people leadership role leading Design Strategy or Product Design
Experience with leading design for enterprise data platforms

Job Title: Director, Commercial Bank Operational Risk Officer
Description:
Overview
West Creek 3 (12073), United States of America, Richmond, Virginia
Director, Commercial Bank Operational Risk Officer
At Capital One, we dare to dream, disrupt and deliver a better way. Our goal is simple — bring ingenuity, simplicity and humanity to an industry ripe for change. Our associates are the heart of Capital One and our commitment to diversity, inclusion and belonging (DIB) are valued at our core. We empower our associates to do great work by creating an inclusive culture that values diverse perspectives, fosters collaboration, and encourages innovative ideas. A workplace where everyone feels safe, seen, heard, valued and able to bring their best, most authentic selves to work.
As part of the Operational Risk Management (ORM) organization, you’ll work with talented associates to provide second line oversight and effective challenge to ensure that Capital One effectively manages operational risk. You’ll also bring your unique perspective and experiences to help us be rigorous, curious and creative.
Operational Risk Officers (OROs) are a team of experienced risk managers that serve as the liaisons between ORM and Capital One. As the Commercial ORO, you will apply your leadership and analytical skills to help advance Capital One's capabilities to effectively manage operational risk in a Top 10 Commercial U.S. Bank. Serving as both an effective challenger and a trusted advisor for Executive leaders within the Commercial Banking business lines, you will be integrated into multiple dimensions of first line activities and risk-taking to help the enterprise properly manage operational risk. 
Responsibilities: 
Provide consultation on complex areas of operational risk and the application of operational risk practices and tools within the Commercial Bank
Provide independent second line challenge to the Commercial Bank, inclusive of senior management, to drive informed and appropriate risk decisions regarding normal operations and changes to the operations, products, and services.
Influence senior management to drive realization and mitigation of new and emerging operational risks
Escalation of material unresolved challenges, and in the event that risks have not been sufficiently resolved, or if the business decision falls outside of the established business risk appetite
Provide leadership across broader Operational Risk Management department for internal projects and associate development
Guide Operational Risk Advisors as they engage with Commercial Bank on Risk Assessments, events, issues and other challenge activities.
Basic Qualifications:
Bachelor's Degree or Military experience 
At least 5 years of Risk related experience in a Commercial Bank role
At least 7 years of experience with financial services industry
At least 5 years of experience structuring information for senior audiences
At least 5 years of experience with Operational Risk Frameworks, COSO Control Methodologies, or Lines of Defense
Preferred Qualifications:
Masters Degree in Business Management, Accounting, or Economics, 
Operational familiarity with Commercial Lending, Underwriting and Portfolio Management, Treasury Management, Corporate Banking, Commercial Real Estate, Speciality Financial Products, Banking, Capital Markets, Treasury, and Commercial Back Office processes
Experience influencing senior leadership in an advisory capacity
Demonstrated ability to understand strategic imperatives and position team goals to effectively support those mandates
(Insert HR’s suggested language around people leadership skills here)
Experience interacting with Audit and Regulatory Authorities 
At least 10 years of experience as a Risk Manager or Assurance within Commercial Banking or Treasury Functions 
Experience with operational risk core methodologies and risk categories aligned with the Basel II Operational Risk Framework
Proficiency with data analytics tools and techniques
Proficiency with structuring slides and presentations in order to convey risk information

Description:
Overview
Center 1 (19052), United States of America, McLean, Virginia
Audit Director: Operational Risk Management
Capital One’s Audit function is a dedicated group of professionals focused on delivering top-quality assurance services to the organization’s Audit Committee. Audit professionals are experienced, well-trained and credentialed, and operate within a collaborative, agile environment to deliver value-added opinions and recommendations. Audit’s vision to provide high value, independent, proactive insights, to innovate with technology, and to be a top-notch talent destination, creates a dynamic and challenging atmosphere for both personal growth and professional opportunity. Capital One is seeking an energetic, self-motivated Audit Director interested in becoming part of our Audit team. As a member of the Risk Audit team, the candidate will focus on all aspects of operational risk across the bank to include third party risk management, business continuity risk management, payments risk and country risk audits.
Responsibilities:
Lead and/or execute operational related audits within Capital One, including the supervision of audit staff on related audit engagements.
Proactively monitor assigned audit universe for changing risks and needed updates.  Lead continuous monitoring activities and updates to risk assessments, audit universe, and audit plan.
Direct business unit and project audits across assigned portfolio.
Review engagement planning documentation and audit programs to ensure adequate coverage of risk and sufficient rationale for audit scope.
Supervise and coordinate work assignments amongst audit team members. Provide timely feedback, on-the-job training and coaching to audit staff and direct reports.
Establish and maintain good relationships with key business and audit partners. Leverage specialized knowledge and skills, providing management with insight into their area of subject-matter focus. Effectively represent internal audit at management meetings, internal forums, and to external organizations.
Provide subject matter expertise to audit partners and ensure comprehensive audit coverage of owned risk domains.
Assess relevance of audit findings, potential exposures, materiality, improving or deteriorating trends, and demonstrate awareness of big picture issues. Interpret business priorities, anticipate issues and obstacles, and apply to scope of role.
Deliver appropriate, succinct and organized information, tailoring communication style to audience. Effectively review and compile relevant, material findings and recommendations into readable and concise audit reports. Communicate complex results and implications, incorporating different perspectives into deliverables.
Manage timely and quality delivery of multiple tasks, including audits, projects, special assignments, and administrative activities. Self-prioritize and independently complete multiple tasks across the team and department. Demonstrate the ability to successfully meet deadlines.
Here’s what we’re looking for in an ideal teammate:
You are a critical thinker who seeks to understand the business and its control environment.
You believe insight and objectivity are core elements to providing assurance on the effectiveness and efficiency of Capital One’s governance, risk management, and internal control processes.
You possess a relentless focus on quality and timeliness.
You adapt to change, embrace bold ideas, and are intellectually curious. You like to ask questions, test assumptions, and challenge conventional thinking.
You develop influential relationships based upon shared risk objectives and trust to deliver outstanding business impact and elevate Audit’s value proposition.
You’re a firm believer that a rich understanding of data, innovation, and technology will only make you a better auditor. This will require leveraging the power of data analytics and furthering your technical expertise.
You’re a teacher. You do the right thing and lead by example. You have a passion for coaching and investing in the betterment of your team. You lead through change with candor and optimism.
You create energy and an environment that fosters trust, collaboration, and belonging, making it easy to attract, hire, and retain top talent.
Basic Qualifications:
Bachelor’s degree or military experience
At least 10 years of experience in auditing or at least 10 years of experience in risk management
At least 5 years of experience in banking or financial services
At least 3 years of experience in people management
At least 3 years of experience managing audit engagements
Preferred Qualifications:
Master’s Degree in Accounting, Finance, Economics, or Business Administration
Professional certification such as Certified Public Accountant (CPA), Certified Internal Auditor (CIA), Chartered Financial Analyst (CFA), Certified Risk Manager (CRM), Certified Business Continuity Professional (CBCP), Certified Third-Party Risk Professional (CTPRP) or Accredited Payments Risk Professional (APRP)
Experience with operational resiliency, third party risk management, business continuity risk management, payments risk, country risk or a combination
12+ years of experience in internal auditing, first or second line risk management, or a combination
7+ years of experience in banking or financial services
7+ years of experience in leadership or supervisory roles
1+ year of experience performing data analysis in support of internal auditing
