Description:
Overview
Center 2 (19050), United States of America, McLean, Virginia
KippsDeSanto - Investment Banking Vice President
KippsDeSanto is focused on providing comprehensive transaction advisory services – primarily M&A, private financing, and strategic advisory to middle market defense and technology companies.
Our Vice Presidents perform critical functions as leaders and active contributors throughout the entire transaction process, from helping to prepare clients for market, engaging with potential buyers, and facilitating due diligence to ultimately negotiating and closing the deal. The position offers substantial opportunities for professional development and upward mobility, while taking on a substantial amount of responsibility in transaction execution, client management, and new business development. 
General responsibilities include:
Working closely with well-established Aerospace / Defense and Technology investment bankers who will act as mentors and work hard to help fulfill your career goals
Analyzing and explaining detailed corporate and financial information
Conducting industry and company-specific business due diligence
Managing and assisting in the preparation of financial models and business valuations
Preparing pitch books and client marketing presentations, memoranda, and deliverables
Understanding the underlying trends that affect the Aerospace, Defense, and Government
Technology industries
Developing and cultivating client, prospective client, buyer, investor, and professional advisor relationships
Mentorship of junior bankers
Basic Qualifications
Bachelor’s degree or military experience
At least 6 years of investment banking, private equity, or other financial services experience or an MBA degree with 3 years of investment banking, private equity, or other financial services experience
Preferred Qualifications
Prior Associate and Vice President experience (with a track-record of being promoted internally)
Significant track record of M&A or financing deal execution
Strong analytical, financial, and quantitative skills
Strong written and oral presentation, verbal communication, and creative and strategic thinking skills
Ability to work independently and lead teams in a fast-paced environment
Strong work ethic and attention to detail
Ability to manage a variety of priorities and projects simultaneously
A passion for excellence and a desire to work hard, win, and have fun

Job Title: Commercial Banking Relationship Manager - Senior Director
Description:
Overview
Place St Charles (37701), United States of America, New Orleans, Louisiana
Commercial Banking Relationship Manager - Senior Director
As a global leader in financial services, we believe in building first rate relationships, achieving quality results and working with integrity. Teamwork is at the heart of everything we do. That is why we provide you with comprehensive training, benefits and programs that inspire you to work with a dynamic team to achieve more every day. As a Relationship Manager V (Senior Director) at Capital One, you will develop markets and administer existing loans, demand and time deposits, and cross sell related banking accounts and services. In addition, you will supervise employees and/or assist in supporting and leading less experienced loan officers. This position focuses on developing new client relationships for the Regional Commercial Bank. 
Responsibilities:
Plans, develops and pursues an active client and prospect calling program, within the Bank structure, in order to attract new banking relationships
You will develop new client relationships, administer, and cross sell related banking products and services
Makes habitual calls on prospective clients in order to generate high quality new loan, deposit, and fee business to achieve or exceed specific production goals
Plans portfolio growth through the development of a business plan in alignment with departmental budget and consistent with overall Bank asset/liability management objectives
Convene with customers through personal calling efforts, branch referrals and other contacts to discuss business needs and recommend ways in which the bank can serve their needs
Coordinates with various divisions and departments (Branches, Operations, etc.) in the servicing of routine transactions and maintains up-to-date knowledge of competitors’ products and pricing in the market served
Liable for the proper pre-qualification, structuring, pricing, and exception-free closing on all loans in his/her assigned area
Analyzes requests and associated financial data to determine if the loan meets acceptable risk standards is within policy
Evaluates risk and reviews the compensating of each loan customer in order to properly price loan to meet profitability standards
Acquires collateral documents to be utilized as security on loans, and approves the release, substitution of collateral in accordance with loan policy
Collaborates with borrowing customers to procure updated financial information on an ongoing basis
Presents credits to the Regional Manager and the Senior Loan Committees as appropriate, and conveys decisions to customer
Work in partnership with the Loan Analysis unit in developing analytical work-ups on credits
Follows up on loan exceptions to insure timely clearing and controls volume of exceptions
Basic Qualifications:
Bachelor’s degree or military experience
At least 10 years of experience in commercial banking
Preferred Qualifications:
Master’s Degree or MBA
Completion of formal credit training program
11 or more years of loan origination experience

Job Title: Commercial Banking Relationship Manager - Senior Director
Description:
Overview
5444 Westheimer (31761), United States of America, Houston, Texas
Commercial Banking Relationship Manager - Senior Director
As a global leader in financial services, we believe in building first rate relationships, achieving quality results and working with integrity. Teamwork is at the heart of everything we do. That is why we provide you with comprehensive training, benefits and programs that inspire you to work with a dynamic team to achieve more every day. As a Relationship Manager V (Senior Director) at Capital One, you will develop markets and administer existing loans, demand and time deposits, and cross sell related banking accounts and services. In addition, you will supervise employees and/or assist in supporting and leading less experienced loan officers. This position focuses on developing new client relationships for the Regional Commercial Bank. 
Responsibilities:
Plans, develop and pursue an active customer call program, within the Bank structure, in order to attract new banking relationships
You will develop new client relationships, administer, and cross sell related banking products and services
Makes habitual calls on prospective clients in order to generate high quality new loan, deposit, and fee business to achieve or exceed specific production goals
Plans portfolio growth through the development of a business plan in alignment with departmental budget and consistent with overall Bank asset/liability management objectives
Convene with customers through personal calling efforts, branch referrals and other contacts to discuss business needs and recommend ways in which the bank can serve their needs
Coordinates with various divisions and departments (Branches, Operations, etc.) in the servicing of routine transactions and maintains up-to-date knowledge of competitors’ products and pricing in the market served
Liable for the proper pre-qualification, structuring, pricing, and exception-free closing on all loans in his/her assigned area
Analyzes requests and associated financial data to determine if the loan meets acceptable risk standards is within policy
Evaluates risk and reviews the compensating of each loan customer in order to properly price loan to meet profitability standards
Acquires collateral documents to be utilized as security on loans, and approves the release, substitution of collateral in accordance with loan policy
Collaborates with borrowing customers to procure updated financial information on an ongoing basis
Presents credits to the Regional Manager and the Senior Loan Committees as appropriate, and conveys decisions to customer
Work in partnership with the Loan Analysis unit in developing analytical work-ups on credits
Follows up on loan exceptions to insure timely clearing and controls volume of exceptions
Basic Qualifications:
Bachelor’s degree or military experience
At least 10 years of experience in commercial banking
Preferred Qualifications:
Master’s Degree or MBA
Completion of formal credit training program
10 or more years of loan origination experience
At this time, Capital One will not sponsor a new applicant for employment authorization for this position.

Job Title: Vice President, Global Head of Infrastructure
Description:
ADP is hiring a Vice President, Global Head of Infrastructure
  The Vice President, Global Head of Infrastructure will be responsible for the vision, leadership, strategic oversight and delivery of all IT infrastructure for the enterprise. This position will drive transformational initiatives along with operational execution, with a high degree of collaboration with other technical and business leaders to ensure our solutions are business aligned. In this role, you will oversee on-premise and cloud infrastructure, engineering, and operations teams to ensure IT infrastructure and architecture is operational, secure, and reliable. You will also oversee the Developer Experience teams to streamline the process and toolsets for infrastructure consumption for the developer community.

You will also ensure technology investments are delivering expected value and outcomes and manage EOL technology roadmap and change management. In this role, we’re looking for a strategic and out-of-the-box thinker with a passion for technology modernization and business impact. You will lead a large global matrix team and drive a culture of talent development, performance enablement, and change management.

Applications for this posting will be accepted until 03/15/2024.

Description:
ADP is hiring a Senior Director of Data Science.
Are you an experienced leader in Data Science ready for your next-level adventure?
Does the thought of working with one of the most comprehensive employment data sets in the world excite you?
Are you inspired by transformation and making an impact on the lives of millions of people every day?
Are you a technologist first and foremost who approaches every problem wearing that hat while going out of your way to champion creativity and build diverse, productive, and engaged teams?

In this role, you’ll have access to the most unique and one of the largest HCM data sets and do exploratory analysis to understand if it meets project requirements. It’s more than digits and dials – you’re making huge decisions that impact millions of customers.
Every day you’ll work with multiple stakeholders to identify, design, develop and implement advanced AI and machine learning projects that influence daily life of working people. You’ll work with your team to provide, interpret, and predict necessary metrics for decision-making. You’ll code with machine learning tools like Python, R, and Scala to synthesize millions of data sets into patterns that answer ad hoc requests and then use Tableau for data visualization. You will create models that guide professional through daily working decisions related to every aspect of working life.

  Job Summary

Job Title: Sr. Director of Program Management – Global Enterprise & Technology Solutions (GETS)
Description:
ADP is hiring a Sr. Director of Program Management – Global Enterprise & Technology Solutions (GETS)
  In this position you will be responsible for leading the planning and execution of complex technology projects and initiatives spanning multiple businesses and the organization to ensure that project deliverables are provided on time, within budget and in accordance with specifications and requirements. This Senior Director is responsible for building and maintaining productive working relationships within the organization with various levels of associates and constituencies, including business, product, security, and finance leaders and teams.  
  Typically manages the integration and/or development and delivery of very large and complex deliverables directly to the enterprise. This position is accountable for managing the overall Program or collection of Projects. The Senior Director is responsible for monitoring the performance of the Project Team and its Project Managers. He/she will engage the manager of a Project Team member should a performance challenge be encountered. All cross-functional Project and Product Managers will be aligned to the Senior Director in a matrixed-management structure during the engagement, for the purpose of achieving team-based goals. The Program Manager acts as the primary contact for the Program to the Major Account’s enterprise and senior management.

ADP is searching for a Director of Marketing Measurement and Insights to support business unit marketing analytics. This player-coach position will be responsible for the leadership of analytics managers, developing & executing against analytics product roadmaps, and enhancing marketings ability to measure through the creation of trusted standardized tracking, datasources, reports, and analytics. Successful candidates will have a good understanding of B2B marketing analytics. This includes experience with email analytics, in-product marketing analytics, campaign analytics, event analytics, ABM analytics, and multi touch attribution (MTA) modeling. He/she must be able to coach, motivate, and train team members in order to drive a high-performance analytics team.
  Responsibilities
  Establish a best-in-class analytics practice that enables marketing to understand performance, optimize tactics, and plan future investments
Become a trusted analytics business partner to marketing stakeholders
Lead and mentor a team of high-performance analytics managers
Drive multi-touch attribution (MTA) adoption and ensure marketing leaders are gaining valuable insights through the development or enhancement of model logic, end user reporting, and training.

Job Title: Executive Assistant to Chief Operating Officer
Description:
At Qualtrics, we create software the world’s best brands use to deliver exceptional frontline experiences, build high-performing teams, and design products people love. But we are more than a platform—we are the creators and stewards of the Experience Management category serving over 20K clients globally. Building a category takes grit, determination, and a disdain for convention—but most of all it requires close-knit, high-functioning teams with an unwavering dedication to serving our customers.

When you join one of our teams, you’ll be part of a nimble group that’s empowered to set aggressive goals and move fast to achieve them. Strategic risks are encouraged and complex problems are solved together, by passing the mic and iterating until the best solution comes to light. You won’t have to look to find growth opportunities—ready or not, they’ll find you. From retail to government to healthcare, we’re on a mission to bring humanity, connection, and empathy back to business. Join over 5,000 people across the globe who think that’s work worth doing.
Executive Assistant
Why We Have This Role
Qualtrics is looking for an energetic individual to support our Chief Operating Officer (COO), Brian Stucki, and partner on business objectives. An ideal candidate would be someone who is an organized self-starter, who is also inventive and efficient. Being flexible and having a sense of humor while maintaining a high level of integrity and confidentiality is crucial to this role. You will have the intuition to react with appropriate urgency to emerging situations, be able to complete multiple high-priority tasks efficiently, and be comfortable to make decisions with minimal oversight or mentorship.
  How You’ll Grow
You will work with our top leaders on a daily basis and learn how the business is run.
Serve as an extension of your executive(s) and represent them and our values to the rest of the company.
Look for / identify experience gaps and suggest areas for improvement for your exec’s org and for the company as a whole.
You’ll have the opportunity to take on projects that impact the entire company and work across departments to achieve outcomes (i.e. help plan & execute events like SKO, Presidents Club, and our annual user conference - X4)
  What We’re Looking For on Your Resume
Bachelor’s degree required
Past Executive Assistant experience is required (5+ years is ideal)
Preference for experience in a fast-paced, tech startup environment
Expert-level written and verbal communication skills
Strong problem-solving skills
Strong organizational skills with the ability to stay on top of and complete multiple tasks in a timely manner

Job Title: Senior Director of Engineering - XM Platform
Description:
At Qualtrics, we create software the world’s best brands use to deliver exceptional frontline experiences, build high-performing teams, and design products people love. But we are more than a platform—we are the creators and stewards of the Experience Management category serving over 18K clients globally. Building a category takes grit, determination, and a disdain for convention—but most of all it requires close-knit, high-functioning teams with an unwavering dedication to serving our customers.

When you join one of our teams, you’ll be part of a nimble group that’s empowered to set aggressive goals and move fast to achieve them. Strategic risks are encouraged and complex problems are solved together, by passing the mic and iterating until the best solution comes to light. You won’t have to look to find growth opportunities—ready or not, they’ll find you. From retail to government to healthcare, we’re on a mission to bring humanity, connection, and empathy back to business. Join over 6,000 people across the globe who think that’s work worth doing.
    Senior Director of Engineering - XM Platform
  Why We Have This Role
  The XM Platform organization seeks a Senior Director of Software Engineering to lead and develop its six teams that manage over 9 billion profiles. This role involves guiding the creation of simple yet powerful solutions that enable customers to harness both experience data (X Data) and operational data (O Data) to gain unique insights, driving impactful interactions through targeted segments, and facilitating near real-time access to data via advanced reporting tools. The position is crucial for overseeing integrations with Ecosystem partners, powering real-time, enterprise-grade workflows with XM XFlows and elevating customer relations with XM Journeys—a leading platform as recognized by Forrester. The successful candidate will exhibit core values such as transparency, commitment, customer obsession, teamwork, and resourcefulness, while managing a team of experienced managers and engineers focused on enhancing the platform to achieve ambitious growth and customer satisfaction.
  How You’ll Find Success
Strategic Vision and Leadership
Technical Expertise
Cross Functional Collaboration
Team Building and Development
Problem Solving and Innovation
  How You’ll Grow
Take charge of a multifaceted engineering division, sharpening your leadership skills by directing seasoned managers and their teams. You'll cultivate a culture of transparency, collective ownership, and customer-centric innovation.
Steer the creation of scalable, efficient solutions that tackle complex customer challenges, enhancing your expertise in developing cutting-edge technology platforms.
Expand your strategic insight by leading the full spectrum of the product lifecycle—from roadmap formulation to execution and operational management, ensuring alignment with organizational objectives.
Collaborate with a diverse set of stakeholders and cross-functional teams, improving your ability to work in a dynamic environment and foster a one-team spirit across departments.
  Things You’ll Do
Communicate and drive engineering initiatives across functions
Define the vision and strategy for several engineering teams
Create mechanisms that ensure designs are high quality, scalable, and sustainable
Design and influence product strategy
Continually find ways to automate and optimize development processes and drive innovation
Recruit, build and develop high performing engineering teams and leaders
Develop and maintain strong collaborative relationships with key stakeholders across the company and serve as an advocate for the function
  What We’re Looking For On Your Resume
10+ years of software engineering experience with demonstrated knowledge of engineering best-practices
5+ years experience managing engineering managers
Demonstrated success building and leading high-performing cross-functional engineering teams in multiple locations.
In-depth technical knowledge on common technologies used as infrastructure
Experience working with technologies used by software developers to develop, test, deploy, and operate their services. These include, but are not limited to Docker, Nomad, Kubernetes, Puppet, and Terraform.
  What You Should Know About This Team
Our team thrives on cross-collaboration with product and UX teams to create seamless, user-centered solutions. Through collective expertise and shared goals, we drive innovation that resonates with users globally.
We are a tight-knit group of highly talented individuals, each bringing a unique set of skills and unwavering dedication to the table. Our commitment to excellence propels us to exceed performance benchmarks and deliver remarkable results.
Our work transcends local boundaries to meet ambitious global objectives. We synchronize our efforts to ensure that every product enhancement and innovation aligns with the company's international strategy and broader mission.
  Our Team’s Favorite Perks and Benefits
Wellness Reimbursement for $300 per quarter for wellness activities including gym memberships, spa massages, workout equipment, meditation apps, and much more.
$1800 Experience bonus to be used for an “Experience” of your choosing
Amazing QGroup Communities; MOSAIQ, Green Team, Qualtrics Pride, Q&Able, Qualtrics Salute, and Women’s Leadership Development, which exist as places for support, allyship, and advocacy.

Job Title: Executive Assistant - Head of EMEA Central Sales
Description:
At Qualtrics, we create software the world’s best brands use to deliver exceptional frontline experiences, build high-performing teams, and design products people love. But we are more than a platform—we are the creators and stewards of the Experience Management category serving over 18K clients globally. Building a category takes grit, determination, and a disdain for convention—but most of all it requires close-knit, high-functioning teams with an unwavering dedication to serving our customers.
When you join one of our teams, you’ll be part of a nimble group that’s empowered to set aggressive goals and move fast to achieve them. Strategic risks are encouraged and complex problems are solved together, by passing the microphone and iterating until the best solution comes to light. You won’t have to look to find growth opportunities—ready or not, they’ll find you. From retail to government to healthcare, we’re on a mission to bring humanity, connection, and empathy back to business. Join over 5,000 people across the globe who think that’s work worth doing.

Executive Assistant - Head of EMEA Central Sales
Why We Have This Role
Qualtrics is on the lookout for a proactive individual to assist the Head of EMEA Central Sales and another Executive within the EMEA Leadership team. In this role, your primary focus will be on administrative tasks, while also being given opportunities to support team objectives, basic project coordination, and even take ownership of select projects. This role offers a significant chance for career development and learning. The ideal candidate would be someone who is organised, attentive, and eager to grow professionally. You should be skilled at prioritising tasks and supporting the team efficiently. An understanding of the company's basic goals and guiding the executives towards those objectives will be expected. Adaptability, maintaining confidentiality, and a positive approach will be paramount.
    How You’ll Grow
Interdepartmental Collaboration: Supporting teams across different locations and assisting in driving team initiatives can broaden your organisational reach and deepen your understanding of cross-functional processes. This will foster your ability to work effusively with diverse groups while improving your relationship-building and interpersonal skills.
Process Improvement: The chance to be involved in process improvement initiatives allows for a deeper understanding of the organisation's operations. With time, you'll cultivate problem-solving and analytical skills, and gain a valuable perspective on improving efficiency and productivity within a complex corporate setting.
Task Prioritisation and Time Management: Managing the master schedule and ensuring executives are spending their time effectively requires significant prioritisation and time management skills. Over time, mastering these skills will position you as an efficient manager, a trait valuable not only in this role but throughout your professional journey.
Project Coordination: The role involves opportunities to coordinate specific activities and manage business gatherings - experiences that can significantly advance your project management skills. Witnessing projects from conception to completion, you will understand the challenges and learn how to overcome them.
Communication Skills: Given the nature of the role, constant interactions with different stakeholders at multiple management levels within the organisations, both internally and externally, are inevitable. This will refine your communication skills, particularly in articulating ideas effectively, managing expectations, and resolving conflicts.

Things You’ll Do
Cross Team Collaboration. Playing a crucial role in supporting teams across different locations, you'll ensure smooth communication and even help drive certain team initiatives. The Executive Assistant (EA) will assist with planning and execution of team all hands meetings, offsites, and socials. 
Rhythm of Business Coordination. The EA will manage the master schedule (including annual and quarterly meetings) by arranging meetings and ensuring that the executives are spending their time effectively on the priorities that matter. 
Process Improvement. Part of the day-to-day role for the EA will involve taking over some of the basic process improvement to support the business (e.g. see around corners to proactively solve potential issues and understand if we are making progress in areas necessary to goal completion).
Administrative Assistant & Project Management . The EA will help set and track agendas for given meetings, take notes and/or action items to document the decisions made in meetings, submit expenses monthly, and provide other administrative support as needed.
Travel and Logistics.  As an essential part of your role, you'll be tasked with ensuring that every journey—whether by land, air, or sea—is smooth, efficient, and aligned with our executives' schedules. This will involve researching the best travel options, coordinating with travel agencies, managing itineraries, and ensuring that any potential hiccups are addressed proactively. Your expertise will make certain that travel is not just about reaching the destination, but about optimizing the entire experience.

What We’re Looking For On Your CV
Administrative Assistant experience in a fast-paced, technology or startup environment.
High level of Business Acumen and ability to navigate complex corporate organisations
Fluency in English & German is required. Fluency French or Spanish or Italian is advantageous.
Experience supporting an organisation with agile processes and innovative workflows preferred.
Experience working in a sales organisation or having an understanding of a sales business is preferred.
Strong organisational skills with the ability to stay on top of and complete multiple tasks in a timely manner.
Expert level written and verbal communication skills.
Strong problem-solving skills.
Consistently produced work with the highest level of attention to detail.
Consistently deliver high-quality professional customer service to internal and external customers with the ability to be personable and happy to help in a variety of situations.
Visionary spirit: ability to take the initiative, work independently and accomplish tasks.
Adaptive: tackle new tasks with little notice or instruction.
Work collaboratively with all other executive admins at headquarters and remote locations to maintain a smoothly working corporate environment.
The utmost level of integrity and discretion in handling confidential information.

Goal-Oriented Approach: We pride ourselves on being a team that not only understands but also contributes to the achievement of the company's primary objectives. Every single task we perform is aligned with these goals.

Visionary Spirit: Our team values the ability to take initiatives, work independently, and accomplish tasks. Everyone has the freedom to think ahead, anticipate potential issues, and find ways to tackle them proactively.

Why We Have This Role

We’re helping the world’s leading companies improve experiences. Why we have this Role
Qualtrics is seeking an experienced product go-to-market (GTM) and people leader to build and lead a team of high-performing product marketers who drive product and GTM strategy for our mature Contact Center and emerging Physical Locations lines of business – across both general and industry-specifics use cases (e.g. financial services, public sector, and healthcare). These products help companies listen to customer feedback across multiple channels, such as contact centers, retail stores, social channels, and branches, in order to take action and deliver optimized omnichannel experiences at scale and in support of key commercial objectives.
In this leadership role, you will own all facets of a multi-channel GTM motion, interface directly with customers to test and evolve messaging, influence the product roadmap with customer and competitive insights, and orchestrate the production of compelling content and enablement across Sales, Revenue Marketing, Training & Enablement, and our inhouse Product Content Studio. You will report directly to the Global Head of Product Marketing.
How You’ll Find Success
This full-funnel role develops Product go-to-market strategies that position the company to achieve long-term growth in the experience management space while meeting annual revenue and profitability goals. PMMs are responsible for their line of business GTM, defining strategic direction and driving execution to achieve long-term business goals. 
You will know your customers, the market, and our business so intimately that you define and communicate a clear, differentiated, defensible, and monetizable market position. You’ll display extreme ownership, be adept at stakeholder management across both Product and Sales, and be confident in prioritization. Most critically, you will excel at building and supporting successful teams in order to amplify the influence of PMM across the overall company, and nurture key talent within the company.
How You’ll Grow
You will have the opportunity to play a pivotal role in the success of our Customer Experience line of business. This role will allow you to build your expertise in Product and GTM strategy, cross-functional collaboration, executive and customer presentations, and people leadership.
Things You’ll Do
Team Leadership: Build, mentor, and lead a high-performing product marketing team, providing guidance and support to help them excel in their roles.
Product Positioning and Messaging: Define and communicate compelling product positioning and messaging that resonates with target customers and differentiates our products in the marketplace. This role has responsibilities for identifying customer needs for both general use cases, as well as industry-specific ones within our key verticals of financial services, public sector, and healthcare.
Go-to-Market Planning: Develop and execute go-to-market plans for new product launches and sales programs, including target customer segments, pricing strategies, and marketing campaigns.
Competitive Analysis: Conduct in-depth competitive analysis to understand the market landscape, identify opportunities, and mitigate potential threats.
Sales Enablement: Collaborate with Sales, Revenue Marketing, Training & Enablement, and our inhouse Product Content Studio to develop effective sales plays, training materials, and collateral that support the selling process.
Customer Insights: Use customer feedback and market research to gain insights into customer needs in order to inform go-to-market strategies and the product roadmap.
Product Launches: Manage and coordinate product launches, ensuring successful execution and maximum impact in the market.
What We’re Looking For On Your Resume
15+ years of experience in B2B SaaS Marketing, with 8+ in customer-facing roles
Bachelor's degree and or equivalent preferred
Experience in managing GTM motions at scale to yield predictable results
Exceptional verbal and written communication skills
Strong stakeholder management skills especially at the senior level; can develop and maintain effective working relationships across both technical and commercial roles – including Engineering, User Experience Design, Product Management, Sales, Marketing, PR, Customer Success, and Operations 
Ability to make meaningful headway in highly ambiguous environments and inspire teams to see opportunity through both high times and challenges
Demonstrated ability to recruit and develop high-performing talent, with a focus on creating psychological safety for diverse teams and building inclusive cultures
What You Should Know About This Team
Sits at the center of our efforts to bring experience management and product innovation to the market
Has high visibility and deep collaboration opportunities across all major functions in our PXE (Product, Experience Design, Engineering) and GTM organizations
Embraces their role as the voice of the market to product and the voice of product to the market, spending significant time in the Field to understand customer needs
Dedicated to the craft of Product Marketing and producing excellent GTM strategies and assets to demonstrate our value
Our Team’s Favorite Perks and Benefits
Competitive salary, performance bonuses, generous 401(k) Match
Wellness Reimbursement for $300 per quarter for wellness activities including gym memberships, spa massages, workout equipment, meditation apps, and much more.
$1800 Experience bonus to be used for an “Experience” of your choosing
Unlimited Sick Days
Amazing QGroup Communities; MOSAIQ, Green Team, Qualtrics Pride, Q&Able, Qualtrics Salute, and Women’s Leadership Development, which exist as places for support, allyship, and advocacy.
Free food and drinks, and amenities like massage chairs, table tennis, and more
Must be legally authorized to work in the job location without Qualtrics sponsorship now or in the future.
 For full-time positions, this pay range is for base per year; however, base pay offered may vary depending on location, job-related knowledge, education, skills, and experience. For part-time or intern positions, this pay range is for base pay per hour. A sign-on bonus and restricted stock units may be included in an employment offer, in addition to a range of medical, financial, and other benefits, based on eligibility criteria.

Get to know Okta

Okta is The World’s Identity Company. We free everyone to safely use any technology—anywhere, on any device or app. Our Workforce and Customer Identity Clouds enable secure yet flexible access, authentication, and automation that transforms how people move through the digital world, putting Identity at the heart of business security and growth. 

At Okta, we celebrate a variety of perspectives and experiences. We are not looking for someone who checks every single box - we’re looking for lifelong learners and people who can make us better with their unique experiences. 

Join our team! We’re building a world where Identity belongs to you.
Job Summary:
We are seeking a highly motivated and experienced Global Renewal Sales Leader to join our team. This role is responsible for driving the renewal sales strategy across the company’s global markets, ensuring customer satisfaction, and maximizing revenue opportunities through the renewal of existing contracts.  The Global Renewal Sales Leader will be responsible for delivering $1.1B in annual renewals in FY25, closing $2.4B in total contract value, and building and leading a team of 80 highly skilled professionals working in the United States, Europe, and Asia/Pacific/Japan   The leader will be a key member of the Okta Customer First leadership team working closely with other leaders in Customer First, Sales, Operations, and Engineering.
Key Responsibilities:
Develop and implement a comprehensive global renewal sales strategy that aligns with the company’s overall objectives and strategy delivering $1.1B in renewal ARR and $2.4B in total contract value.
Develop the global renewal strategy and lead the development of regional plans to include a multiple-channel go-to-market strategy that includes: direct customer engagement, partners, outsourcers, and digital.
Lead and manage a global team of 80+ renewal sales professionals, setting clear goals and performance metrics.
Develop a culture of transparency, innovation, integrity, and empowerment.
Collaborate with sales, operations, engineering, support, professional services, customer success, and account management teams to identify renewal opportunities and develop related strategies.
Ensure the highest standards of compliance and security are upheld across all services.
Establish and maintain strong relationships with key customers and stakeholders to ensure high renewal rates.
Develop and aggressively implement strategies and change to reflect industry/market trends, best practices, and technological advancements to keep the company at the forefront of SaaS renewal sales.
Provide regular reports and forecasts on renewal sales performance to senior management.
Work closely with the marketing team to create effective renewal campaigns and collateral.
Ensure the team is equipped with the necessary training and resources to achieve their goals.
Negotiate contract terms and conditions with clients as needed.
Implement best practices and continuous improvement initiatives in the renewal sales process.
Qualifications:
Bachelor’s degree in Business Administration, Sales, Marketing, or a related field.  An MBA is a plus but not required.
Minimum of 10 years of experience in sales, with a focus on renewal sales or account management.
Proven track record of leading and scaling renewal sales teams in a global context.
Excellent communication, negotiation, and interpersonal skills.
Strong analytical and strategic thinking abilities.
Ability to work in a fast-paced and dynamic environment.
Proficient in Salesforce.com, Google, and Microsoft Office Suite.
Willingness to travel globally and frequently.
What We Offer:
Competitive salary and performance-based bonuses.
Opportunity to work in a dynamic, innovative, and global environment.
Comprehensive benefits package including health, dental, and vision insurance.
Career development and continuous learning opportunities.
Inclusive and diverse company culture.
How to Apply:
Interested candidates should submit their resume along with a cover letter explaining their interest and qualifications for the role.
Application Deadline: April 1, 2024

This role is responsible for profitably driving the professional services strategy and plan across the company’s global markets, ensuring service excellence, customer satisfaction, customer success, and software sales growth.  The Global Leader of Professional Services will be responsible for: profitably delivering $80M in bookings/billings, enabling partners to deliver on behalf of Okta, and building and leading a team of 200 highly skilled professionals working in the United States, Europe, and Asia/Pacific/Japan.  The leader will be a key member of the Okta Customer First leadership team working closely with other leaders in Customer First, Sales, Operations, and Engineering. Profitably deliver $80M in bookings/billings.

Description:

Okta is The World’s Identity Company. Join our team! We’re building a world where Identity belongs to you.
Okta is The World’s Identity Company. We free everyone to safely use any technology—anywhere, on any device or app. Our Workforce and Customer Identity Clouds enable secure yet flexible access,
authentication, and automation that transforms how people move through the digital world, putting Identity is at the heart of business security and growth. 
At Okta, we celebrate a variety of perspectives and experiences. We are not looking for someone who
checks every single box - we’re looking for lifelong learners and people who can make us better with their unique experiences.
Join our team! We’re building a world where Identity belongs to you.
Okta is the leading independent provider of identity for the enterprise. The Okta Identity Cloud enables organizations to securely connect the right people to the right technologies at the right time. With thousands of pre-built integrations to applications and infrastructure providers, Okta customers can easily and securely use the best technologies for their business. Over 18,000 organizations trust Okta to help protect the identities of their workforces and customers.
We are seeking an experienced Finance Director who will be a leader in the FP&A ; Organization and is excited about driving and effectively scaling Okta’s growth. This person will report to the Vice President of GTM Finance and will partner with the Chief Customer Officer and their senior leadership and teams
on all planning, forecasting, and analysis activities.  This is a fantastic opportunity for a candidate who wants to be part of a dynamic FP&A ;An  organization that is operating at an accelerated pace and scaling for
the future.   
The ideal candidate is highly motivated, a team player, a confident business partner, capable of driving
action cross-functionally, analytical, and outstanding at FP&A . AnThis person is comfortable operating at
all levels, with an eye on the strategic big picture, while skillfully managing the financial details.
Job Duties and Responsibilities:
 Be a strategic finance partner to the Chief Customer Officer who is responsible for the Customer Success, Customer Support, Global Services as well as Renewals groups. Also, build strongr elationships and finance partnerships with each of those functional leaders.
 Be involved in long-range planning for Customer First organization to ensure alignment with supporting Okta’s evolving business by segment, market, and geography.
 Partner with Sales Finance to ensure alignment of services financial plan and initiatives with
Sales short and long-range plan.
Work closely with Customer First Operations leadership and teams to facilitate planning and
execution.
 Manage and report on all financial aspects of the full P&L for Global Services.
 Own the budgeting and forecasting processes for the CCO, including:
Partnering with business partners to ensure accuracy for headcount, program spending, and other key metrics based on operational performance
 Preparing budget vs. actual variance analysis and other relevant reporting
 Leading thoughtful analysis, evaluating key drivers and metrics, and partnering on driving operational efficiencies
 Collaborating with the controllership organization on accruals as well as   other elements of the closed process
 Evolving these processes, as needed
 Develop monthly/quarterly management reports regarding the underlying   performance, leading indicators, validation of plan assumptions, and key   metrics on the business
 Work closely with the Customer First operations team to deliver   consolidated  metrics including core financials plus utilization rates, bill rates,  etc., and help drive solutions to maximize the impact of metrics to performance.
 Facilitate and drive frequent ad hoc as well as targeted projects to support senior management on business decisions
 Lead process and systems improvement and scaling projects for your area and partner on cross functional teams, to drive the company’s continued growth and scaling.

Skills Required:
Analytical Skills: Ability to work independently, think objectively, and interpret meaningful and insightful narratives from both quantitative as well as qualitative data
 Financial and Business Acumen:  Ability to evaluate financial and business indicators and translate as well as distill data into actionable information to drive results
 Problem Solving & Decision Quality:  Ability to apply rigorous logic and sound methods to solve multi-faceted problems with effective solutions
 Relationship Management:  Able to build constructive and effective relationships with a broad and diverse group of business partners, inclusive of senior members of management
 Ability to influence at all levels, with a demonstrated aptitude to work effectively within a matrixed team across multiple functional areas, and be assertive in driving successful management strategies
 Presentation Skills:  Effective in a variety of presentation settings including one-on-one, small,and large groups.
Job Requirements:
10+ years of progressive experience in FP&A with experience with 5+ years having supported a rapidly growing customer success/support and/or global services organizations, highly preferred.
 Strong communication skills and senior-level presentation experience
 Experience building high-performing teams
 High proficiency with FP&A systems required, Anaplan & Tableau experience is a HUGE plus
 Excellent financial modeling and analysis skills
Advanced Excel and strong PowerPoint skills are required
 Prior experience with SalesForce.com is a plus
 Prior experience in a high-growth high tech/software/SaaS organization is a plus
Bachelor's degree in Accounting, Business, or equivalent from an accredited college/university; CPA or another advanced professional credential is preferred

Job Title: Director, Global Physical Security and Safety
Description:
Get to know Okta

Okta is The World’s Identity Company. We free everyone to safely use any technology—anywhere, on any device or app. Our Workforce and Customer Identity Clouds enable secure yet flexible access, authentication, and automation that transforms how people move through the digital world, putting Identity at the heart of business security and growth. 

At Okta, we celebrate a variety of perspectives and experiences. We are not looking for someone who checks every single box - we’re looking for lifelong learners and people who can make us better with their unique experiences. 

Join our team! We’re building a world where Identity belongs to you.
Position Overview:
We are seeking a highly skilled and experienced Director of Global Physical Security and Safety to oversee and manage all aspects of our organization's physical security, employee health and safety, and Global Security Operations Center (GSOC). This position is within Okta’s People & Places team and reports to the Head of Global Workplace & Safety.  The ideal candidate will be a strategic thinker with a proven track record of implementing comprehensive security and safety programs on a global scale.
Responsibilities
Develop and implement global physical security policies, procedures, and standards to protect company assets, employees, and visitors.
Lead and manage a team responsible for overseeing security operations across multiple locations worldwide.
Develop and maintain health and safety policies and procedures in compliance with local, national, and international regulations and standards
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to assess security risks and vulnerabilities and develop mitigation strategies.
Oversee the operation and continuous improvement of the Global Security Operations Center (GSOC), ensuring 24/7 monitoring and response capabilities.
Establish and maintain relationships with external partners, including law enforcement agencies, government entities, and security vendors.
Develop and conduct security awareness training programs for employees to promote a culture of safety and security.
Monitor industry trends and emerging threats to proactively adjust security strategies and protocols as needed.
Responsible for ensuring regular audits and assessments of physical security measures comply with regulatory requirements and industry best practices.
Develop and manage the departmental budget, allocating resources effectively to support security initiatives.
Serve as a subject matter expert on security and safety matters, providing guidance and recommendations to the executive leadership team.
Qualifications
Bachelor's degree in a relevant field such as Criminal Justice, Security Management, or Business Administration.
Minimum ten years of corporate security experience, focusing on physical security and employee health and safety.
Proven experience leading global security initiatives and managing teams in a complex, multinational organization.
Strong understanding of security technologies, including access control systems, video surveillance, and incident management, and protective intelligence platforms.
Experience managing a Global Security Operations Center (GSOC) or similar command center environment.
Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to effectively engage and influence stakeholders at all levels of the organization.
Demonstrated ability to think strategically and develop innovative solutions to complex security challenges.
Security industry professional certifications are desirable.
Experience working in high-risk environments or industries such as technology, finance, or manufacturing is a plus.
Ability to travel domestically and internationally as needed.
Location
This position is US-based and located within a commutable distance of one of our Okta offices (DC, Chicago, NY, SF, Bellevue) with domestic and international travel required.

Job Title: Head of Corporate Financial Planning & Analysis (FP&A)
Description:
Get to know Okta

Okta is The World’s Identity Company. We free everyone to safely use any technology—anywhere, on any device or app. Our Workforce and Customer Identity Clouds enable secure yet flexible access, authentication, and automation that transforms how people move through the digital world, putting Identity at the heart of business security and growth. 

At Okta, we celebrate a variety of perspectives and experiences. We are not looking for someone who checks every single box - we’re looking for lifelong learners and people who can make us better with their unique experiences. 

Join our team! We’re building a world where Identity belongs to you.
Head of Corporate Financial Planning & Analysis (FP&A)
The Head of Corporate Financial Planning & Analysis (FP&A) is a key leader partnering with senior leadership across Okta to meet the company's financial objectives, identifying risks and opportunities across the business. The successful candidate will build strategic partnerships across functional teams, leading to improved processes, accurate forecasts and transparency around key operating metrics. This position reports to the Head of FP&A.
Lead quarterly outlook and monthly financial income statement and cash flow forecast processes, resulting in added visibility, a clear understanding of business trends and overall financial outlook, and meeting accuracy targets.
Drive the financial long-range planning (LRP) and annual budgeting processes to achieve the overall company strategy, partnering with key stakeholders across FP&A, Operations and Corporate strategy.
Conduct ad-hoc analyses with the ability to summarize and present findings clearly to executive leadership team members.
Partner with Finance Transformation, Business Technology (IT), and Data & Insights on systems/tools roadmaps, process improvements, reporting and analytics, and automation opportunities to prioritize and improve forecasting, planning, reporting, and other vital areas to scale the function and organization.
Be a strategic financial partner to the CFO, FP&A Leadership, and IR Leadership.
Partner with the Accounting, Tax, Treasury and Accounting Operations organizations on the close and earnings release processes.
Lead corporate FP&A team of 15 based in the US and India, with a heavy emphasis on coaching and managing for performance, career development, and attracting and retaining talent.


What We Need From You
15+ years of relevant FP&A experience, with at least 5 years directly managing people and teams.
Bachelor's degree in Finance, Accounting, or related Business field;  MBA a plus.
You have deep experience in public company SaaS/software, with a command of the SaaS industry and related metrics.
You have excellent leadership, interpersonal, communication and business partnering skills, with a track record of collaborating across organizational functions and levels to accomplish team goals.
You are a strategic thinker with strong analytical skills who can simplify the complex, make/drive decisions, and adapt to changing environments.
You have a strong understanding of FP&A systems and related critical systems (ERP, HCM) and can partner with key stakeholders to develop and execute on an integrated strategy.

Head of Global Payroll
Okta is seeking a top-tier candidate to develop and execute the overall strategic vision for its global payroll department. As the Head of Global Payroll, you will be responsible for overseeing all aspects of the company's payroll function, including payroll operations, accounting, compliance, and international expansion.
  The ideal candidate will lead the day-to-day global payroll operations which include supporting international expansion efforts and complying with local statutory regulations. This leader will be a key partner in developing and implementing strategies to scale the global payroll operations and systems efficiently while maintaining quality, accuracy, internal controls and compliance. This position is best suited for a career-minded payroll professional who is detail-oriented and enjoys working in a meaningful, fast-paced environment.
  This role is based out of Okta’s headquarters in San Francisco, CA, and reports to the VP of Accounting.
    What you’ll be doing 
Develop and execute the payroll function's vision, strategy, and mission, aligned with the company's strategic objectives
Lead and mentor a global team of payroll professionals, fostering a collaborative and high-performing culture while championing a continuous improvement mindset
Oversee payroll operations with 24+ countries, ensuring accuracy, timeliness, and compliance with applicable laws and regulations
Identify and mitigate potential payroll-related risks and implement controls to prevent errors, fraud, or compliance violations
Build and nurture strong relationships with payroll service providers
Evaluate, select, implement, and maintain payroll software and systems to streamline processes and improve efficiency
Establish and standardize global payroll policies, processes, and procedures while accommodating regional variations and legal requirements
Ensure compliance with all relevant payroll regulations, including considering Sarbanes-Oxley (SOX) and other legal requirements applicable to the payroll function in each country of operation
Ensure the confidentiality and security of payroll data, adhering to data privacy regulations and safeguarding sensitive employee information
Collaborate with the Finance, People and Legal teams to support the company's global expansion efforts by providing payroll expertise and coordinating payroll setup in new regions
Provide regular payroll-related reports, operational and financial metrics, and insights to senior management, supporting decision-making and strategic planning
Manage payroll audit inquiries requests from both internal and external audit parties. Work with tax agencies and payroll service providers to resolve external tax issues and audits


What you’ll bring to the role
Bachelor’s Degree in Business, Finance / Accounting, or a related discipline
Certified Payroll Professional (CPP) 
15+ overall years of work experience including at least 7+ years experience with multi-state and international payroll and taxes including global mobility taxes
6+ years of managing a global payroll team consisting of 5 or more employees
Experience with payrolls larger than 7,000 employees
Strong leadership and team management skills with a proven track record of building high-performing teams
Exceptional communication and stakeholder management skills with the ability to effectively collaborate with internal teams, external partners, and senior management
Comprehensive knowledge of payroll software and systems, as well as the ability to evaluate, implement, or upgrade payroll technology as needed. Advanced level experience of Workday required
Extensive experience in establishing and standardizing policies, processes, procedures and controls to maximize automation, scalability, and cost-effectiveness
Highly proficient in interpreting local and international payroll rules and regulations
Deep understanding of equity reporting processes as it relates to payroll and payroll taxes globally
Experience implementing payroll in new countries and for acquired companies
Strong financial acumen and analytical skills, showcasing demonstrated commercial judgment and creative problem-solving abilities
Knowledge of data privacy regulations and the ability to maintain strict data protection protocols to safeguard sensitive employee information
Highly analytical with working knowledge of general payroll protocols and accounting principles

We are seeking a dynamic and experienced Senior Director of Global Workplace Operations to lead and oversee the strategic planning, development, and management of workplace operations on a global scale. The ideal candidate will have a strong background in facilities management, workplace strategy, and operational excellence, with a proven ability to drive efficiency, innovation, and collaboration across diverse locations.
Key Responsibilities:
Develop and Implement Global Workplace Strategy: Lead the development and implementation of a comprehensive workplace strategy that aligns with the company's vision, values, and business objectives. This includes establishing and setting clear goals for the Food & Beverage program and the Global Culture & Connection program.
Oversee the management of facilities, services, and resources to ensure safe, efficient, and effective workplace environments.
Lead and mentor a high-performing team of workplace operations professionals, providing guidance, support, and development opportunities.
Establish and maintain strong relationships with key stakeholders, including senior leadership, business units, and external partners.
Drive continuous improvement initiatives to enhance workplace processes, technology, and sustainability practices.
Monitor and analyze key performance indicators to track operational performance, identify areas for improvement, and implement corrective actions as needed.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to support workplace design and construction projects, workplace technology solutions, and emergency preparedness planning.
Ensure compliance with local regulations, industry standards, and best practices related to workplace operations and health and safety requirements.
Develop and manage the departmental budget, ensuring cost-effective operations and resource allocation.
Stay informed about emerging trends and best practices in workplace operations, facilities management, and employee experience to drive innovation and excellence.
Qualifications
Bachelor's degree in facilities management, business administration, or a related field 
Minimum of 10 years of experience in workplace operations, facilities management, or a related field, with at least 5 years in a senior leadership role.
Proven track record of successfully managing global workplace operations in a complex and dynamic environment.
Strong leadership and team-building skills, with the ability to inspire and motivate team members to achieve excellence.
Excellent communication, negotiation, and problem-solving abilities.
Strategic thinker with the ability to develop and implement long-term plans and initiatives.
Knowledge of workplace technology solutions, sustainability practices, and industry trends.
Professional certifications in facilities management (e.g., CFM, FMP) are a plus.
Additional Information
Able to travel domestically and internationally approximately 25% of the time
If you are a visionary leader with a passion for creating exceptional workplace environments and driving operational excellence on a global scale, we invite you to apply for the position of Senior Director of Global Workplace Operations and be a key driver of our organization's success.

  The Deal Strategy Team

Head of America Deal Strategy Opportunity
Okta is seeking a world-class deal strategy leader to partner with the America Go-To-Market teams to grow the business and close the best deals possible. The Head of America Deal Strategy will set the strategy and direction with NA GTM leadership to help Okta scale to $4B+ through driving innovative approaches and operational excellence to help the field win.
This role requires strong cross functional executive collaboration and influence along with the ability to deal with ambiguity, come up with creative solutions and drive urgency with quarterly business cadence while transforming for scale. The person in this role will work across NA GTM leadership and cross-functional support teams such as Legal and Finance to determine the best deal structures as we ramp up the business.. In addition, this leader will work with the broader business planning team including P&P, Business Value and compete along with IT to support the successful rollout of new offers and programs to market.
As Okta rapidly launches new innovations and expands into new markets, this role is critical to our success. A successful leader in this role will have a combination of skills across deal strategy & management, customer negotiations, business value positioning, deal analytics, program management, communication, influencing and collaboration.
What you’ll be doing
Drive deals management strategies that will help Okta scale to $4B+ in revenue.
Work closely with leaders in the GTM teams to craft deal proposals while evaluating and applying new buying programs, business models and monetization strategies. 
Gather GTM team feedback on deal quality and velocity improvement proposals.
Provide well-reasoned deal structuring guidelines and optimization recommendations to GTM leaders across the organization and the executive team.
Govern commercial terms and non-standard approvals.
Define and evaluate Key Performance Indicators to track the impact of deal strategies and guidelines.
Support customer facing discussions (where appropriate) to help sales win business.
SME support for deal enablement and training content for the sales team to help best position deal commercial terms and conditions with customers.
Provide targeted in-deal support to the sales team to assist in strategic precedent setting opportunities.
Coach and develop team members to allow for further scale and optimization while setting priorities to maximize the team's impact.
What you’ll bring to the role
10+ years of experience in a sales support role, inclusive of a minimum of 7 years in a deal strategy role, preferably at a SaaS or enterprise software company.  
Minimum of 3 years of direct people management experience.
Ability to quickly grasp new product and business model concepts, consistently apply critical and structured thinking to new areas.
Action-oriented to solve problems and get a lot done in short timeframes.
Demonstrated leadership experience driving complex, cross-functional execution.
Exceptional communication and collaboration skills across all levels of an organization. 
Bachelor’s degree in Computer science, Engineering, Finance, Marketing, Business or an equivalent; MBA preferred.

Okta is seeking a world-class Pricing Strategy leader to identify and drive business growth strategies across the portfolio. This lead will drive the creation of monetization strategy proposals, application of new monetization models, list to net price optimization strategies and models, identification, and pursuit of new go-to-market growth strategies, quantitative market research and analysis, customer and field validation for innovation launches and updates at Okta. They will drive strategy decision approvals and ensure downstream implementation dependencies are lined up to operationalize. 
This role requires strong cross-functional executive collaboration and influence along with the ability to deal with ambiguity while building and transforming for scale.  This leader will have team management responsibilities to drive company-level initiatives.  The person in this role will work across Sales, Go-to-market & Product leadership teams to determine the best list to net price optimization strategies and plans as we launch new innovations. They will drive and maintain the monetization strategy roadmap and work with product management and business operations teams to implement pricing and packaging changes within the product and the quote to cash systems. Finally, this leader will be responsible for driving the change management and alignment to ensure that the proposal lands successfully with the field and customers. 
As Okta rapidly launches new innovations and expands into new markets, this role is critical to our success. A successful leader in this role will have a combination of skills across product strategy & management, customer research and market insights, business strategy, analytics, program management, communication, influencing, and collaboration.
Core responsibilities will include:
Drive list to net price realization and optimization strategies across products, services, geos, GTM programs, and routes to market
Define and launch monetization and go-to-market pricing and discounting strategies that will help Okta scale to $4B+ in revenue
Lead company-wide priority to drive discount guidance for the field. Define and evaluate Key Performance Indicators to track price realization across geos/ segments, socialize results with Sales leaders, and recommend improvements
Work closely with leaders in the Sales, GTM, Product, and Product Marketing teams to craft new packaging and pricing strategy proposals for new and existing product innovations.
Drive cross-sell and up-sell opportunities through bundling and enterprise buying programs (ex. ELAs) that balance portfolio-level simplification with value capture.
Provide content inputs for Okta’s official pricing web pages.
SME support for pricing enablement and training content for the sales team to help best position pricing conversations with customers.
Provide targeted in-deal support to the sales team to assist in strategic precedent-setting opportunities.
Build and manage a team to scale business impact
Required Skills:
Bachelor’s degree in Computer science, Engineering, Finance, Marketing, Business or an equivalent; MBA preferred.
10+ years of experience across strategy consulting, pricing, strategic finance, corporate strategy, deal strategy & value management, ideally at a SaaS or enterprise software company
5+ years in a monetization/pricing strategy role with experience managing strategy & execution for pricing waterfalls from the list to net prices
3+ years of direct people management experience
Experience using analytics and BI solutions (e.g. Tableau).
Ability to quickly grasp new product concepts across a variety of technologies, and consistently apply critical and structured thinking to new areas.
Strong analytical background with experience running and analyzing large financial and customer data.
Action-oriented to solve problems and get a lot done in short timeframes.
Demonstrated leadership experience driving complex, cross-functional initiatives.
Exceptional communication and collaboration skills across all levels of an organization.

  Okta is looking for a results-oriented and strategic head of Marketing for our Enterprise and Strategic Account business in the Americas. You will be a member of the Americas Marketing Leadership Team and will have a passion for driving revenue and digging into new Go-To-Market challenges. 
You are a seasoned growth marketer who thrives in a dynamic environment and moves quickly to build structure and process. You will lead the team of marketing professionals and be responsible for the development of the regional marketing strategy for Okta’s US Enterprise & Strategic businesses as well as all segments in Canada and LaTAM.  
In this role, you will lead the development of a comprehensive plan to drive the creation and execution of integrated, online, and offline programs that build the demand strategy to fuel Okta’s growth through new customer acquisition and cross-selling to existing customers.  You will work extensively with sales, partners, campaigns, and global marketing to design, execute and measure demand generation and qualification programs to support pipeline growth in the Americas.  
Duties and Responsibilities:
Responsible for setting and delivering the marketing strategy for our US Enterprise & Strategic business + all segments in Canada and Latin America, aligning closely with key stakeholders (in sales, channels and marketing)
Lead a high-performing team to execute impactful marketing programs that drive results and meet the needs of the region and business
Build an integrated marketing plan that combines both locally created marketing programs and global activities into one integrated approach working in partnership with the global marketing teams – including global campaigns, digital marketing, strategic events, PR/comms, brand & data analytics 
Work hand in hand with Partner Marketing & Sales Leadership to drive all routes-to-market that drive impact within your segments in the Americas. Activate Global Partner Marketing programs as well as advise Global Partner team on marketing techniques that drive demand in the region
Collaborate with Customer Marketing, inclusive of customer advocacy programs which include references, customer stories
Review the marketing funnel, through a data driven approach, improving, and executing marketing programs. Drive tight interlock and accountability with xDR team
Target Account Marketing Manage strategic approaches to the market at an account level with a keen understanding of leveraging account plans and ABM analytics for marketing success
Act as a liaison between your segments and Global Marketing; be the face of marketing to field sales teams, and conversely communicate the needs of the field back to Global Marketing teams
Qualifications:
Strategic marketing leader with proven track record of success developing go to market strategies, driving customer engagement programs, digital demand/lead generation, account-based marketing and leading teams that have cross functional dependencies and accountabilities to other lines of business. 
Demonstrated track record in generating proven marketing-oriented business growth for a global B2B, including a history of results in transforming and modernizing marketing capabilities.
Strong analytical capabilities & history of using data & analytics to lead marketing functions
Ability to integrate the “magic” and “math” of marketing. 
Specific successes in re-imagining end to end demand generation efforts & driving interlock between sales and marketing leadership. Experience in sales a plus.
Proven ability to manage influence through persuasion, negotiation & consensus building.
Strong people leader who role models Okta’s leadership expectations and behaviors.
Demonstrated ability, determination, and tenacity to move major initiatives forward and drive focus while consistently thinking of the bottom-line impact of the efforts.
Experience leading distributed, global teams
A mindset of continuous improvement.
Strong empathy for customers and passion for revenue and growth

Job Title: Area Sales Director, Identity Security Management
Description:
Get to know Okta

Okta is The World’s Identity Company. We free everyone to safely use any technology—anywhere, on any device or app. Our Workforce and Customer Identity Clouds enable secure yet flexible access, authentication, and automation that transforms how people move through the digital world, putting Identity at the heart of business security and growth. 

At Okta, we celebrate a variety of perspectives and experiences. We are not looking for someone who checks every single box - we’re looking for lifelong learners and people who can make us better with their unique experiences. 

Join our team! We’re building a world where Identity belongs to you.
The Area Sales Director, Enterprise Opportunity
The ASD of our Identity Security Sales team will manage a team of ISM Account Executives to bring Okta’s Security Management product to our existing install base and prospects.  You and your team will operate within a dynamic startup-like environment backed by strong GTM ecosystem support, enabling you to excel in your role, and become an expert in the Okta Security Management product area.
What you’ll be doing 
Attract, recruit, hire, and mentor the ISM Account Executive sales team. 
Create an open, inclusive team oriented environment, building a results-driven culture of accountability and transparency.
Engaging cross-functionally with your peers to identify and execute opportunities for  Identity Security Management within accounts with strong product fit
Lead by example, set expectations, follow through effectively and provide coaching and mentorship as needed and ensure that managers do the same for their team.
Be accountable for consistently delivering and overachieving against targets – ensuring Okta’s goals, and objectives are achieved consistently and sustainably.
Analyze data and dynamics to maximize existing successes and to create new sales growth opportunities
Accurately forecast monthly, quarterly, and annual targets for assigned regions; establish and manage data and supporting metrics (pipeline coverage, ASP, etc.)
Put into place sales force structure, process strategies, and strategic resource plans that will capture key opportunities in target markets, Enterprise and Strategic accounts/prospects, partners or industry verticals throughout the Region.
Own the pipeline generation strategy and with internal stakeholders to execute against the strategy.
Maintain market intelligence and develop strategies to maintain Okta’s leadership position.
Exhibit a growth mindset with the ability to outline the long term vision and strategy.
What you’ll bring to the role
10+ years’ experience building and running Enterprise sales teams in the software industry
3+ years’ experience as a front line sales leader
Experience in rapidly growing a new product line
Strong understanding of identity management and security solutions
Deep understanding of SaaS / Cloud Go-To-Market and the required roles for effective customer engagement
Relevant software industry experience in any of the following: IT systems, cloud enterprise or infrastructure management, application development and management, security, business applications and/or analytics. 
History of consistently meeting/exceeding targets and objectives personally and as a leader
Excellent leadership and influencing skills; ability to build strong business partnerships both outside, and within the organization
Mastery of consultative/solution selling methodologies like MEDDPICC, Challenger, Solution Selling, and Sandler
Technical aptitude and are experienced selling into CEOs, CFOs, CIOs, CTOs and Lines of Business
