Description:
Get to know Okta

Okta is The World’s Identity Company. We free everyone to safely use any technology—anywhere, on any device or app. Our Workforce and Customer Identity Clouds enable secure yet flexible access, authentication, and automation that transforms how people move through the digital world, putting Identity at the heart of business security and growth. 

At Okta, we celebrate a variety of perspectives and experiences. We are not looking for someone who checks every single box - we’re looking for lifelong learners and people who can make us better with their unique experiences. 

Join our team! We’re building a world where Identity belongs to you.
Position Description: The Area Sales Director, Strategic Sales is responsible for the development and business results of a team of quota-carrying Strategic Account Executives in their region. Each Strategic Account Executive is responsible for maintaining high activity standards; daily prospecting, pipeline growth, prospect qualification, and delivering assigned monthly sales revenue targets. The right Sales Leader for this position should have the ability to increase the productivity of account executives through skill development, adherence to activity standards, providing inspiration, rapid conflict resolution and building a highly empowered, constructive sales culture.
Job Duties and Responsibilities:
Lead the team of Strategic Account Executives in achieving individual and team quota
Support direct reports by participating and leading in client and prospect meetings or engaging other resources as required
Ongoing mentoring and development of sales team which includes recruiting, hiring and mentoring new reps
Conduct weekly forecast meetings
You will be reporting on sales activity and forecast to senior sales management
Consistently monitoring the sales activity of the team, and tracking the results
Quote, negotiate, and assist sales reps in closing highly complex transactions through the development of executive-level relationships with key prospects
Manage daily and weekly activities, pipelines, forecasts and closed deals to ensure above-quota results based on successful pipeline management
Coordinate and lead weekly and monthly one-on-one and team-wide pipeline reviews, meetings and training sessions to ensure ongoing improvement.
Work closely with extended team of pre-sales, services, training, legal, renewals business partners
Required Skills:
Demonstrated success in leading a high-performing enterprise sales team within a software sales environment
Experience of handling individual contributors
Successful track record in a high volume transaction sales environment
Excellent presentation and listening skills
Should be able to thrive in a very rapidly changing environment
Ability to successfully hire and train new sales representatives
Successful history of closing business, and over-achieving quota
Demonstrated ability to accurately forecast sales results
Ability to work in a fast-growing, exciting environment
Collaboration and good communication skills.
Ability to travel as needed

Okta’s Area Vice President, Corporate Sales (West) will be responsible for building and leading our Corporate Business unit in their Region. Our ideal candidate is an energetic, dynamic, and proactive team player who can simultaneously partner with executive leadership and work hands-on alongside our front line team. 
What you’ll be doing
Lead a high-performance sales organization of Corporate Directors and Account Executives
Build a team of top talent and deliver productivity that consistently exceeds standards and objectives 
Execute value-based solution selling techniques and further develop a culture of consultative sales 
Drive Corporate revenue growth through a combination of outbound prospecting and AE sourced pipeline, extreme focus on new logo acquisition, skilled at both velocity based and strategic sales cycles, strategic account planning, cross selling new products/use cases to existing customers
Recruit, develop, and retain top talent providing career development and  performance management so that at least 75% exceed quota and we experience no more than 10% regrettable attrition 
Build a strong cross-functional operating cadence with teams around pipeline, forecasting, deal review, execution, deployment and revenue realization
Partner with cross-functional teams (Renewals, Customer Success, BD, and Marketing) on strategy and execution to drive adoption, increase productivity, and reduce/eliminate customer churn 
What you’ll bring to the role
10+ years of experience in B2B Enterprise Sales, with a track record of over attainment
5+ years of building and leading high-performance SaaS B2B sales teams 
2nd line leadership experience 
Experience in the security/SaaS industries 
Solid technical and commercial skills with an ability to operate independently 
Superb communication and presentation skills; able to communicate at the C-level
Willing to travel ~25%
BS/BA degree strongly preferred

Job Title: Area Vice President, Strategic Sales Central
Description:
Get to know Okta

Okta is The World’s Identity Company. We free everyone to safely use any technology—anywhere, on any device or app. Our Workforce and Customer Identity Clouds enable secure yet flexible access, authentication, and automation that transforms how people move through the digital world, putting Identity at the heart of business security and growth. 

At Okta, we celebrate a variety of perspectives and experiences. We are not looking for someone who checks every single box - we’re looking for lifelong learners and people who can make us better with their unique experiences. 

Join our team! We’re building a world where Identity belongs to you.
Due to our expansive growth, we are seeking an exceptional, growth-minded sales leader to join our team as a Area Vice President, of Strategic Sales for the central region. The Area Vice President of Strategic Sales will define market tactics to meet annual business goals. They will establish and lead a cross-functional team of experienced sales leaders and account executives in growing a productive and sustainable sales pipeline across the complex territory. This person will help transform and integrate all GTM functions, evolving an already world-class field operation, while achieving significant revenue growth annually. In addition to requisite passion, skills, and experience, the successful candidate will have a measurable track record in building and managing large, high performing sales organizations. This individual will play a key role in driving a significant share of revenue for Okta. 
The Area Vice President of Strategic Sales must have the ability to develop and implement an effective go-to-market plan aligned with Okta’s overall strategy, act as the Okta spokesperson in the region and be the executive sponsor for key customer and partner relationships. The successful candidate is an inspiring leader of people who can recruit and retain exceptional sales talent, support the team in delivering on the agreed metrics, and while leading from the front, work alongside the team to exceed the targets for the region.
 What We Are Looking For:
Success hiring, leading, and developing high performing teams
Success adapting and growing in fast-growing and changing environments
Success effectively influencing key stakeholders at our customers and inside of Okta
Success orchestrating and aligning decision makers around a common objective
Deep understanding of SaaS / Cloud Go-To-Market and the required roles for effective customer engagement
As the Area Vice President of Strategic Sales you will:
Attract, recruit, hire, and mentor the Strategic sales leadership team. 
Manage a team of Strategic front-line leaders and partner closely with other cross-functional teams (SEs, PS, Channel/Alliances team, Legal, Desk Desk etc.).
Lead by example, set expectations, follow through effectively to provide coaching and mentorship as needed ,and ensure that managers do the same for their team.
Be accountable for consistently delivering and overachieving against targets – ensuring Okta’s goals, and objectives are achieved consistently and sustainably.
Analyze data and dynamics to maximize existing successes and create new sales growth opportunities
Be the subject matter expert for the Central region accounts and industries
Deliver accurate forecast monthly, quarterly, and annual targets for assigned regions; establish and manage data and supporting metrics (pipeline coverage, ASP, etc.)
Unearth customer insights, define the value proposition and determine appropriate sales and marketing strategy to maximize growth objectives.
Ensure the best utilization of supporting resources jointly with the Sales management team Develop and maintain relevant senior-level contacts within the Okta partner ecosystem (ISVs, resellers, and GSIs).
You will be a great fit for us if you have:
10+ years’ experience building and running Strategic sales teams in the software industry
3+ years’ experience as a second line sales leader
Previously led a $50M+ (minimum) ARR sales organization
Relevant software industry experience in any of the following: IT systems, cloud enterprise or infrastructure management, application development and management, security, business applications and/or analytics. Subscription, SaaS, or Cloud software experience.
History of consistently meeting/exceeding targets and objectives personally and as a leader.
Excellent leadership and influencing skills; ability to build strong business partnerships both outside, and within the organization.
Skilled at business planning and diligent at measuring and communicating progress towards the plan, identifying roadblocks, and coming up with appropriate solutions.
Highly professional persona and polished demeanor. Strong verbal and written communication skills; effective at delivering executive level presentations.
Mastery of Consultative/solution selling methodologies like MEDDPICC, Challenger, Solution Selling, and Sandler
Technically strong and accustomed to selling into CEOs, CFOs, CIOs, CTOs and Line of Business
Operationally strong and experienced bringing process and rigor to his/her organization
An innovator with the courage to nourish “outside the box” thinking to surface and pursue new ideas

Get to know Okta

Okta is The World’s Identity Company. We free everyone to safely use any technology—anywhere, on any device or app. Our Workforce and Customer Identity Clouds enable secure yet flexible access, authentication, and automation that transforms how people move through the digital world, putting Identity at the heart of business security and growth. 

At Okta, we celebrate a variety of perspectives and experiences. We are not looking for someone who checks every single box - we’re looking for lifelong learners and people who can make us better with their unique experiences. 

Join our team! We’re building a world where Identity belongs to you.
The Okta Partners & Global Alliance Team
The Global Alliance Team is part of Okta’s Revenue Organization. We manage the largest and most complex relationships from Cloud Marketplaces, Resellers, Distributors and Systems Integrators with a laser focus on driving sales and deployments of Okta’s software. We are looking for a Global Alliance Director to join the team and own our Global partnership with PWC. They must be a builder with a strategic mindset that can scale with growth.
How you’ll make an impact
Reporting to the Head of Global Strategic Partners, this role will partner closely with Theater Leaders (Regions) to drive initiatives with PWC to grow their Okta practice. This role will set the partnership strategy, create and own annual planning, joint investments and plan execution. This leader will set the stage for executive interlock, rhythm of business and outline key areas of opportunity. This is a builder role, where the leader will start as an individual contributor, but also scale to managing a team and understand the nuances of Global to Local leadership. 
What you’ll do
Develop and execute partner business plans with large complex GSI teams and Okta sales leaders.
Own and drive financial targets for your partner and for Okta.
Develop, cultivate, and maintain relationships across your GSI partner to execute the partner strategy and deliver financial results. 
Execute tactics to achieve specific growth goals: certifications, co-marketing, deployments, customer satisfaction scores and more.
Consistently track and communicate outcomes and learnings.
What you’ll bring with you
Minimum 10+ years working in technology sales and/or alliances capacity within cyber security.
Direct and recent experience working with PWC (ideally on a global basis).
Deep experience and knowledge of Systems Integrators (from business model, to training and certification strategies). 
Executive communication skills and an ability to drive influence and action from Sr. Leaders across product, finance and sales.
Track record of having and achieving business development goals, pipeline development and revenue based quotas.

Get to know Okta

Okta is The World’s Identity Company. We free everyone to safely use any technology—anywhere, on any device or app. Our Workforce and Customer Identity Clouds enable secure yet flexible access, authentication, and automation that transforms how people move through the digital world, putting Identity at the heart of business security and growth. 

At Okta, we celebrate a variety of perspectives and experiences. We are not looking for someone who checks every single box - we’re looking for lifelong learners and people who can make us better with their unique experiences. 

Join our team! We’re building a world where Identity belongs to you.
The Federal Sales Team
Due to our expansive growth, we are seeking an exceptional, growth-minded sales leader to join our team as a Vice President of Federal Sales.  The Vice President of Federal Sales will define market tactics to meet annual business goals. They will establish and lead a cross-functional team of experienced sales leaders and account executives in growing a productive and sustainable sales pipeline across the complex Federal territory. This person will help transform and integrate all GTM functions, evolving a world-class field operation while achieving significant revenue growth annually. 
Vice President of Federal Sales
Reporting to the SVP of Public Sector, The Vice President of Federal Sales must have the ability to develop and implement an effective go-to-market plan aligned with Okta’s overall strategy, act as the Okta spokesperson in the Federal region, and be the executive sponsor for key customer and partner relationships. The successful candidate is an inspiring leader of people who can recruit and retain exceptional sales talent and support the team in delivering on the agreed metrics.
What you’ll be doing 
Develop and execute a strategy to overachieve against annual revenue targets and long-term growth.
Attract, recruit, hire, and mentor the federal leadership and federal sales team. 
Manage a team of Federal second/front-line leaders and partner closely with other cross-functional teams (SEs, PS, Channel/Alliances team, Legal, Desk Desk, etc.).
Create an open, inclusive, and positive team-oriented environment, all the while building a results-driven culture of accountability and transparency.
Lead by example, set expectations, follow through effectively, provide coaching and mentorship as needed, and ensure that managers do the same for their team.
Accountable for consistently delivering and overachieving against targets – ensuring Okta’s goals and objectives are achieved consistently and sustainably.
Analyze data and dynamics to maximize existing successes and create new sales growth opportunities
Accountable for accurate monthly, quarterly, and annual forecasting
Establish and manage data and supporting metrics (pipeline coverage, ASP, etc.)
Effectively develop, design, build, and execute all aspects of the Federal business plan to predictably and consistently generate short-term results while holding a long-term perspective of overall results.
Unearth customer insights, define the value proposition, and determine appropriate sales and marketing strategy to maximize growth objectives.
Own the federal pipeline generation strategy and work with internal stakeholders to execute against the strategy.
Ensure the best utilization of supporting resources jointly with the Sales management team Develop and maintain relevant senior-level contacts within the Okta partner eco-system (ISVs, resellers, and GSIs).
What We Are Looking For:
Success hiring, leading, and developing high performing Federal sales teams
Success adapting and scaling in fast-growing and changing environments
Success effectively influencing key stakeholders both externally and inside Okta
Success orchestrating and aligning decision-makers around a common objective
Deep understanding of SaaS / Cloud Go-To-Market and the Federal landscape across Civilian, DoD, & FSI
 What you’ll bring to the role
8+ years’ experience building and running Federal sales teams in the software industry
2nd line management experience is preferred 
Must have previously led a $20M+ (minimum) ARR sales organization with 40%+ growth
Relevant software industry experience in any of the following: IT systems, cloud enterprise or infrastructure management, application development and management, security, business applications, and/or analytics. Subscription, SaaS, or Cloud software experience.
History of consistently meeting/exceeding targets and objectives personally and as a leader.
Excellent leadership and influencing skills; ability to build strong business partnerships both outside and within the organization.
Skilled at business planning and diligent at measuring and communicating progress towards the plan, identifying roadblocks, and coming up with appropriate solutions.
Highly professional persona and polished demeanor. Strong verbal and written communication skills; effective at delivering executive-level presentations.
Mastery of Consultative/solution selling methodologies like MEDDPICC, Challenger, Solution Selling, and Sandler
Technically strong and accustomed to selling into The C-Suite and Line of Business
Operationally strong and experienced bringing process and rigor to his/her organization
An innovator with the courage to nourish “outside the box” thinking to surface and pursue new ideas
 Okta’s Top 5 Core Leadership Competencies are part of the deeply ingrained principles that guide all of our company’s actions. They also align strongly to our cultural cornerstones, our Okta values: love our customers, empower our people, never stop innovating, act with integrity, and maintain transparency. It’s our expectation that our managers and leaders embody these core competencies:
 Builds Effective Teams: Building strong-identity teams that apply their diverse skills and perspectives to achieve common goals.          
Demonstrates Self-Awareness (EQ): Using a combination of feedback and reflection to gain productive insight into personal strengths and weaknesses.
Develops Talent: Developing people to meet both their career goals and the organization’s goals.
Drives Results: Consistently achieving results, even under tough circumstances.
Strategic Mindset: Seeing ahead to future possibilities and translating them into breakthrough strategies.
Additional requirements:
This position requires the ability to access federal environments and/or have access to protected federal data.  As a condition of employment for this position, the successful candidate must be able to submit documentation establishing U.S. Person status (e.g. a U.S. Citizen, National, Lawful Permanent Resident, Refugee, or Asylee. 22 CFR 120.15) upon hire.

About the job
The Global Network Delivery team is responsible for deploying that network reliably and at scale. As a leader in this team, you will have a direct impact on the delivery, scalability and availability of this network infrastructure and associated tooling and operations to keep our systems running smoothly. You will be at the hub of multiple technical teams responsible for unparalleled network expansion. Google's complex network generates a constant stream of challenges which require you to continually be innovative with an evolving set of technologies. You will also ensure that network deployments are safe and efficient by monitoring performance, coordinating complex projects, and responding to capacity scaling issues. Keeping the network growing ensures that Google can meet our customers’ growing needs, including for innovative new technologies like Gemini.
As Director, you will be responsible for the delivery of all network and AI/ML infrastructure and capacity delivery on our data center and regional Google Cloud locations. You will lead a distributed team of technical program managers and network infrastructure engineers responsible for the deployment, upgrade, and life cycle management of Google’s data center networking and machine learning (ML) infrastructure in a predictable, scalable, and efficient manner. This will involve significant coordination with our internal suppliers and partners. You will utilize a technical background in infrastructure, capacity planning, servers, networks, and experience with data center construction and operations. You will possess excellent communication and presentation skills at the executive level as well as the ability to work closely and constructively with all areas of the business.
Behind everything our users see online is the architecture built by the Technical Infrastructure team to keep it running. From developing and maintaining our data centers to building the next generation of Google platforms, we make Google's product portfolio possible. We're proud to be our engineers' engineers and love voiding warranties by taking things apart so we can rebuild them. We keep our networks up and running, ensuring our users have the best and fastest experience possible.

Job Title: Head of Private Platforms and Anti-Covert Tracking, Privacy Sandbox
Description:
About the job
The Privacy Sandbox partnerships team works with web and mobile ad tech companies, platforms, publishers, marketers, infrastructure providers, anti-fraud services and other integrators to accelerate participation in the Privacy Sandbox initiative, which aims to introduce new privacy-forward technologies and mitigate cross-site and cross-app user tracking.
In this role, you will interface between product managers, early industry adopters, and partner managers. You will develop deep expertise on a specific set of Privacy Sandbox technologies, working with product managers to develop the strategy and collateral to support early adopters with technical integration, real-world validation, and insights.
The Global Partnerships organization is responsible for exploring new opportunities with Google's partners. Google’s Global Partnerships team works with a wide range of partners to bring the best of Google to power their business. The Global Partnerships team supports Google’s own Product teams with essential partnerships to help Google’s user experiences in advertising, Search, Assistant, Maps, Travel, Shopping, Payments and more. Teams create product-enabling partnerships, go-to-market strategies and incubate business growth for a variety of products.

Job Title: Director, Studio and Sports Partnerships, YouTube
Description:
About the job
As Director of Studio and Sports Partnerships, you will own the performance of the studio and sports leagues. You will help develop account strategies with direct oversight of agreements, execution, and partner management for studio and sports partners in close collaboration with regional leaders (i.e., AMER, APAC, and EMEA) to collectively deliver upon global priorities. You will also oversee Sports licensing.
At YouTube, we believe that everyone deserves to have a voice, and that the world is a better place when we listen, share, and build community through our stories. We work together to give everyone the power to share their story, explore what they love, and connect with one another in the process. Working at the intersection of cutting-edge technology and boundless creativity, we move at the speed of culture with a shared goal to show people the world. We explore new ideas, solve real problems, and have fun — and we do it all together.

About the job
As Vice President, you will be responsible for connecting our Google Cloud Platform (GCP) ecosystem across GCP services to provide aggregate value to our customers. You will lead a cross-functional team dedicated to creating an interconnected, cohesive experience for our GCP customers.
In this role, you will be responsible for external products that make building and operating distributed applications easier. Additionally, you will be responsible for the internal platforms used by other GCP teams to deliver their services and AI-assistance in Duet AI for Google Cloud.
Additionally, you will influence leaders throughout GCP and horizontal owners around this initiative. You will sit within Google Cloud’s Application Ecosystem and report to the General Manager of that organization.
Google Cloud accelerates organizations’ ability to digitally transform their business with the best infrastructure, platform, industry solutions and expertise. We deliver enterprise-grade solutions that leverage Google’s cutting-edge technology – all on the cleanest cloud in the industry. Customers in more than 200 countries and territories turn to Google Cloud as their trusted partner to enable growth and solve their most critical business problems.

About the job
With over 2 billion monthly users, YouTube has grown into a global community where people all over the world access information, share video, and shape culture. The YouTube team helps budding creators build careers, artists and Media Companies reach audiences, creates products like YouTube Kids, YouTube Music, and YouTube TV, and engages communities around shared passions and global conversations. Together, we empower the world to create, broadcast, and share.
As the Vice President for User Experience, you will lead the design and research organization for YouTube globally. You will use your UX expertise to continue to innovate and push the bounds of what YouTube is - for creators, consumers and brands alike. You'll work cross-functionally with partners across product, engineering, content partnerships, finance, marketing, regional leadership, policy, and communications, among others.
In this role, you will combine your deep understanding of the user with business acumen and the ability to drive excellent product development. Your work will influence product strategy to ensure the future is a place where YouTube thrives.
At YouTube, we believe that everyone deserves to have a voice, and that the world is a better place when we listen, share, and build community through our stories. Job Overview
Overview
Do you want to lead a team that builds and deploys Artificial Intelligence (AI) technologies that serve >200M people around the world? Do you want to join a team whose mission is to power prosperity around the world with AI and Data? Do you have the vision and drive to make strategic decisions, build cutting-edge technology, create a high performance culture, and deliver great results for customers around the world?
We are searching for a leader to lead Machine Learning & AI for our consumer and small business ecosystem of products and services. Using your deep knowledge of Machine Learning & AI, you will translate complex business requirements into a bold strategy, galvanize a team around it, and deliver trajectory-changing results. You will work in an energizing, growth mindset environment with disruptive thinkers and bring your whole self to work every day.
We are looking for a creative, passionate, enthusiastic and experienced leader who will collaborate with senior leaders, peers and stakeholders, to develop priorities, roadmaps, and deliver game-changing ML & AI products and capabilities. The leader should possess a sound understanding of, and practical experience, building large-scale data and AI products and platforms and a relentless focus on engineering and operational excellence. We embrace entrepreneurs and also those who come from established corporations.

Job Overview
Come join the Virtual Experts Platform (VEP) as the Director of Engineering, Intuit Assist. VEP powers AI-driven digital expertise and AI-assisted human expertise for all Intuit customers to ensure customers who enter the Intuit ecosystem never experience a ‘dead-end’ and always have a trusted expert by their side to help them along the way. VEP is core to Intuit’s Big Bet 2 and serves every single customer and that touches all the products across the tech ecosystem including expertise-led offerings such as TurboTax Live, TurboTax FullService, QuickBooks Live.
We are looking for a seasoned technology leader with a platform mindset and experience in building and running AI powered solutions at scale. In this role, you will lead the technology platform and solutions that drive Intuit wide outcomes focused on leveraging AI (including GenAI) to transform our product and service experiences. You will partner closely with Business Units, Customer Success, and external partners, to lead the strategy for accelerating outcomes by leveraging existing external and internal capabilities and developing our portfolio of digital expertise capabilities. Your solutions impact millions of Intuit customers and experts and this is truly a chance to make a difference and drive a huge impact, globally.
The ideal candidate’s experience encompasses strong technical architecture and/or software development, building at scale PaaS and SaaS solutions, business acumen and expertise in developing product strategy, and outstanding organizational leadership in building high performing teams. This leader will have an ability to leverage prior success building and rearchitecting products and platforms that run at scale.

Job Title: Director of Sales Enablement & Customer Education
Description:
Job Overview
Intuit is a global technology platform that helps consumers and small businesses overcome their most important financial challenges. Serving more than 100 million customers worldwide with TurboTax, Credit Karma, QuickBooks, and Mailchimp, we believe that everyone should have the opportunity to prosper. We never stop working to find new, innovative ways to make that possible
Mailchimp solves one of the largest challenges small businesses faces – getting customers. For two-thirds of small businesses, finding new customers is their biggest obstacle and over 25% struggle to retain existing ones. 13M businesses use Mailchimp to grow their business, and the combination of QuickBooks and Mailchimp will enable the next horizon of transformative innovation. Through the combined offering, small businesses will be able to grow and manage their business with one platform, enabling Mailchimp to offer unparalleled performance to its customers.
We are looking for a Director of Sales Enablement and Customer Education to lead an organization focused on empowering both our customers and customer facing organizations. In this role you will scale digital education and self-help support for our global customers and partners. You and your team will provide online resources, training and certification to enable success and growth on the Mailchimp platform, including the Academy platform for certification. You will lead enablement for Mailchimp’s customer facing teams to equip them with the skills and capabilities needed as advisors to acquire and grow our customer base.

Job Overview
As Intuit’s Director, ESG Strategy & Reporting, you will drive and shape the evolution of Intuit’s environmental, social and governance (ESG) strategy.
This newly-created position requires an experienced professional who is knowledgeable about a broad range of ESG topics. The ideal candidate will have experience building ESG capabilities within an organization, be a strong collaborator, with a proven track record of working across various corporate functions to influence and drive alignment among senior stakeholders across the organization. The candidate will build partnerships with other business leaders to ensure that Intuit complies with current and future reporting requirements. As a courageous leader, you will establish relationships across the organization to develop and drive a cross-functional community of leaders responsible for ESG policies, strategy, and programs and to elevate Intuit’s position as an industry ESG leader.
This high-visibility role will be responsible for our ESG reporting, including our annual Corporate Responsibility report and responses to ESG raters and rankers. You will also contribute to the ESG disclosures in other critical channels to meet regulatory requirements and investment community expectations, such as our proxy statement, 10-K and state law reporting. This position will be responsible for acquiring and consolidating precise ESG data and performance metrics from various contributors across the organization, while establishing a governance and control framework that complies with relevant reporting standards and regulations, in order to comply with external assurance expectations. The candidate we seek has an understanding of ESG reporting taxonomies and ratings methodologies, will report to the Vice President of Investor Relations, and hire and manage a small team, including third-party advisors.
The ideal candidate is a strategic thinker, highly organized and efficient with strong project management skills, collaborative and able to work with, educate and influence stakeholders across the organization.

Job Overview
As the Head of Strategic Technology Partnerships at Intuit Mailchimp, your primary role will be to lead, develop, and inspire our team of Strategic Partner Managers, creating a cohesive unit capable of growing successful partnerships with some of the world's prominent technology companies — Shopify, WooCommerce, Wix, Meta, Square, among others.
You will be responsible for growing Mailchimp's revenue through technology partners by leading the team to jointly develop go-to-market plans, support joint product roadmap development, and establishing senior level relationships with partner stakeholders. Your leadership will be critical for the team members as they navigate complex engagements internally and externally, keeping them focused on growth objectives while fostering innovation and synergy for success.
Location: New York, New York;  Atlanta, Georgia

Job Title: Director of Engineering, Growth and Sales
Description:
Job Overview
Come join the Virtual Experts Platform (VEP) as the Director of Product Development, Growth & Sales. VEP powers AI driven expertise and AI assisted human expertise for all Intuit customers to ensure customers who enter the Intuit ecosystem never experience ‘dead-end’ and always have a trusted expert by their side to help them. VEP is core to Intuit’s BigBet2 and serves every single customer that touches all the products across the tech ecosystem and powers all expertise led offerings such as TurboTax Live, TurboTax FullService, QuickBooks Live.
We are looking for a seasoned technology leader with a platform mindset and experience in building and running SaaS (CRM) solutions at scale. In this role, you will lead the technology platform and solutions that drive Intuit wide Sales outcomes. You will lead Intuit with a tech led innovation powered through AI/GenAI to reimagine the Sales process to accelerate growth for Mass-market and Mid-market sales motions. You will also partner closely with Sales business, Sales operations, Sales product management, Finance and external partners, to lead the strategy for accelerating sales outcomes building and evolving the Sales capabilities and leveraging internal and external capabilities. Your solutions impact millions of Intuit customers and this is truly a chance to make a difference and drive a huge impact, globally.
The ideal candidate’s experience encompasses strong technical architecture and/or software development, building at scale PaaS and SaaS solutions, business acumen and expertise in developing product strategy, and outstanding organizational leadership in building high performing teams. This leader will have an ability to leverage prior success building and rearchitecting products and platforms that run at scale.

Job Title: Head of New Business Sales, North America (Mailchimp)
Description:
Job Overview
Intuit Mailchimp is the #1 growth platform for small to medium sized businesses. We empower millions of customers around the world to build their brands and grow their companies with a suite of multichannel marketing and CRM solutions powered by GenAI.
We are looking for a customer-obsessed, strategic, and analytical sales leader with experience and a passion for leading and inspiring sales teams. Reporting to Mailchimp’s Head of Sales, you will lead a team of sales leaders and sellers with a focus on customer acquisition of mid-market customers as well as setting up new and existing customers for continued growth and expansion. You will collaborate closely with the Head of Sales and Chief Sales Officer and cross functional leaders to strategically grow our mid market customer segment in North America and help innovate our sales process and coverage model globally.
Diversity and inclusion isn’t just something we do — it’s part of who we are. Intuit’s commitment to diversity and inclusion dates back to the early days of the company when we first declared our core values and mission, and today our Stronger Together value keeps this front and center in how we power prosperity around the world. When our workforce composition reflects our customers and communities, we believe we can develop deeper empathy, accelerating innovation to solve the biggest problems our customers face. Location: Atlanta, Georgia;  New York, New York

Job Title: Director, HR Business Partner for Accelerating Functions
Description:
Job Overview
Intuit is a global platform company on a mission to power prosperity around the world for consumers, small businesses and the self-employed. Across our five leading brands – Turbo Tax, Credit Karma, QuickBooks, and Mailchimp – Intuit serves over 100M customers and is one of the few companies in the world to have both a thriving consumer and small business ecosystem. Intuit is known for its innovation track record, customer centricity, and its consistent recognition as a top place to work. Year-over-year, Intuit has been recognized as a best employer and is consistently ranked on Fortune’s “100 Best Companies to Work For” and Fortune World’s “Most Admired Software Companies” lists. Immerse yourself in our award-winning culture while creating breakthrough solutions that simplify the lives of consumers and small businesses and their customers worldwide.
Accelerating Functions are our cross-Intuit teams that enable the enterprise to deliver for our customers with speed, consistency, and quality. The three functions this HRBP Director would partner with are our Legal, Compliance & Policy Organization, our Marketing & Communications organization, and our Corporate Strategy & Development organization. Each leader of these organizations plays a critical role in the growth of Intuit and is a member of the CEO staff leadership team.
The People and Places team is the steward of Intuit's greatest strategic asset — Our People. Our mission is to power prosperity around the world, and we do that by creating an environment where the world’s top talent does the best work of their lives. And that’s where you come in! Join Intuit as Director, Human Resources Business Partner for Accelerating Functions. This position is based in Mountain View.

Job Title: Director Product Management, Virtual Expert Platform
Description:
Job Overview
Come join Intuit's Customer Success Organization as the Director of Product Management responsible for our Virtual Expert Platform. This role is responsible for the platform itself and related tools across the enterprise. This product leader will be responsible for the strategy and execution of the Virtual Expert Platform for the Enterprise.
The ideal candidate will have a proven track record of delivering new technology and experiences at scale in highly cross-functional organizations. You will be responsible for leading a team of highly skilled product managers and coaching them in the product management craft. You must have excellent collaboration skills and be able to work effectively with internal and external partners, including technologists, engineers, product managers, and senior leadership.
If you are passionate about customers (internal and external) and thrive in a role where people, process, and technology can fuel growth and innovation, then we want to hear from you! Join our team and help us build the systems and processes that will drive Intuit's success.
Location: San Diego, California;  Mountain View, California

Job Overview
The Director of Business Development for the QuickBooks Segment will be responsible for defining and executing on all aspects of the partnership strategy from inception to delivery as part of a new business within Intuit. This executive will build and lead the partnerships organization for the both segments, responsible for developing the partnerships strategy, partnering with key internal stakeholders across product, engineering, marketing, sales and support. They will partner closely with the senior leadership team to ensure alignment with other aspects of the Small Business & Self-employed platform, product and partnerships ecosystem. The right candidate will be a strategic and ambitious visionary with the proven ability to deliver impactful partnerships that deliver exceptional value to the end customers, partners and Intuit. Furthermore, this leader should be highly motivated to succeed, and empower his/her team to do so, in an approachable manner, that engenders trust and confidence at all levels across the organization.

Job Title: VP, Chief Architect - Enterprise Applications and Infrastructure
Description:
Job Overview
Intuit is a global technology platform that helps consumers and small businesses overcome their most important financial challenges. Serving more than 100 million customers worldwide with TurboTax, Credit Karma, QuickBooks, and Mailchimp, we believe that everyone should have the opportunity to prosper. We never stop working to find new, innovative ways to make that possible.
The Tech-4-Intuit (t4i) team is responsible for building Intuit’s core capabilities surrounding enterprise applications and infrastructure. Our team owns a series of capabilities spanning enterprise Finance, People and Places tech, Learning, digital collaboration, enterprise infrastructure, privacy and more. Our broader set of stakeholders include Intuit’s Finance team, Human Resources team, Brand and Experience team, Legal team and all of Intuit employees. The t4i team works closely with these stakeholders to ensure we are delivering the enterprise capabilities needed to support Intuit’s scale, growth and provide best in class employee experience.
The t4i team has been on a platform journey, to ensure our customers get a seamless experience across our products. We are consolidating and standardizing all our backend processes onto a common set of capabilities. We are also in the process of evaluating different vendor capabilities through a build vs buy strategy to provide the best-in-class tech capabilities for our stakeholders and employees.
The Chief Architect - Enterprise Applications and Infrastructure is a vice president level role that will report to the Chief Information Officer and is responsible for driving tech strategy for all the enterprise capabilities. The role will partner closely with leaders from t4i Product Management, t4i Engineering and from Accelerated Functions (Finance, HR, Legal) to understand the business needs and put together a strategy roadmap and establish a durable pattern to support Intuit’s growth and scale through technology and automation.

Job Overview
Intuit is a leading provider of business and financial management solutions for small and mid-sized businesses, consumers, and accounting professionals. You probably know us by our flagship products: QuickBooks, TurboTax, Credit Karma, and Mailchimp. Over 100 million users and seven million small businesses depend on us. We innovate at the crossroads of real customer problems and breakthrough technology.
About the Role:
Intuit is taking a thoughtful and measured approach to the future of work for our employees. We are reimagining where, when, and how we work so that our nearly 17,000 employees can do the best work of their lives. We’ve made tremendous strides in the last 2 years, but to preserve our culture we must define and reshape how we engage our workforce in this new paradigm of hybrid work, embracing both physical and virtual engagement and fundamentally reimagining our approach. We will do this in service to amplifying our amazing people-first culture, which is Intuit’s secret sauce. In this role you will be building on our world-class employee engagement and enhancing our people-first culture.
As the Director of Employee Engagement, you will be focused on both our engagement strategy and driving its implementation across the company globally. We are looking for a data-driven problem solver and seasoned leader with a passion for people and the art of the possible. In this exciting role you will reshape how we drive employee engagement at the team, site, organization and company level across our 17,000 employees. The Director of Employee Engagement is a newly created position and will report into our People and Places organization as part of our Talent Development team. This leader will be leading engagement at scale across the whole company globally. In addition, this leader will be a driver on our Workforce and Workplace of the Future mission team.
In this work, you will be partnering closely with a large cross-functional team, including HR Business Partners, Talent Development, Talent Acquisition, Site Leadership, Employee Resource Groups, Communications, Brand Storytelling and Experiences, Workplace, We Care & Give Back and drivers in our business and functional organizations. This is a high visibility effort within the company with sponsorship from C-level leadership.

Job Overview
As members of the People and Places team, we are stewards of Intuit's greatest strategic asset: Our People. Our mission is to Power prosperity around the world; and we will do that by creating an environment where the world’s top talent does the best work of their lives; that’s where you come in! Come join Intuit as part of the People and Places team as an Director, HRBP for Technology. This position is part of the Ecosystem HR Line organization and reports into the SVP, HR and is located in Mountain View, CA.

Job Overview
Intuit is a global platform company that is on a mission to power prosperity around the world for consumers, small businesses and the self-employed. Across our four leading brands – Turbo Tax, Credit Karma, QuickBooks, and Mailchimp – Intuit serves over 100M customers and is one of the few companies in the world to have both a thriving consumer and small business ecosystem. Intuit is known for its innovation track record, customer centricity, and its consistent recognition as a top place to work.
Mailchimp solves one of the largest challenges small businesses face – getting customers. For two-thirds of small businesses, finding new customers is their biggest obstacle and over 25% struggle to retain existing ones. 13M businesses use Mailchimp to grow their business, and the combination of QuickBooks and Mailchimp will enable the next horizon of transformative innovation. Through the combined offering, small businesses will be able to grow and manage their business with one platform, enabling Mailchimp to offer unparalleled performance to its customers.
We’re looking for a seasoned Revenue Operations leader who will lead several functions that are critical to Mailchimp’s business including forecasting and planning, capacity management and coverage models, compensation strategy, performance analysis and process improvement. This role will lead and build a team responsible for ensuring that GTM teams have the right data, strategies, and process support to accomplish their key business outcomes and deliver exceptional experiences for our customers.
Location: Atlanta, Georgia;  New York, New York

Description:
Job Overview
The Small Business & Self Employed Group (“SBSEG”) is Intuit’s largest business unit with $8B in revenue, serving 7M+ customers with the QuickBooks line of products including accounting, payments, payroll, capital lending and banking. The US SBSEG Finance team is critical in driving business growth and profitability through strategic, financial and operational leadership.
The Finance Director for the Sales and Mid Market team will be a key member of the SBSEG Finance leadership team and will partner closely with the Senior VP of Sales and Mid Market as part of his staff to drive Intuit’s growth.
We are looking for a driven leader who is a creative problem solver with a passion for finance and technology to accelerate growth in service of our mission of “powering prosperity around the world.”

Job Overview
Do you want to lead a team that builds and deploys Artificial Intelligence (AI) and advanced machine learning technologies that serve >200M people around the world? Do you want to join a team whose mission is to power prosperity around the world with AI and Data? Do you have the vision and drive to make strategic decisions, build cutting edge technology, create a high performance culture, and deliver great results for customers around the world?
We are searching for a leader to lead Machine Learning & AI for our small business and self employed ecosystem of products and services. Using your deep knowledge of Machine Learning & AI, you will translate complex business requirements into a bold ML & AI strategy, galvanize a team around it, and deliver trajectory changing results. You will work in an energizing, growth mindset environment with disruptive thinkers and bring your whole self to work every day.
We are looking for a creative, passionate, enthusiastic and experienced leader who will collaborate with senior leaders, peers and stakeholders, to develop priorities, roadmaps, and deliver game changing ML & AI products and capabilities. The leader should possess a sound understanding of, and practical experience, building large-scale data and AI products and platforms and a relentless focus on engineering and operational excellence. We embrace entrepreneurs and also those who come from established corporations.

Job Title: Head of Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion
Description:
Job Overview
As a member of the People & Places organization, we are stewards of Intuit’s greatest strategic asset: Our Employees. Our mission is to maximize the potential of our employees and accelerate Intuit’s business growth with the right leadership, talent, and organizational capabilities.
We would love to have you join Intuit’s People & Places (P&P) organization as our Leader on our Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion team. We are a small, agile team responsible for designing and delivering solutions that allow every employee to bring their whole self to work and do the best work of their lives!

Job Overview
Intuit is a global platform company on a mission to power prosperity around the world for consumers, small businesses and the self-employed. Across our leading brands – Turbo Tax, Credit Karma, QuickBooks, and Mailchimp – Intuit serves over 100M customers and is one of the few companies in the world to have both a thriving consumer and small business ecosystem. Intuit is known for its innovation track record, customer centricity, and its consistent recognition as a top place to work. Year-over-year, Intuit has been recognized as a best employer and is consistently ranked on Fortune’s “100 Best Companies to Work For” and Fortune World’s “Most Admired Software Companies” lists. Immerse yourself in our award-winning culture while creating breakthrough solutions that simplify the lives of consumers and small businesses and their customers worldwide.
The Small Business & Self-Employed Group (“SBSEG”) is Intuit’s largest business unit with ~$10B in revenue, serving ~8M customers. We are powering prosperity for millions of customers worldwide with the QuickBooks and Mailchimp ecosystems of accounting, payments, payroll, customer engagement and marketing automation, lending, e-commerce, and time tracking solutions. This role will partner with three senior vice presidents and their organizations within SBSEG: Money (inclusive of Payments, Banking & Lending), Workforce Solutions (inclusive of Payroll & Time Tracking), and Business Operations. The leaders of these organizations are part of the SBSEG senior leadership team and report to the General Manager.
The People and Places team is the steward of Intuit's greatest strategic asset — Our People. Our mission is to power prosperity around the world, and we do that by maximizing the potential of our people. That’s where you come in! Join Intuit as Director, Human Resources Business Partner for our Small Business & Self-Employed Group, based in Mountain View.

Job Overview
Intuit’s new People Experience team shapes experiences that maximize the potential of our people. The Employee Relations partner group is one pillar of the team and focuses on fostering a high-trust, high-performance culture across the company. We’re navigating the challenges of a work-from-home environment with the weight of a global pandemic, conversations about systemic racism and a polarized political world resting on everyone’s shoulders.
We are re-imagining Employee Relations for this new world including how we handle workplace conflicts and how we lean into a more proactive, data-driven approach to organizational health issues and teaching employees what it means to share diverse points of review with respect. We are taking today’s and tomorrow’s challenges head on because, at Intuit, we believe that we are stronger together.
Location: Mountain View, California;  San Diego, California
