About Netflix
Netflix is one of the world's leading entertainment services with over 260 million paid memberships in over 190 countries enjoying TV series, films, and games across a wide variety of genres and languages. Members can play, pause, and resume watching as much as they want, anytime, anywhere, and can change their plans at any time.

The Opportunity
Are you excited about how great entertainment is created, and how technology enables consumers to discover and enjoy it? Do you want to help tell the story of a company delivering joy to its millions of members all over the world and setting new standards for its industry? Are you exceptional at planning and implementing great campaigns that shift how people think about brands? If so, we have a leadership opportunity on our growing communications team.

The Role
The Director, Communications will be a key leader in our small but effective US PR team. We tell our product, financial, innovation, entertainment, and culture stories, and work closely with many different teams, including publicity, product, and marketing. The ideal candidate has experience and a demonstrated ability to define the narrative of publicly listed companies, at both a business and consumer level. They are entrepreneurial, creative, strategic, and business-savvy, thriving in a fast-paced, results-oriented environment. They enjoy the challenge of juggling multiple projects and can become a trusted advisor to our global teams as well as Netflix’s executive team. The candidate should have strong writing skills, strong media relationships, a willingness to learn rapidly and the ability to thrive in a fast-paced culture are key.

Key Responsibilities
This role requires a seasoned corporate communications executive with experience in the entertainment and/or tech industry. The successful candidate will:

*Set strategy on thought leadership, brand positioning, and reputation issues
*Lead all PR around corporate functions - including but not limited to ESG, Policy, Legal and annual reports 
*Develop creative, thoughtful, and impactful stories to advance Netflix’s priorities
*Develop and strengthen relationships with key journalists, columnists, and broadcasters
*Provide reputation counsel, support, message management, and media training for key executives
*Recognize impactful viewership trends translating those insights into actionable ideas into a cohesive communications strategy
*Manage complex, fast-moving, and unexpected communications challenges with high judgment and professionalism

Key Attributes
*Excellent media relationships
*Excellent at setting strategy, solving problems, and driving momentum for our brand 
*Strong judgment and business acumenSkilled storyteller who can thoughtfully craft narratives, boil down complex concepts into succinct pitches and with journalists across broadcast, print, online, and radio in both the trade and consumer spaces
*Good interpersonal and management skills
*Deep familiarity with or enthusiasm for entertainment and technology
*An entrepreneurial self-starter who thrives on trying new approaches

Qualifications
*A minimum of fifteen years of experience in media, corporate, or agency settings
*Proven expertise leading and shaping brands at the corporate level within a global company
*Established credibility and relationships within the media, domestically and/or globally, is highly desirable
*Ambidextrous in successfully engaging and navigating industry and consumer audiences alike
*Prior experience leading, developing, and managing high-performance team(s).

Job Title: Director, Product Management & Live Service - Internal Games
Description:
Netflix is revolutionizing entertainment. We connect people with movies and television globally by delivering outstanding content and technological innovation. 

This is your chance to be at the forefront of Netflix’s new offering of Video Games. We will bring these new experiences to market through the world's leading streaming entertainment app with 247 million paid memberships in over 190 countries who are already enjoying TV series, documentaries and feature films across a wide variety of genres and languages. Members can watch as much as they want, anytime, anywhere, and now they can download and play mobile games anytime, anywhere with a collection of Netflix curated and produced Games. At Netflix, we have an insatiable need to continually improve our product experience and the creative elements that support it and this team sits at the forefront of the effort. 

Netflix is looking for an experienced Director of Live Service to join the Internal Games team. This role reports directly to the VP of Internal Games and will partner with Internal games leadership, first and second party game studios, as well as cross-functional partners to ensure the successful launch and operation of world-class, multi-platform live service games.

What You’ll Do 

The Director of Live Services on the Internal Games team will be responsible for identifying, establishing, and running all central game product management processes related to launching, operating, and optimizing live service games for our internal game studios. The person in this role will take analysis and insights derived from multiple sources, including our cross-functional strategy, analysis, live services, and data science teams, to drive actionable strategies, strategic execution, plans, and recommendations across the internal studios organization and portfolio (including slate strategy, product strategy, and the approach to live services). You will be expected to form great relationships with our internal game teams, working through influence to ensure that all of our internal studios have top-notch game PM, live operations, and analysis capabilities. You will also be expected to form great relationships with our cross-functional partners who dive deep on analysis and insights and the platform teams who are in charge of developing and optimizing the games platform, discovery surface, recommendation algorithm, etc and advocate for the needs of internal studios when it comes to the tech and tools required to launch and operate great live service games on the Netflix mobile download and TV/Web streaming platforms. You will have the opportunity to influence the evolution and fine-tuning of the unique metrics used to evaluate game and portfolio performance in a subscription service. The ideal candidate will have deep knowledge and understanding of the competitive market for high-engagement feature design and live service programs, be able to anticipate and identify key emerging trends, and help our studios and our slate planning team be on the cutting edge of live service game development.
Responsibilities
Establish central processes and identify best practices for successful game product management and live operations of subscription and cloud based games.
Partner with our first-party game studios, strategy, and central live services teams to ensure accurate forecasts for game launch KPIs.
Participate in phase reviews for the internal games slate to help ensure that game teams are properly resourced and set up for success with respect to all things PM, live ops, and analysis. Provide ongoing support to game studios in their development and operation of live service games.
Seek out data from all available sources (game strategy team, game teams, our external development team, customer insights, etc). Synthesize data and insights into recommendations that can inform our live ops best practices and content strategy decisions. Work through influence to inflect our games and slate based on these recommendations. 
Work with Netflix games platform and product teams to advocate for the tech, tools, and processes required for internal game teams to successfully launch and operate live service games.
Partner with internal studios leadership to shape the go-forward strategy for internal game development at Netflix. 
Required Qualifications
8+ years of experience in the gaming industry, working in analytical roles including strategy & analysis and product management, assessing ongoing performance and optimization for games in multiple categories.
Deep understanding of video game metrics with experience reading and interpreting metrics, forming and leveraging hypotheses to influence roadmaps and strategies. 
Experience running live service games on any platform (PC, console, mobile) with the ideal candidate having deep mobile live service experience.
Experience as a heavily engaged player of live service games and a deep understanding of engagement drivers in live service game titles.
Expertise in creating and presenting engaging, insightful narratives through data.
Experience managing cross-functional groups and game teams through influence.
Continuously looking for ways to improve and iterate on existing frameworks, or building anew for best results. Passion for video games, innovations in software, and how they enrich the player experience.
Location
Los Angeles, CA/Remote

It’s an amazing time to be joining Netflix as we continue to transform entertainment. We deliver billions of hours of movies and TV shows per month to more than 260 million members in over 190 countries. To entertain the world, we must rapidly build and ship innovative experiences for our members and creators all around the globe.

Our Developer Platform is central to this approach, providing a comprehensive experience across the entire software lifecycle, from development to delivery to operations to maintenance. More than just a set of tools, the platform is designed to streamline the development process, making it more efficient and less burdensome. By evolving with the needs of our developers and business, the platform maximizes the efficiency and effectiveness of Netflix engineers, increasing their overall impact.

The Opportunity
We are looking for a Director of Product to drive the evolution of our Developer Platform. Your mission is to offer best-in-class experiences that empower and delight our software engineers, and simplify and accelerate their developer experience. You will lead the overall product vision and strategy for our Developer Platform, managing a team of experienced technical product managers who are responsible for different product domains within the platform. This pivotal role enables Netflix engineers to focus on our core mission: entertaining the world. Your contributions will directly shape the future of development, influencing how we innovate and deliver entertainment to millions worldwide.

Our Developer Platform offers a comprehensive suite of tools and services encompassing the entire software development lifecycle. These include:

Developer Experience:
We provide a unified front door, the Netflix Console, for easy software and infrastructure management. This includes product discovery, learning, provisioning workflows, software catalog, inventory management, change campaigns, and core services like search.

Developer Foundations:
We optimize the inner development loop to keep developers in the flow, with development environments and tools like IDEs, source code management, repository management, project initialization, and CLIs.

Application Development: 
We optimize application development by providing tools, frameworks, and libraries for specific personas and use cases (e.g., backend, frontend), including code authoring, build, test, and debug workflows, build systems, test frameworks, and more.

Continuous Integration & Delivery: 
We ensure safe delivery of changes from commit to production with robust, seamless integration of changes, delivery workflows and pipelines, global deployment orchestration, safe delivery and rollbacks, and fleetwide change orchestration.

Reliability & Resiliency:
We ensure operational excellence and highly reliable, resilient, scalable systems with incident management and product readiness tools, testing frameworks, automation, reporting & insights, and product infrastructure experimentation (e.g., canaries, shadow traffic, performance testing, failure injection testing, chaos experiments, etc).

Observability:
We enable rapid issue detection and remediation with telemetry ingestion, storage, and querying of metrics, events, logs, and traces, monitoring and alerting, remediation, system health exploration and troubleshooting, and profiling and diagnostic tools.

Examples of opportunities that you and your PMs might tackle include unifying the developer experience, providing holistic end-to-end workflows, managing more for users through higher levels of abstraction, reducing toil, optimizing cycle times, defining how we measure developer experience and productivity, and ensuring we provide best-in-industry tooling. The scope and impact of these roles is significant. You and your PMs will be responsible for managing a portfolio of products and driving holistic product strategy and prioritization across them.

Product Management is a newer team within Platform Engineering, and we're on a mission to elevate product thinking across the organization. This unique opportunity allows you to shape our product management practices and contribute significantly to our evolution.

If you’re looking for a deeply technical and highly dynamic opportunity that will have an outsized impact on the future of developer experience at Netflix, we’d love to talk to you!

What You Will Do
Deeply understand customer needs, product analytics, and industry innovation to drive the product vision and strategy for Developer Platform, maximizing business and customer impact
Lead, mentor, inspire, and grow a high-performance team of technical product managers, developing strategies, roadmaps, and specifications that prioritize the most impactful opportunities
Collaborate with senior management to align vision, strategy, success metrics, and roadmaps
Foster a collaborative environment with Netflix engineers, creating continuous feedback loops to ensure we're solving the right problems and driving maximum impact for Netflix
Stay informed about industry advancements, influence their direction, and conduct comprehensive buy vs. build analysis to align with state-of-the-art solutions, encouraging ROI-based decisions
Foster a metrics-driven environment that encourages quality experimentation and sets high standards for measuring product success
Exhibit robust problem-solving and decision-making skills, tackling both technical and strategic challenges in innovative ways, and leveraging both data and intuition to make strategic choices in the face of ambiguity and complexity
Ensure thoughtful product evolution that addresses product lifecycle and adoption experience
Help evolve Platform Engineering’s customer engagement model, communication strategy, and prioritization and planning practices
Collaborate with other product leaders across Platform Engineering and Netflix to evolve our practices and competencies in technical product management
What We’re Looking For
At least 5 years of experience managing a team of senior and staff technical product managers as a Director of Product, Group Product Manager, or similar role
Proven track record of leading and scaling teams, managing and evolving a product portfolio, and driving product vision and strategy
Deep technical knowledge paired with a customer-focused mindset and empathy.
Experience working on developer platforms with a solid understanding of the software development lifecycle and passion for developer experience and productivity
Strategic thinker who can connect customer use cases to technology solutions and think holistically about end-to-end experience
Ability to manage a portfolio of projects, balancing short-term goals with long-term vision in a rapidly changing environment
Proficiency in using both qualitative and quantitative methods to define success, with a track record of making data-driven decisions
Strong problem-solving skills with the ability to leverage product intuition and judgment to make informed decisions in scenarios where perfect information may not be available
Insatiable curiosity, with a passion for learning new domains, keeping up with industry innovation, and constantly questioning the status quo
Excellent communication skills with a knack for setting clear expectations
Experience navigating and leading in a fast-paced, agile environment with rapidly shifting priorities

Design Director, Monetization
Location: Los Gatos, California Preferred (San Francisco Bay Area - USA)

Team: Netflix is the world’s leading streaming entertainment service with over 230 million paid memberships in over 190 countries enjoying series, documentaries, and feature films across a wide variety of genres and languages.  As our slate of original productions and licensed content continues to grow and we increase our global reach, we must scale the business and look for value creation across markets and user segments.  

Within the Monetization team, revenue is our ultimate priority. To be successful, we need to find the right balance between...

Business Case: Viability (could this make money), feasibility (does it pass the ethical, and legal bar), capability (can we build it), and cost (how much time and effort to build). To be viable, we need to consider risk and reward for both shorter (1 year) and longer-term (3+ years). 

Consumer Needs: Value considerations (does it address a real or perceived need), desirability (how important is this need relative to others), and willingness to pay.

We are looking for an experienced design leader to manage the teams responsible for further developing and generating new business and revenue models, iterating on our global plans & pricing strategy, and identifying ad growth levers across different flows and content types to help generate revenue and keep Netflix profitable and successful. 

In this role, you'll be responsible for product innovation on plans and pricing design, and collaborate closely with several cross-functional leaders while managing a talented and diverse remote design team. You’ll help your teams design and build superlative experiences that help Netflix monetize with existing and new business models. These experiences are part of our consumer acquisition and retention flows, so experience with and a deep passion for design excellence and creativity is essential. 

This role is ideally based in our Los Gatos offices. There is also the option to be based out of LA, or remotely from the West Coast/PST working hours. Expect to travel monthly to meet with your teams, stakeholders, and partners.
Key Responsibilities
Collaborate closely with your Product, Engineering, Data Science, and Operations leadership partners to plan and execute our product roadmaps.
Develop and nurture relationships with our global stakeholders, learn the nuances of their workflows, and ensure your team is designing and shipping impactful and cohesive product experiences that meet our stakeholders’ needs.
Balance being a passionate advocate for our users while pushing your teams towards efficient operational excellence.
Manage and coach your design team by helping them navigate the complexity and ambiguity of our business areas.
Keep your teams inspired and engaged by providing clear direction that looks towards the future while creating actionable steps that are impactful today.
Skills, Characteristics & Qualifications
7+ years of experience successfully leading and scaling high-performance design teams, including ICs and people managers.
Demonstrated passion for design excellence in the consumer space and a successful track record of shipping impactful products at a global scale.
Experience collaborating closely with cross-functional stakeholders, helping drive alignment between design and your cross-functional partners, and building strong relationships across business areas.
Comfortable working with ambiguity. Ability to bring rigorous design thinking and operational structure to complex and evolving problem spaces.
Exceptional communication skills both written and verbal whether in small group discussions, large-scale presentations, or with executives.
Ability to inspire, lead, and engage your design teams, leaning in and giving them critical business context, feedback, and direction.
Bring a balanced perspective and thoughtful decision-making to strategic discussions, advocating for both user-centricity and the needs of the business with your teams and your peers.
Bonus
Experience working in the entertainment industry and a deep understanding of existing creative production and marketing technology workflows, launching successfully from 0 - 1.
Passion for storytelling and filmmaking.
Courage when asked to join team karaoke 🎤😜
Pay Transparency

Systems, Workflows & Technology (SWT) is a central organization that is optimally positioned at the intersection of creative (art) and technology (science), bringing the brightest minds from different functions and geographies to solve business needs across the Netflix ‘pitch-to-play’ ecosystem. 

Collaboration is fundamental to our success. We identify opportunities for improvement through deep discovery and alignment with senior leadership and business stakeholders; ensuring initiatives are consistently interlocked with business objectives and operational strategies.  Our close partnership with product and data science teams enables us to deliver effective, scalable solutions that drive operational efficiency for Netflix productions, globally.  

We are tenacious and eternally curious.  Our team remains in perpetual exploration and evolution, empowering a culture that thrives on continuous improvement and innovation.  To amplify business impact, we are searching for a Director to lead our newly formed Production Solutions group in United States/Canada (UCAN). This is a unique and thrilling opportunity for a dynamic business leader with a proven track record of driving complex operational strategies and executing business-centered solutions.  An extensive knowledge of production operations and technical workflows, paired with an exceptional ability to manage stakeholder relationships and define and structure business needs (or problems), is critical to the success of this role.

Influencing without authority will play a pivotal role in your ability to affect meaningful change in support of a more cohesive, efficient, and impactful UCAN Production org. As a result, operationalization will require development of business strategies across multiple functions, including teams outside of UCAN Live Action Production such as Content, Product, Production Finance, Dubbing, Marketing, and Business Affairs & Legal Affairs. 

You are self-motivated, quick-thinking, flexible, able to pivot when necessary, thorough, and able to juggle multiple and diverse responsibilities with a strong emphasis on organization and unwavering attention to detail at all times. This is a demanding and fast-moving position that requires someone who is a proactive and positive thinker, and able to exercise good judgment and initiative. 

CORE FUNCTIONS:
Workflow Validation & Prioritization: Establish clear understanding and alignment on UCAN production org priorities, which will serve as a guide for informed business decisions and strategic planning. Clearly define the breadth of needs, both ‘top-down’ and ‘bottoms up’, to ensure successful implementation of solutions and improvements.  
Workflow Operationalization: Take the lead in implementing key global and regional studio initiatives, while also serving as a crucial bridge between local and global teams, with the goal of alleviating the operational demands on title management functions.
Production & Market Insights: Provide a regional and functional perspective on vendor and talent landscape by monitoring industry trends, vendor performance and market pressures. Work in close partnership with global and local teams to support effective data gathering and curation, e.g., partner and talent survey, vendor performance metrics.
RESPONSIBILITIES (include, but not limited to):
Provide functional support and guidance for key business stakeholders in UCAN, including production management, post-production, VFX, and music teams.
Identify, prioritize, and communicate local and regional needs to central teams, ensuring alignment with global initiatives while streamlining workflows, tools, and processes to optimize resources and allow our content, creative, and production teams to focus on higher value activities.
Employ ‘top down’ and ‘bottom up’ approaches to identifying opportunities for business improvement, including alignment with senior leadership and title management teams.
Collaborate across global, regional, and local teams to address data accuracy and completeness. Leverage data to drive regional improvements.
Partner with SWT and product teams in the discovery, development, and adoption of tools, overseeing their operational rollout and guiding long-term planning initiatives.
Partner with SWT and regional counterparts in the development of slate planning tools, articulating business pain points, contributing high-level requirements, collaborating on product briefs, aligning on technical specifications, and testing strategies.
Provide the business with actionable data-driven insights and enhance user experiences.
Assist Product/Customer Success teams in curating and developing runbooks for managing, operating, and supporting new product releases, including exception handling and establishing recovery pathways.
Provide regular executive-level reporting.
QUALIFICATIONS:
10+ years of experience in content production, with roles in production/post, technology, and workflow optimization at a production service vendor, studio or network.
A proven ability to lead teams despite reporting lines.
Deep knowledge and experience of the content creation process, on set production and post production services and workflows.
Repeated success creating cross-functional workflow and processes that create visibility for multiple POV’s.
An excellent communicator who is highly diplomatic in stressful and complex situations; able to generate highly effective decks, documents, spreadsheets, or in-person presentations as a way of inspiring alignment and managing change.
An innovator and strategic thinker who has a real passion for production and innovation.
Curious about collecting data to help set business goals and best practices.
Demonstrated success with engineering teams in scoping and developing solutions for a broad and diverse user base.
Functional knowledge and understanding of how data is gathered and leveraged across the production lifecycle to inform decision making. 
Ability to manage and operate in ambiguous situations and think on your feet to solve challenges and problems
Strong communication skills with proven ability to socialize, explain and “sell” new and complex technical strategies, practices and workflows
Proven track record of innovation, taking initiative, ideation and implementation
Experience and understanding of requirement documentation, scoping and implementation of custom software development
Proven ability to embrace, drive and enable change management
Experience working with diverse teams across multiple functions, skills and locations
Strong organizational skills with proactive mentality, positive orientation and outlook
Ability to respond after hours for important, timely, or urgent matters
Team-player who thrives in a fast paced, team-oriented setting
Passionate about our culture and values in the workplace
Willingness to travel

ADDITIONAL CRITERIA TO BE CONSIDERED:
Has a multi-faceted background in production technologies and workflows, software development, and data structures is ideal
Must be comfortable operating within a matrixed organization, but possess the strategic and tactical acumen to navigate through ambiguity and partner with the right stakeholders to execute projects successfully.
Adaptable management / leadership philosophy
Willingness to embrace and drive technical innovation and disruption in production space

Location: Hybrid (California remote with required travel)
Team: Content & Business Products / XD

Netflix is the world’s leading streaming entertainment service with over 230 million paid memberships in over 190 countries enjoying series, documentaries and feature films across a wide variety of genres and languages.  As our slate of original productions and licensed content continues to grow, we must scale the technology solutions we use to manage content and operational data to meet the changing needs of the business.  

The Content & Business Products team builds a suite of tools to scale the operations behind taking a Netflix show from concept to streaming.  We are looking for an experienced design leader to manage the teams responsible for the critical applications that help us create and deliver entertainment to the world.  

In this role, you'll collaborate closely with several cross-functional leaders while managing a talented and diverse remote design team. You’ll help your teams design and build applications that help Netflix localize our content, scale our marketing capabilities, ensure flawless global delivery of our titles to members, and much more. These critical B2B applications are used by both internal and external users, so experience with (and passion for) working on enterprise applications is essential.

This role can be based in our Los Angeles or Los Gatos offices. There is also the option to be based remotely from the West Coast/PST working hours. Expect to travel monthly to meet with your teams, stakeholders, and partners.

KEY RESPONSIBILITIES

• Collaborate closely with your Product, Engineering, Data Science, and Operations leadership partners to plan and execute our product roadmaps.
• Develop and nurture relationships with our global stakeholders, learn the nuances of their workflows, and ensure your team is designing and shipping impactful and cohesive product experiences that meet our stakeholders’ needs.
• Balance being a passionate advocate for our users while pushing your teams towards efficient operational excellence.
• Manage and coach your design leadership team by helping them navigate the complexity and ambiguity of our business areas.
• Keep your teams inspired and engaged by providing clear direction that looks towards the future while creating actionable steps that are impactful today.

SKILLS, CHARACTERISTICS, AND QUALIFICATIONS

• 7+ years of experience successfully leading and scaling high-performance design teams, including ICs and people managers.
• Demonstrated passion for B2B2C / Enterprise related user problems and a successful track record of shipping impactful products at a global scale.
• Experience collaborating closely with cross-functional stakeholders, helping drive alignment between design and your cross-functional partners, and building strong relationships across business areas.
• Comfortable working with ambiguity - able to bring rigorous design thinking and operational structure to complex and evolving problem spaces.
• Exceptional communication skills, in writing and verbally, whether in small group discussions, large-scale presentations, or with executives.
• Ability to inspire, lead, and engage your design teams, leaning in and giving them critical business context, feedback, and direction.
• Bring a balanced perspective and thoughtful decision-making to strategic discussions, advocating for both user-centricity and the needs of the business with your teams and your peers.

BONUS

• Experience working in the entertainment industry and a deep understanding of existing creative production and marketing technology workflows.
• Passion for storytelling and filmmaking.
• Courage when asked to join team karaoke 🎤😜

PAY TRANSPARENCY

Our compensation structure consists solely of an annual salary; we do not have bonuses. You choose each year how much of your compensation you want in salary versus stock options. To determine your personal top-of-market compensation, we rely on market indicators and consider your specific job family, background, skills, and experience to determine your compensation in the market range. The range for this role is $290,000 - $1,900,000.

Netflix Open Connect is one of the largest Content Delivery Networks in the world that delivers double digit percentage share of internet traffic. We are responsible for providing hundreds of millions of Netflix subscribers with the highest quality viewing experience possible. In addition to streaming video, we work on projects within Netflix that leverage physical infrastructure, such as our Cloud Games initiative.

We are looking for a Director to lead the engineering team responsible for development of our content delivery system, which handles delivery of our VOD content, live streams, ads, and static assets. Additionally, the team is responsible for our Smart DNS service and contributes to development of our Cloud Games infrastructure. The content delivery system is composed of application layer code that runs on tens of thousands of Open Connect Appliances and control plane services that run in our AWS Cloud.
Responsibilities
Lead architecture and development of the Open Connect CDN system
Help us enhance and scale our live streaming capabilities
Continue improving our system to be more efficient, reliable, secure, and manageable
Refine our approach to running multiple CDN services on shared infrastructure
Create incremental business value by helping identify, evaluate, architect, and implement additional ways to leverage our edge servers
Nurture and expand a high performance, healthy engineering organization
Drive and contribute to collaborative projects across engineering and other functions
Requirements
Experience leading teams responsible for architecture and development of large scale, highly efficient, reliable, and manageable content delivery systems
Experience building systems that provide low latency delivery of large scale live events
Thorough technical understanding of internet architecture, video streaming, and related topics 
High comfort with technical complexity and ambiguity, and an interest to pioneer
Exceptional communication, cross-discipline collaboration, and leadership skills
Passion for excellence and getting things done
Things that show what we work on and how we think
FreeBSD optimization used by Netflix to serve 800 Gb/s from a single server
Distributing Content to Open Connect

Netflix is one of the world's leading entertainment services with over 247 million paid memberships in over 190 countries enjoying TV series, films and games across a wide variety of genres and languages. Members can play, pause, and resume watching as much as they want, anytime, anywhere, and can change their plans at any time. We are looking for a Product leader to join a newly established Merchandising team. 
 The Technical Merchandising team members are the guardians of our merchandising capabilities. They are responsible for having a deep understanding of our product and merchandising techniques, how they work, and how we develop and optimize them over time to scale and support our business. We expect this team to work in close partnership with Product Management and require technical depth and expertise. You should be comfortable at the hub of a fast-paced innovative environment. This is an opportunity to build a team and their output from the ground up.
In this role, you will:
Be responsible for ensuring that our merchandising techniques (and related technical approach) are aligned with consumer expectations, developing turn-key merchandising capabilities, and establishing efficient and effective execution for merchandising programs 
Build and lead a team of Technical Merchandisers and Merchandising Operations, based in the U.S. 
Set the vision for the team, define annual objectives, key results and roadmaps 
Be accountable for your team achieving key results and setting up the appropriate recurring review processes to ensure your team is on track 
Ensure obstacles to launching key projects are addressed for your team. You will elevate opportunities and challenges with solutions to improve efficient and effective output, as needed  
Work closely as ‘one team’ with your Merchandising peers and build strong partnerships across Consumer and Studio Product Management, including leadership
Be responsible for your team's development and growth 
Be willing to roll up your sleeves and lead and execute on key projects 
Team Responsibiltiies:
Lead the vision and requirements for merchandising configurations and capabilities - working across Consumer and Studio Product management to integrate merchandising requirements into overall core roadmaps and partner on their development.
Once vision and requirements are developed, work with Performance managers to integrate experimentation frameworks and performance evaluation. Ensure broader team adopts the capabilities and deeply understands the requirements to utilize. 
Own and champion merchandising guidelines and principles and when/how merchandising modules are used. Your team will be responsible for ensuring that the guidelines and principles are maintained. 
Understand the technical capabilities and limitations of our product and use this knowledge to determine how we best support business needs. Be a central point of contact for all tasks related to merchandising capabilities.  
Have a deep understanding of personalization as it relates to content recommendations and merchandising and their intersection with consumer expectations. Your team will partner closely with Personalization teams on how to evolve relevant recommendation systems based on consumer needs and merchandising goals.
Be responsible for overall program prioritization, execution, and tracking - build the relevant processes and ensure adoption of them across Merchandising team 
Collaborate with a team of stunning colleagues across product management, consumer insights, data science to develop great merchandising experiences
Qualifications:
10+ years of experience in merchandising development and operations within an app - either in product or in a support function; must have people management experience and ideally built out a similar team from its foundation
Required to grasp technical concepts quickly - including how products ‘work’ (technical stack), how to innovate and develop new opportunities 
Must have experience in developing scaled merchandising modules for products
Experience in merchandising performance management a plus
Experience in understanding recommendation systems a plus 
Experience in developing self-service tooling a plus 
Strategic, analytical thinker with a strong customer-focused mindset
Must have experience directly managing a team 
Excellent written (memos and presentations) and verbal communication skills; timely communication
Highly motivated self-starter with the ability to work independently and drive alignment amid ambiguity
Ability to build strong relationships with stakeholders and effectively influence and contribute with concrete recommendations/next steps, across both regional and global teams
Comfortable applying a combination of qualitative and quantitative methods to define success
Insatiable curiosity to learn new domains, keep up with industry innovation, and constantly ask ‘why’

We’re looking for a talented and seasoned Creative Director to guide story, character development, and world foundations for our game’s IP – breathing heart, rich texture, and novel depth into our world and the characters that inhabit it. 

We’re a team with big ambitions and an obsession to create memorable game moments that leave players telling their own stories for years to come. We seek new teammates who care deeply about the experiences they create and the people they make them with, who bias towards action and are energized by the learning that comes with bold experimentation at an agile pace.

As a part of Netflix, we strive to hire the best and value integrity, excellence, respect, inclusion, and collaboration.  Now is an amazing time to join Netflix as we seek to entertain the world. We have over 230 million paid members in over 190 countries, and we won’t stop there. If this sounds like you, we would love to hear from you!
Responsibilities Include
Fully own the process of developing our game’s IP, working with Art and Game Design leadership to develop the settings, characters, themes, and multi-season story arcs within that world
Leverage a deep understanding of both narrative and game design needs to weave the IP, world, and story into a cohesive whole together
Shepherd a shared vision around our key aspirational character and teamplay core fantasies, acting as the torchbearer for how our project will intentionally deliver on them
Own communication around the IP, which includes developing and refining key artifacts that help communicate our vision to teammates, stakeholders, and partners
Promote an inclusive and diverse culture within our team, and let this ethos guide the stories we tell and the worlds we create
Participate actively in team playtesting and provide feedback
The Ideal Candidate
Has significant experience (10+ years) in:
-Game creative direction, across multiple IPs and/or projects
-Managing and guiding writers and other creative team members
-Developing partnerships with internal departments and external agencies
-Bonus points if you have worked across multiple media (games, shows, film, books, comics, marketing, etc.).
Possesses a deep understanding of IP world-building and narrative design
Communicates with authenticity, intention, and curiosity
Thrives as a member of a cross-functional multidisciplinary team
Excels in online collaboration with a remote team
Plays broadly across multiple games of varied genres
Gets excited by learning new skills, dashing to pitch in, even if this means flexing beyond this role’s core responsibilities if it can help us win

Now is an amazing time to join Netflix as we seek to entertain the world. We have over 200 million paid members in over 190 countries, and we won’t stop there. We’re now looking for a Director of Ratings and Partnerships.
 With a catalogue of thousands of titles, great discovery and choosing experiences are central to Netflix, and reliable content ratings are crucial to helping members make the decisions about the titles that are right for them and their families. To deliver this, our Ratings & Partnerships team takes the lead on ensuring we have accurately rated every title on service, in every market we serve around the world. 
 In this role, you’ll be leading the team responsible both for the operational excellence that ensures every title is accurately rated to exacting global and national standards, and for the strategic partnerships that help us stay ahead of an ever-changing world of government policies, content standards and member expectations, all as we navigate a new, broader world of entertainment from Netflix that includes games, live content and more.
You will:
Lead our teams of ratings experts and partnerships managers.
Be accountable for how we rate content – ensuring an accurate rating for every title, in every market around the world.
Set the vision for the department, define performance standards, annual objectives, key results and roadmaps
Be accountable for your teams maintaining performance standards, achieving key results and setting up the appropriate recurring review processes to ensure they are on track in a fast-paced operationally critical environment.
Manage day-to-day partnerships across the business, creating and facilitating working relationships across Content Analysis, Content, Public Policy, local leadership teams, and Product. You will work with leadership at all levels across the business and must fluidly communicate between organisations 
Work with technology, operations and innovation leaders to drive progress in how we rate titles at scale, including the use of emerging technologies to classify at scale
Ensure obstacles to launching and supporting key projects are addressed for your team. You will elevate opportunities and challenges with solutions to improve efficient and effective output, as needed  
Be responsible for the development and growth of your teams and their leaders
Qualifications
7+ years of experience in a field encompassing any of content rating, regulated content classification, media policy or similar.
Must have experience directly managing large teams
Deep understanding of the media regulation landscape and understanding how it intersects with product innovation and member-focused discovery
Should have experience in running globally distributed and remote-first teams 
Strategic, analytical thinker with a strong customer-focused mindset and empathy
Excellent written (memos and presentations) and verbal communication skills; timely communication
Highly motivated self-starter with the ability to work independently and drive alignment amid ambiguity
Ability to build strong relationships with stakeholders and effectively influence and contribute with concrete recommendations/next steps, across both regional and global teams
Comfortable applying a combination of qualitative and quantitative methods to define success
Insatiable curiosity to learn new domains, keep up with industry innovation, and constantly ask ‘why’

SLSQ125R45
Partner Alliance Senior Director, Accenture
The Consulting & Systems Integrator (C&SI) team accelerates Databricks' growth by building and managing relationships with the leading data technology services companies.
In this role, as our Accenture Partner Alliance Director, you will be part of a team responsible for driving a high performing partnership focused on the strategic go-to market motions with Accenture. You will lead this partnership regionally  and implement a cohesive strategy to grow an iconic partnership focused on expanding mindshare, growing revenue, scaling Accenture's Data & Analytics practice and driving joint innovation.
You will report to the Regional Vice President of Accenture Global Partnership.
  The impact you will have: 
    You will expand and develop a partnership focused on delivering predictable and recurring growth within a mutually defined plan
    You will help accelerate Databricks' and the partner's adoption within new opportunities and use case expansion
    You will develop a training strategy resulting in practice growth and knowledge expansion
    You will secure investment and establish programs around repeatable IP and solution investments, resulting in essential go-to market plans
    You will launch go to market events and mindshare activities that promote joint customer adoption and new logos
What we look for:
    10+ years experience in securing and supporting partnerships at global scale
    In-depth understanding of alliance/partner organization, key stakeholders, overall strategy, company culture, market offering and joint value proposition.
    Deep domain experience in enterprise infrastructure, cloud and analytics space
    Global SI partner management experience spanning AMER, EMEA or APAC
    Experience working with direct sales organizations  in hyper growth technology companies
    Experience working and building unique channel relationships and complex contract negotiations
    Experience working in a high growth, entrepreneurial organization that has seen scale from $500M-$2B

Databricks is looking for a Director -Corporate Engineering, IT, reporting to the VP, of Infrastructure and Operations.  
In this influential role, you will be responsible for:
Cloud Infrastructure Management:
Develop and implement a strategic roadmap for the company's cloud infrastructure ensuring the stability, scalability, and security of technology platforms and environments. Spearhead the establishment and enforcement of standards and automation for Infrastructure Provisioning, DevOps and SRE services, and integration with other SaaS services.
Create a strategy with a coherent plan to build out your center of excellence teams, focusing on developer velocity, end2end quality, end2end security, Infra-as-code, GitOps, KPIs measurement, etc
Take ownership of Infrastructure compliance requirements, including but not limited to SOX, PCI DSS, FedRAMP, and other relevant regulatory frameworks.
Conduct regular risk assessments with Security teams to identify areas of non-compliance and implement mitigation strategies to address identified risks.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to ensure understanding and alignment with compliance requirements. Work closely with Security, legal, and other departments to implement necessary controls.
Lead operational support for Tier 3 IT services, ensuring alignment with business needs and regulatory compliance. Drive production incident management, coordinate and drive debugging production issues.
Develop and manage cloud budgets, including vendor management and cost optimization initiatives.
Manage internal productivity, & workplace products such as Gmail, Atlassian, Moveworks, Glean, Slack, GitHub etc to provide an exceptional employee experience.  
Lead a cross-functional team to shape the vision and strategy for a suite of Collaboration tools. with a focus on employee needs and market trends, drive efficient product adoption, and, oversee the entire product lifecycle fostering strong relationships with stakeholders. 
Qualifications and Experience:
7 years of experience managing Cloud infrastructure at large enterprises. Extensive experience managing public cloud implementations in AWS. Experience with GCP and Azure will be a plus. 
In-Depth understanding of Cloud native technologies to lead and guide the team. Must have hands-on experience in troubleshooting and debugging issues in production environments
Working experience in managing DevOps/SRE practices OKRs (Objective and Key Results), Agile development, Infra-as-code, SRE (Site Reliability Engineering), DevOps measurement such as DORA KPIs, 
In-depth understanding of each collaboration tool's features, functionalities, and configurations (e.g., Gmail for email, Slack for messaging). Ability to identify and integrate and optimize the use of various tools for seamless collaboration (e.g., connecting Jira with GitHub for Dev metrics).
Experience leading a team of senior professionals working asynchronously in a remote, distributed team. Strong communication skills, with clear verbal communication and written communication skills.
 Collaborative style: partners well with cross-functional teams to solve hard problems and to complete complex deliverables with quality and business outcomes.
Provide mentorship and guidance to team members to ensure that their skills and knowledge are kept up-to-date

Databricks is seeking a Strategy and Execution Director to operationalize the Databricks corporate strategy by leading the design, implementation and optimization of processes, and engagement models. In this role, you will drive cross functional alignment to scale the business for continued hyper-growth. Successful candidates for the role will possess both a strategic business outlook, ability to design processes to scale and the keen analytical skills to be able to look at the data into the details and requirements of various strategic initiatives, while understanding the bigger picture and business objectives. We are building a team that is more interested in getting it right than being right. We care more about winning the game than who scored the points.
This role will report into the AVP, Strategy and Execution within the central Corporate Operations function.
Impact You’ll Have
Identifies opportunity areas and drives cross-functional outcomes to grow and scale Databricks 
Design E2E scalable solutions, weaving together process design, operating model definition, automation, and/or AI levers to optimize your answer.
Measure quantifiable impact of the outcomes implemented and create well defined KPIs to ensure successful execution of transformations and sustainable improvement. 
Own operationalizing and delivering on the business outcome in conjunction with cross functional business partners, while driving alignment with senior leadership 
Enable a tailored approach to meet the customer / business needs by adjusting behavior and outcomes based on the dynamics of the team, stakeholder, and program situation(s)

Advanced research and analysis skills that you can flex to address a complex problem and/or situation
Demonstrate an advanced ability to define and break down ambiguous and complex business problems
Communicate complex ideas with authority, influencing stakeholders including Databricks executives and department leadership.
Experience in the enterprise software industry, SaaS and B2B experience preferred.
Comfortable and thrive in a rapidly scaling and dynamic startup environment

Databricks is looking for a Career Programs Director to join our growing global Talent Management team. You will report to the Head of Talent Management in our People team and will own the strategy and build of our Career processes and programs that ensure that we support and grow our Bricksters as we scale. Our mission is to build a world class People function that is uniquely suited for Databricks, built for scale, and empowers our global Brickster team to do the best work of their careers.
The impact you will have:
Build and align all career programs to ensure they are integrated with our strategic people team agenda 
Lead the overall design and implementation of our strategy for careers at Databricks - including roadmap, stakeholder engagement, and technology ecosystem 
Manage and design the career architecture transformation program, including job leveling, our approach for skills and competencies across all functions and levels, and the use of AI in the system to ensure it stays relevant as we scale 
Manage the career enablement play, including training and toolkits to help managers and Bricksters have powerful career conversations 
Partner with our People Partners to ensure the strategy and roll out meets the needs of the different functions and geographies
What we look for:
12+ years experience building and scaling career and job architecture programs, globally from design and architecture through to operationally delivering 
Deep subject knowledge on careers in growth companies, how people move, advance and progress in a scaling environment 
Worked in large enterprise companies and smaller early stage growth companies and has a balance of strategy and hands-on execution experience
Has experience delivering impactful results in complex, high-demand settings
Partner management skills; you pride yourself on building relationships and broad organizational influence
Business acumen, data analysis skills and an understanding of how talent systems and strategies create business impact
Change leadership, able to break through the noise in a business, to pivot when needed and to stay focused on the most important goals

Job Title: VP, Enterprise- Healthcare and Life Sciences
Description:
About the Team
The Healthcare and Life Sciences sales team is responsible for aggressively growing top-line revenues and driving new business through the implementation of scalable, repeatable, structured systems/processes and embracing the operational challenges of leading a high-growth business at a significant scale through its next stage of growth.
Mission
Databricks is seeking a seasoned and transformational Vice President, Healthcare and Life Sciences to serve as a key member of our regulated industries leadership team who will continue to scale our world-class sales organization to drive rapid growth within the HLS vertical, which is critical to our continued success. Achieving Databricks mission and vision requires working together to create a culture that supports their hunger to be the best. To be effective in this role, the successful leader will be responsible for driving the below:
Vision
Understand the direction Databricks is going and the criticality of their respective functions, organizations and teams to achieve that outcome.  Can translate that vision into a purposeful mission for their team. Constructs actionable plans for the team to execute and carry out its mission. Communicates and unifies the team behind its mission and plan
Strategy
Create a framework for the entire team to follow and clearly communicate the direction they are going in alignment with the company’s overall strategy by igniting the passion and motivation inside other people and leading them to do extraordinary things.
Execution
Consistently deliver great results at a rapid (but sustainable) pace.  Along with setting an inspiring and clear vision and defining their strategy; effective execution is critical to the success of the team and company. To execute well, a leader at Databricks needs to be able to deliver extraordinary outcomes.  
Teamwork
Talent magnet who can build and lead teams to achieve significantly more as a collective unit than they could achieve individually.  We can overcome our biggest obstacles if we have a team that shares a common goal and works together to achieve it. A team that works together excels and they have a strong sense of purpose, know their roles, and understand precisely how to operate efficiently together.
What You’ll Do
Lead and hire top talent within our HLS vertical. Execute revenue goals, and develop leaders within each region, while implementing a strong sales methodology and working complex strategic sales cycles.
Deliver regular and accurate forecasts and ensure monthly, quarterly, and annual targets are achieved.
Drive executive relationships at the CxO level, and successfully support large complex sales cycles in the HLS space.
Create and drive strategic go-to-market plans to meet company growth and market share goals. Position the company to continue to successfully compete with the largest players in the HLS industry.
Engage and develop senior CxO clients/prospects within the HLS space to establish, drive, and grow strategic relationships.
Act as a strategic thought leader and advisor to the SVP, Regulated Industries, and broader Executive Team. Work closely with other executives across the organization to establish and develop a strong and collaborative partnership to ensure success.
Maintain strong reporting and accountability against numbers, driving to exceed quotas, while developing and managing motivating incentive tools.
Be an exceptional leader and change agent. This executive will collaborate across the organization and help bring disparate teams together into a more cohesive unit.
Competencies:
Team First Culture
Focuses on what’s best for the company long term. Ability to easily work across functions as ‘one team’ that is in it together and aligned on key goals for the company. Determines true ways to grow revenue and build capacity for future growth with a crucial long-term perspective in mind.
Healthcare and Life Sciences Space
Comprehensive understanding of the HLS space including issues, market trends, and sales cycles.  Will also understand how leveraging data and AI technology can be utilized to solve complex healthcare business challenges.
Operational Excellence
Experience implementing complex strategy and operational improvements. Takes a data-driven and efficiency-oriented approach to sales operations. Measurable success in improving sales enablement, hiring practices, productivity, sales strategy, and program function.
Enterprise Software - Sales Leadership
Demonstrated success in leading software sales organizations and working across highly complex, truly global businesses. Has managed as a 3rd line leader, in high-performing sales organizations
Modern SaaS
Experience within a cloud-native, disruptive software business with proven leadership of a modern, recurring revenue go-to-market motion.
